description:
You can order food from Foreign Cinema to this bar!

I ordered a bloody mary and it was perfection. I was surprised because when I actually sat down at Foreign Cinema and ordered a bloody mary, I was super disappointed. 

So I guess moral of the story, get your bloody from this bar  and order another one from them before you head over to the restaurant.
author: Alana Z.

description:
Surprised about this place. If you go to the Mission, you know that place is crazy/busy.

As soon as you walk into this bar, you feel like you're not even in the Mission. This place is classy!

I was here one evening promoting an event, and bartenders are pretty cool. They serve homemade chips from next-door's restaurant, and popcorn. Nice snack while drinking. 

They have an upstairs, with nice space too. 

They have booths, and tables/bar stools.

If you ask me, this is the type of bar I would hang out at, especially the size of it is pretty decent. Not too big, not too small.
author: Jocelyn C.

description:
Best part of Laszlo is that they offer the menu from foreign cinema without the wait! Perfect if you are a couple or a small group. Groups bigger than 4 might find it tough to eat dinner as the tables are small. 

Drinks are good. Service is okZ
author: Stephanie C.

description: One of my favorite finds in the city. I remember how excited I was to walk in and find out they serve the same food as Foreign Cinema. I've eaten at Foreign Cinema and really enjoyed the food but getting a reservation can be tricky. Now I can just pop in Laszlo and enjoy my favorites there. Not to mention the cocktails are delicious. Bartenders and servers are friendly. There is also a movie playing in the bar. Nice touch!
author: Ashley G.

description:
We had dinner close by and decided to check out Laszlo afterwards. My group of four stopped by on Friday, December 15th around 11:15pm. We started by ordering drinks at the bar. We moved upstairs after we got our drinks and found a table in the corner by the window. It wasn't too busy this night, so not hard to find seating.

*Selena por vida: tapatio tequila, fresh orange juice, aperol fresh lime, jalapeno, basil, spiced rum ($12)
*It's a wonderful life: rittenhouse rye, fleur de sel fresh lemon, small hands passionfruit syrup ($12) x2
*Pink flamingoes: lo-fi gentian amaro, fresh grapefruit juice, served with seltzer, fresh herbs & citrus ($12)

I got the rye cocktail which ended up being a bit too sweet for me. (They only had four cocktails on the menu and this was the only one with dark.) I tried the other two and they were a little more refreshing. Especially the pink flamingo. I'm not big on tequila, but the jalapeno in the Selena gave it a good kick.

Nice stop for one drink. I just wish their cocktail menu was bigger. Apparently they have slushees which always appeals to the kid in me. And happy hour Monday to Thursday, 4pm to 6pm with $7 cocktails. I may be back just to try that.
author: Elena N.

description: Let's start with the good - decent service, nice bar. Onto the disappointment- Ordered a bunch of cocktails on a Saturday but all the cocktails were poorly made. Got 4 different cocktails made of whiskey, gin, rum and tequila. All were "eh". The whiskey one was sooo sweet and the gin one was too sour. And on top of that they were $13 each! What a rip off! Don't waste your money or time here.
author: Nandita B.

description:
Great place for day drinking. Strolling along Mission District to see what it's about I found this place. Drinks are delicious! 
I, of course, had to order "Selena Por Vida" which is an incredible tasting drink! 
I was there on a Sunday afternoon and it wasn't crowded. Really nice place to just chill. They have outdoor seating, which is nice to people watch as you drink and appreciate this interesting neighborhood. It totally reminded of LA, in Echo Park and LA Arts District area. 
I can't say much about food, or the night scene because I just came by for one drink since I was bar hopping. 
It was nice to see a drink named after Selena. I would order it again and again. I really enjoyed chilling here.
author: Melissa S.

description:
After having dinner at Lolinda a few doors down, our party ended up here for a toot, or so I thought...

ATMOSPHERE:
The tight quarters make up the small bar that is connected and related to the Foreign Cinema restaurant.  The first level sports bar and high top seating, with a few more tables on a loft above.  A DJ was spinning a mix of genres while a muted 80's movie was being projected on the bar's wall.  Conversation level was manageable. 

MENU:
Full bar, no food. 

BEVERAGE:
T.W. Pitchers' Radler - $7.  I took my chances on this which was a sweet grapefruit/blood orange-flavored beer.  Meh. 

Tecate - $3.  Having had this in Puerto Vallarta, I stuck to this light but still good budget brew.  No hangover the next day. 

SERVICE:
Joyce was the friendly and fast bartender on duty. 

OVERALL:
Nice watering hole, fair pricing.  We finally called it a night three rounds later!
author: Vince N.

description:
Fun place and good drinks. Feels like an extension of the Foreign Cinema (they use their same system) and they were playing "To Wong Foo Thanks for Everything, Julie Newmar" in the background. Super appropriate for Pride Weekend, thumbs up on that @Laszlo.

We had a great time and even found a table. We were pretty surprised to find a spot on a Saturday night, but weren't gonna question it - You should give it a try after dinner, it was a cool spot for a night cap.
author: Charo F.

description:
I was on the wagon so no cocktails for this gal, but I can say that both my companions raved about the black Manhattan. 

4 stars for the free flowing awesome popcorn and delish chips!
author: Tara C.

description:
We came here since we were waiting for a table at foreign cinema.  Theres seating upstairs which is great because the bar gets full quickly.  

I ordered a rum passionfruit cocktail and tried some of the flamingo. The rum passionfruit cocktail was delicious!!! Super sweet and fruity. They have the most fuking amazing chips here. They are delicious,  and have some kind of egg white powder on top. 

Im coming here again just for the chips.
author: Tiffany Y.

description:
Came here on a late Saturday night. I ordered two drinks and I paid around $17 for both and tipped $2 for a total of $19. I ended up getting charged $49 on my credit card. 

Don't come here, they over added the tip and tipped themselves...SHADY AF.
author: Karen K.

description: Great place to chill.  It's right next to El Techo and Foreign Cinema so perfect after eating.  A little dark, but music is cool.  Drinks are great.  Vibe is chill.  Love coming here.
author: KB B.

description: I went there to grab some drinks. The place is definitely nicer than the other bars in the mission and the drinks are good too. The overall atmosphere isn't the kind that will keep you there. We got bored after the first drink and left.
author: Haya D.

description: Leave it to a transplant with sharpie eyebrows to ruin the mission. The rude bartender ignored us for 25 minutes and would not take our order. She instead kept socializing, rolling her eyes and outwardly talking crap about customers. Unbelievable service. If I wanted to be treated like trash by a white person id have gone to Zeitgeist
author: Julie G.

description:
Great place to come on Sundays after a nite of partying and grab a bloody or 2 to recuperate. Great food (burger!!), cocktails, music, DJ's and awesome bartenders make this place MUST on a chill weekend afternoon. 

p.s. Free doughnuts every Sunday too!!! sweet!!!
author: Michael B.

description: First time here this past Saturday. Nice place with good drinks and fantastic service from a bartender named Joyce! She was fun and full of life. There was another server there with brown hair ( I didn't catch her name) who was miserable as hell. No personality to the point of just plain rude. This girl can learn a lot from Joyce!
author: This Is M E.

description:
Babe cave Every Sunday!!!
Donuts,  bacon and bloody Marie's! 

Music and a free raffle from Dj don't tell mom! 
They also serve the full menu from foreign cinema and access to their entire wine list! 
Beautiful and delicious craft cocktails!
author: Bryan A O.

description: Run down pretentious dump. Horrid service. Asked what nonalcoholic drinks they could do. The bartender snidely said "water." I'd been there before and had some sort of great nonalcoholic concoction. She didn't care, didn't want to care.
author: Ryan B.

description: TBH this place is overpriced. I had one drink and left. While the drink was good, it was expensive for the neighborhood. I get the idea they are going for, but not in this neighborhood. I ordered the queen as a drink, it was good but not worth the price.
author: Sandeep C.

description: I had higher expectations. Dropped by here after dinner and it was pretty dead for a Friday night. 10ish. The bouncer was witty and that was the highlight of the experience. Grabbed a seat in the front, unfortunately the bartender got my drinks wrong and I didn't have a beer for a good 15 minutes. The music wasn't anything special. Decor wasn't anything spectacular. Maybe we were here too early. I was yawning and ready to go in no time at all. Left around 11. Maybe you have to get here way later to have some fun.
author: Cristina P.

description:
If you're looking to eat Foreign Cinema food without the wait - GO HERE!
If you're looking for craft cocktails AND Foreign Cinema food without the wait - GO HERE!

Laszlo has just undergone a remodel - get cozy in the new booths upstairs or enjoy the downstairs and watch the vinyl DJ play. 

Yes, there are some new bartenders but the old homies are still around too! 

Perks: 
A movie plays on the wall, just like nextdoor! 
Healthy mix of guest DJ's/Genre's
Geniusly handcrafted cocktails + brunch (Weekends only)
author: Shannon M.

description:
Pros: 
The female bartender (sorry, don't know her name) for creating a special birthday smoothie for me because I was recovering from surgery and couldn't have alcohol. She was so nice to my friends all night! 

The upstairs lounge area where you can fit a decent-sized group. 

The manageable noise level, we could actually talk to each other. 

Cons: 
The cold and mysterious wind that was blowing from some hidden AC vent. In December we don't need AC. Brrrr
author: Tonie C.

description:
Lights turned down, and you hear the sound of B-3...B-3 someone yells Bingo! That's right, I was here with some work buds for Drag Queen Bingo.. It was a blast and the bar was popping! 
Our crew stationed themselves upstairs over looking the rest of the bar. 
The bingo was fun, and yes I did not win, and started to not care about winning after a few drinks and a few losing cards. 
The bartenders were great, and hard working and it never took too long to get a drink. The place is pretty low key and no one seemed to be acting cooler then anyone else.. Which I dug and I could see myself coming back. 
The drag queen was really fun and a lovely host to the evening.. I had a few high lifes and called it a night! A fun night that was!
author: Patrick T.

description: Great place for after work drink or grabbing chill drink date with de table snacks and food. Great way to get Foreign Cinema menu in a more relaxed environment.
author: Amisha G.

description: A little pricey, and not a great experience. Four of us came in the early evening and ordered two cheese plates but they took what felt like forever to come out. We also asked for waters and the bartender directed us to the back water station. When we saw that other people had small water pitchers for the table, we asked for one (there were several on the bar, not in use) and got directed to the back water station again!
author: Alaina P.

description: Jack was a good server but they served the charcuterie with only two pieces of bread. Took another 25 min to get extra bread while the plate just sat there. Pretty annoying. Cocktail was ok.
author: Matt C.

description: Their Tecate is some of the best in the city.  Good place for a friend date.  Sometimes on Thursdays there's a really cute DJ with mullety hair.  Her music is kind of spooky, electronic, and eclectic to the vibe of the bar, but her stylish looks and emotionally enveloping red lipstick will likely distract you from all of that.  Also the limes that are served with their drinks are above average in size.
author: Peter L.

description:
Had a really bad experience at Lazlo. After sitting at the bar for 15 minutes without being acknowledged and finally getting the attention of the bar tender, I ordered a Bloody Mary. They were out of their house pickles so without acknowledgement replaced them with olives, would have been nice to give the heads-up. On top of that the Bloody Mary is suppose to come with a top shelf liquor but instead the bar tender used Seagrams vodka. Not that I could taste the difference but definitely a principle issue.

I got the check and asked the bartender to swap the price for a well drink since he used well vodka which he did, saving me a grand total of $1. I've been to Lazlo a bunch of times but am reluctant to go back. Hopefully they get a bit more courteous and most importantly truthful about their drinks. Although probably wouldn't be able to taste the difference the principle is there when paying $12+ for a cocktail.
author: Brad R.

description: Walked into Laszlo after dinner with friends on a Sunday night. Looking in from the street it looks small but once you walk in you realize there's a stair leading to more seating upstairs (cozy seating by the way). I like the vibe there, it's chill and inviting; not at all pretentious. The bartenders were really nice and acknowledged you as soon as you sat down. I forgot what my cocktail was called but i do know it was with mezcal and sea salt (super good if you like refreshing yet slightly smoky drinks). My friends had some beers (tecate & west coast IPA) and my fiancé had the dickel pickle (whiskey shot with pickleback for chase)They were playing really cool but different music and an old movie that was being projected on the wall. Now I know where to go to whenever I'm in the mission area.
author: Cristal F.

description:
AJ was really really rude to myself and a friend. Oh and the chubby brunette lady bartender was pretentious and rude as well.

They must be related to the manager or something to still be working there because I'm surprised people like them can keep a job with the hostility my friends and I have experienced from these people.  

 We left after the first 5 minutes of walking in. Never ever going back.
author: Michele K.

description:
The bartenders are terrible. There is nothing worse than being serviced by someone who seems as if you're inconveniencing them. The guy with the ridiculous man bun is unprofessional anytime the other bartender asked him to do anything he would do the most dramatic eye roll. Also he only wants to service single women so expect to wait a lifetime for him. The other bartender didn't have the greatest attitude either but maybe because she was doing a majority of the work. 

On the upside the atmosphere is nice and they play an eclectic variety of music.
author: Nicolette P.

description:
We came for drag queen bingo. If you've never been, it's very aptly named: a drag queen is calling bingo. 

And it's fun. Especially if you bring a large crowd of your closest friends/co-workers and drink all the rosé they have in the house. Laszlo also has efficient bartenders, strong cocktails, plenty of beer, and a low-key vibe that's good for a quiet drink or a rowdy, drag queen bingo evening.

I imagine it's less fun if you're sitting in the bar with your laptop, quietly playing bingo, and a large crowd of obnoxious co-workers invades the bar and drinks abnormal amounts of rosé in your personal space. 

But that guy chose to come to drag queen bingo.
author: Peter D.

description:
Came here with coworkers for Drag Queen Bingo... see other reviews. We pretty much took over the upstairs section of the bar and joined in on the bingo bender. I love that they use the old school red-plastic-slide bingo cards instead of the paper and blotters. It makes it easy to jump in whenever you want and you don't feel committed to bingo for the rest of the evening. 

The staff was friendly and didn't seem bothered by our fairly large group busting in on bingo night. I had a few old fashioned's and they were great... otherwise I didn't really interact with the staff much... no complaints. Luckily, I was fortunate enough to win a round of bingo which resulted in the option to get a bottle of rosé to go or for here. I obviously cracked that bitch open and made it rain brosé on all my coworkers. All in all, it was a good night. Would do it again.
author: Scotty C.

description: Good happy hour deal in terms of price, and attentive/friendly bartender. Drinks, however, were pretty basic (e.g, whisky ginger, gin and tonic) and weak. The bar stools are also small and uncomfortable.
author: Hector S.

description: Love the name, the feel. It feels like going into a noir movie set. Or walking back into time in Casablanca.  No wonder the film club folks are meeting here. Great cocktails nice people good service. Makes me feel like being in a movie!
author: Xiu L.

description:
When I hang out with a certain group of friends we usually end up here at point or other. And this has been going on for years.

Service is really inconsistent - it's just a roll of the dice really. But I usually associate this place with a long wait for a drink.

The set up is pretty cool but I don't know what it is, I never really have fun here. There's been a few douchebag confrontations on my last few visits here. Maybe this place is becoming the tech-bro hub or something.
author: Art O.

description: $58 plus tip for 3 shots of DON JULIO people! I don't know how the hell lazlo justifies that price, but either way I'm not coming back. Sucks cause lazlos used to be cool.
author: Teresa B.

description:
Great vibe, well decorated, lots of seating space and food if you're hungry. Friendly bartenders. 

$17 for a grey goose martini is pretty steep in the mission. It was ok but I've had better.
author: Inga W.

description: Laszlo is a charming little spot right next door to foreign cinema restaurant, in the heart of the mission. The bartenders are killer and there has clearly been a lot of thought put into the menu in this establishment. Come try trivia on Monday nights or if you're looking something a little more hoppin, come through on thurs-sat nights to get down with their resident djs.
author: Paddy Og M.

description:
PROS:
They serve the same menu as Foreign Cinema. Same food, no wait (none between noon and 2pm on a Sunday). Free donuts up front.

CONS:
They pretty much cancel out not having a wait by having terribly slow service. They're set up to be a bar and don't seem to know how to handle having dining customers. We sat at a table where a big group had just finished brunch, but somehow the bartenders/servers didn't notice that we weren't the same people who'd been there earlier. They didn't clean off the table for 20-30 minutes because they thought we'd just finished our meal. Even after finally cleaning off the table (due to some prodding from me), they just didn't seem to want to serve us food. We waited maybe a total of 1 hour, and by that time Foreign Cinema texted us that a table was open.

Even when my boyfriend went up to the bar at one point to order drinks, he was ignored for a good 15 minutes. They weren't that crowded, but were either understaffed or very uncommunicative as a staff.

Here are the drinks we tried:

* Pample Pimms (Pimm's, Giffard Pamplemousse, grapefruit, ginger ale. $12) - 3.5 stars
Ginger ale was the dominant flavor. This was light and tasty, but I wished the grapefruit flavor was more prominent.

* Annapolis (Mt Gay XO, Babtiste, lime juice, grapefruit juice, honey syrup & seltzer. $12)
Light in flavor and refreshing; I wanted there to be more lime and grapefruit flavors.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Apparently, you can't sign your cards in any language other than English because that is how AMERICA works. Racism is something I never thought I'd witness at a business in SAN FRANCISCO. Well, Lazlo's has done it. 
In disbelief, I witnessed (along with 7 other people) a denial of entry by a bouncer because my friend was of Arabic descent. Unbelievable. It was my mistake for believing that being racially profiled would never happen in a city with a reputation that embraces people for who they are. We left and took our money elsewhere because all money should be good money. 
Well, perhaps the bouncer was having a bad day. Being a bouncer is not the best job and I understand that. However, having a shitty job or day does not warrant treating others awfully and for that reason, I'm never returning to Lazlos. I'm not one to expect good service, but I expect decent human treatment. Unfortunately being different never makes you safe, no matter what city you're in. As a SF native I guarantee you that there are better, more welcoming bars to choose from.
author: Stacey P.

description: First time in San Fran on vacation and this was the exact environment we were looking for. My friends and I are in our early 20s and didn't feel like fighting the crowds shoulder to shoulder at a club and accidentally stumbled upon Laszlo. The bouncer was a super cool guy and the drinks weren't expensive. My only complaint is they didn't have draft beer but they still sold craft in bottles. They're love DJ was decent and the music was loud but not loud enough you couldn't talk to each other. I will remember this place for next time!
author: Austin J.

description:
This was our last stop on a Sunday night. . . I say last b/c the power went out in the mission from here to 18th street.  It was pretty random.
As the alarms sounded so loudly, everyone was evacuating the bldg.  I didn't know what to do, plus the bartender was just finished making my drink I didn't want to leave it.

The bartender said we could bring our drinks to the patio, WHEW! 
There were abt 5-6 other ppl anyways hanging out in the bar.  
I've NEVER experienced this in all the times I've went barhopping in the mission.
You can say this will never be forgotten! haha

I told the bartender to make me something fruity, he didn't know what to make.  So, I said make me something with tequila.  Since they are obviously known for their tequila.

We tried two of their signature drinks.  I would tell you the name of them but by the chance I could read what it was the whole block had a blackout.
author: Remie M.

description:
We stopped by Laszlo before seeing a movie at the Alamo Drafthouse and got here there right when it opened.  It is a cool looking bar and the bartenders were friendly.  My wife and I only ordered a drink each and went with the bartenders recommendation.  Mine was ok but lacked a lot of flavor.

Cool bar to check out if you're waiting for dinner at Foreign Cinema or seeing a show at the Alamo Drafthouse.
author: Blake B.

description:
Bunch of friends and I stopped by around 12 as we wondered the Mission, we didn't want to walk to far from where we had dinner. It was pretty empty when we walked in. They have some lofted space with a lounge area for more seating which is small but nice. I didn't actually try the drinks though the bartenders seemed pretty chill. One of them let my friend go behind the bar to learn how to make a drink. Though there probably are some legal concerns with that - they got scolded when by the manager when he walked in and made us stop with the show. 

Still pretty cool that the bartenders allowed that. Otherwise, don't have much of an impression since I didn't get anything.
author: Liza X.

description: Man oh man...that's how it usually starts.  I stumble here and immediately I'm drawn to Libby! You can't miss her beautiful face and fabulous hair! This bar is nice and completely laid back.  They totally jam here.  The drinks are amazing and no matter how chaotic the crowd seems, the bartenders will always get your order.  Good things come to those who wait.  There's abundant seating and the lighting is flattering.  This bar is nestled beside the entrance hall of Foreign Cinema.  Another option, you can go to brunch here.  It's entertaining, allowing you to people watch street level or from upstairs. I always have a hard time leaving...I laugh so hard.  Fun place and always a great time.
author: Trish Z.

description:
I love the slushee machine, I've had a few different flavors and all of them were tasty! I try to come each month for drag queen bingo, it's so much fun! It can get really busy but the bartenders are pretty good about taking care of everyone. I usually leave before the DJs get started, but I know they have them lots of nights if that's your thing. 

I like that you can order the Foreign Cinema food in a more casual setting when you don't want to get dressed up :)
author: Nicole B.

description: Upscale lounge & good music. FYI to the management, i read some comments at Yelp and had the same issue. It seems like the bartenders do not want to work there, they were just standing and didnt even ask us if we want any drinks. Will I come back? Yes But still dont like the bartenders
author: Taryn M.

description: Trivia on Monday nights! Tasty drinks, reasonable prices. Secret tip: you can order food from the foreign cinema menu, they even play movies on the wall! Plus, it's clean and has friendly, non pretentious bartenders! I'll definitely be coming back!
author: Clementine D.

description: Excellent cocktails, good music, friendly and quick service.  You can get the whole Foreign Cinema menu without having to make a reservation.  Nice lighting and atmosphere. Feels laid back classy.  Fun trivia night, bingo and dj nights. Wine list is small but excellently selected.  Great place for a mellow happy hour drink or a late night party vibe.  Also great brunch spot.  All around a solid go to Mission bar.
author: Lauren F.

description: Awful experience -went to meet a few friends (one happened to be celebrating her birthday) and we had the displeasure of coming across one of the rudest waitresses we've ever encountered! Our party was not drunk or being demanding, this was the first impression within the first 5 minutes of arriving. We came in with full intentions of having dinner and drinks, the waitress had such a nasty attitude that we ended up ordering only water and to make matters worst, she brought one of the glasses broken! Our entire party felt very uncomfortable that we took our business else where. I will never come in again or recommend this place to anyone! Save you money and go somewhere else where your business is appreciated.
author: Jose G.

description: Cute bar next to Foreign Cinema! Came here for a drink before dinner. It was packed downstairs so headed upstairs for a drink. They play movies on a big screen.
author: Sophina G.

description: I don't know where to start. The cocktails are amazing, the people here are really friendly. The bartender, Libby, makes amazing drinks! It's a delicious diamond in a sea of mundane bars. I could drink here all day. They have a frozen drink that looks like a random iced drink machine from New Orleans, but DEAR GOD IS IT DELICIOUS!  Drop in, say hi to Libby and enjoy an amazing drink. Cheers!
author: Carlos R.

description: I went in to check out laszlo after the remodel and  they did an amazing job. More seating upstairs is a plus with private booths. Nice tables outside and inside by the window to people watch. They still offer foreign cinemas full menu for dinner AND brunch which could save your date if you didn't get reservations. One the missions oldest fine dinning/ cocktail spots in the city still doing a great job!
author: Nick P.

description:
Laslo, Lazlo, Laszlo... how do you spell the name of this place? I had to look it up so many times.

I love the lighting, cool ambiance and drinks here. The bartenders are great. Nice selection of whiskey.
author: Vivian H.

description:
Great ambience which drew me and my friend Marc to this bar. But to my dismay the drinks were not only super super expensive but also super weak. 
The bartender made a comment saying we gotta save Vodka for the staff. I should have gone with my gut and ordered a beer here.
Definitely a nice looking place with good music. 
Advice for owner: Get a new bartender- ours was the skinny one with a small pony tail and a beard.
author: Artie C.

description: I ordered a Sazerac. They don't know how to make one. On top of that, it took 45 mins to receive 6 drinks. They haven't came back to replace my "sazerac"drink.... it took them an hour. This place is the epitome of hipster and douche bag central. Do not go here.
author: Jane Q.

description: The drinks were good. However, there was barely any service that was required. After my first and only visit to this place, when we were done with our drinks and left the bar, the waiter followed us into the street as he wasn't satisfied with the tip we left for him. I was waiting in a line to enter another bar when he approached me and my friends. Honestly, I could live without the embarrassment. I bumped up the tip only to steer him clear! The authorities must look into this to avoid losing customers, as I am sure of never going to this bar again. The experience inside the bar was fine, but it totally went down because of the waiter. Wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.
author: Madhura P.

description:
Great concept, good music. I came here last Saturday night for my birthday and I was annoyed at the bartender. I get that it's busy and crowded, but I do not deserve to get yelled at say: "don't you ever f*cking touch me", I was disgusted. He simply asked me what kinda of Vodka would I like? I said Ciroc? Goose? he said we don't have that and asked someone else what can I get you?

Luckily the guy next to me said they have specialty vodkas here, and I recommend this. I gently tapped the guy on the shoulder and he FREAKING YELLED at me?!  I said my bad, the guy next to me said I'm sorry he's a douche let me pay for your drink? I said oh you come here often, and he's rude like that? He said yes! I am the Patron, so therefore I will come first before any yelling or rudeness. I believe your paycheck comes from the people you serve!!  The same bartender ignored my friends as well, when they lifted their finger up asking for a drink-response was DON'T POINT YOUR FINGER AT ME! This made me very upset, I hope something is done about it. Please re-train your staff with a class of manners.

PS, Bartender was a tall Caucasian, brunette, long hair.
author: Kathy V.

description: Horrible service at the bar! The bartenders are overloaded with the orders and just do not have the time over the counter.
author: Ranjit G.

description: Don't know who was responsible for this, but last week, my phone fell out of my pocket at Laszlo.  I continued on my night, unaware, to a couple other destinations,  only discovering my missing phone at dinner.  Retraced steps to Laszlo, where GAH, THE SHIFT HAS CHANGED! My friendly bartender was gone...  the new bartender, equally friendly,  asked if he could help. I explained my dilemma.  He said he didn't know, but he'd  bring me to some one who would.  Turned out that was the host desk, where they quizzed me about my phone, turning it over when I properly described it.  Thanks for holding it, and for your friendly and honest service. Oh, and the craft cocktails, delicious.   Definitely coming back.
author: Anjee D.

description: it was only 9pm, and not crowded at all, but we waited for ages for bartender to come to us, staff and bartender had so much attitudes :(
author: Tegshbayar B.

description: My brother and I decided to grab a quick cocktail here before heading to the Alamo Drafthouse...we sat near the end of the bar and waited patiently for the bartenders to acknowledge us... Finally one did and said "I'll be with you in a minute" we said no problem....we figured he'd wrap up that drink and then take our order. For reference the bar was not that packed. 10 mins pass by and the guy still hadn't checked on us... we thought maybe he just had a lot of orders.... finally he starts walking toward us and just as I think he's going to ask for our drink order he asks the group next to us that already had drinks if they wanted something else.... at that point I was over this place and the service.... I do also want to mention we were the only Latinos in the place.... was it a form of racism? Not sure, I'd like to think San Francisco is not a place where that exists but I've never felt so invisible to a bartender.
author: Alma L.

description: Love this place - wicked spicy margaritas combined with food from Foreign Cinema. Great place to sit and watch the Mission!
author: Robyn W.

description: Do you like airports and their shitty overpriced drinks? What if I told you there is a place in town where you can have that very experience.
author: Anthony M.

description: The cocktails are great, the space is amazing after the renovation, but most importantly, there are hooks for your jacket!
author: Dave N.

description: Serve the same menu with foreign cinema without the wait,  I had the champagne omelet and it was a bit too salty. A side of the sauteed greens came at the end of the meal. Limited wine selection at Laszlo side but DJs and are cocktails are the same
author: Amanda D.

description:
Drinks and food are 5 star worthy, but the the service is just mediocre at best.

The bar was near empty and still I had to wait in front of the bar tender for nearly 10 min for him to finish writing something down before I was acknowledged, and when I was it almost felt like he didn't want to do so. 

When I asked for the check, I immediately gave my credit card, and still he placed the check down and walked over to the DJ booth where he remained for another 10 min before coming back to the bar. 

If it is that slow with only a handful of customers i can't picture how they operate when it gets busy.

Update:

I omitted a red flag from my original review hoping it was all in my head but after reading another review I need to add to it..

When my partner arrived I commented to him on how I was the last to be served from the bar as well as the only one that got asked for an ID (I'm 33). I was also the only Hispanic at the bar. I don't play the race card ever but I did tell him I got a weird feeling from my exchange with the bar tender.   I chose to believe it maybe was all in my head but after going through some reviews I see someone else felt the same way with whom I suspect is the same bartender due to the physical characteristics and relatively recent review.
author: Alberto P.

description:
Went for brunch. 5 stars for serving the same great brunch menu as Foreign Cinema, but the service was painful.  

The bartenders seemed annoyed with the customers and each other, and they dropped the ball a couple of times. They didn't put in one of our three orders, but never apologized or made up for it in any way- instead awkwardly bringing out the missing food about 20 minutes after we pointed it out.  Then when we finally got their attention again for the bill they brought another tables bill and seemed annoyed once again that we pointed out the error.

Probably should've just waited an hour for a walk in table at foreign cinema rather than trying to dodge the line and eat here.
author: Ben R.

description:
It's $12 for a cup of soda with a splash of alcohol and a lame environment. 

2 Stars cause the bartender was chill at least.
author: David M.

description: Amazing cocktails, wonderful atmosphere, great people. Highly recommend checking this spot out!
author: Richard H.

description:
DISGUSTING BARTENDER!!!

Dear management,

We came here this evening for cocktails and good fun. While at the bar ordering drinks a friend's friend was ordering a drink and the bartender took a dirty used cup (knowing it was dirty) from the counter and poured the drink in it. When she called out the bartender of his nasty pour habits, he took that cup and poured it in another cup. WHO DOES THAT? He's the bartender chunkier bartender with greasy hair kind of covering his eyes (NOT THE ONE with long hair wrapped in a bun). 

1) that's gross 
2) who does that 
3) his behavior is a reflection of the establishment 
4) don't make me report this elsewhere 
5) don't treat paying customers like trash 

I like this place a lot. But seeing that really made me think otherwise. All I kept thinking was... "Damn we all could be drinking other peoples backwash"... "If I wake up with herpies, I'll know it came from Laszlos"
author: Jane A.

description:
Laszlo was not for me. We walked in for a drink only because of its proximity to Foreign Cinema, where we planned to have dinner. My man and I were saddled down with two large pieces of luggage plus some other bags, otherwise I would have suggested we move somewhere a bit more welcoming. 

To be clear, the bartender was nice and the music great but the crowd was a bit rough. And the whole bar reeked of the cigarette smoke that wafted in from the patrons who stepped outside. I can enjoy a dive now and then but Laszlo just didn't work for me.
author: Michelle C.

description: It's okay. Been here a couple times & it's fine. Seats at the bar, music is pretty good and it's got a relaxed vibe. The service is slow but I'm not really in a rush either.
author: Heather S.

description:
I was here with some friends after dinner at Foreign Cinema and there were bar seats. The staff didn't seem comfortable shooting the shit - maybe because they're usually packed and don't have to do that - still the cocktails were excellent. 

I'm a big Manhattan fan so we tried several Bourbons and Ryes made the same way in a nicely made Manhattan. Had a great time in this very dark place. Also make excellent Craft Cocktails for you Crafty types.
author: Rew C.

description: Great for day-time drinking!   Libby is a great bartenderess and friendly.   Frozen Rosie is the way to begin any hot sunny day.  FYI, the Music is on point!    Lighting is good (not dark like most crap bars) and a local vibe.
author: Carlos D.

description:
Stopped by here waiting for our reservation at Foreign Cinema.

They have unique drinks here and are pretty good from the ones I've tried but they don't really make great classic drinks like an old-fashioned. The bitters they used were not great quality. The bartender we had was not too friendly. The place is not too large and their TVs are quite small/outdated. For the Giants game, they had the game projected onto their wall but because their wall is uneven and not-white, it wasn't very clear. I guess at least they tried...
author: Katherine L.

description:
I've been frequenting Laszlo's for a  couple of years now. It's consistently a great place for brunch, day drinking and night drinking. It's also large enough that you can have a nice little get together there. 
Drinks wise they've got a limited selection of beers but it's mostly a cocktail bar. Bartenders are attentive and fairly quick. 
One of my favorite reasons to visit Laszlo's is for brunch. Plenty of great options as they serve up the same dishes as Foreign Cinema. Everything I've had there has been delicious especially when it's flanked by a spicy bloodymary. They also have free donut bites on the weekend and there's a dj spinning an eclectic mix of old school tunes on vinyl.
author: Stevie K.

description:
We've all been here before... it's midnight and the night is kind of foggy.  You can't quite figure out if it's because you've had a few too many or the night is actually filled with literal fog.  The Mission is slurring as a whole and your quest seems lackluster so you grab a drink.  You secretly dream that you could be dinning at what seems to be the hottest place in town in Lazlo's backyard but alas, you're at the bar wallowing what's left of your night away.  

The drinks aren't half bad but a couple blocks away and you could do better.
author: Kevin J.

description: Not friendly bar tenders!!!!!!!!!!!!! I mean for Saturday and early and empty. Only in the mission!!
author: David F.

description:
Incredible rude bartender. When I asked for a cocktail menu he just grunted and said they don't have one when I clearly saw a whole stack on the bar. Then he proceeded to make the most disgusting gin and tonic I have ever tasted. Flat, bitter and gross. How you mess that up I have no idea. 

I can take attitude if you deliver the goods. Unfortunately for you having a beard and mustache doesn't make you a good bartender or even remotely cool so drop the act and get yourself to bar tending school. And learn some manners while you are at it. 

Two thumbs down for Laszlo.
author: Noah Z.

description:
Pros: fun ambiance, big pours, good music
Cons: slow service (seriously 30 minutes to get a beer and wine), no-personality bartenders
author: Jody N.

description: Super low key and chill, smells like rich mahogany. The grey gardens is light and refreshing it needs a little more kick to it but I like the environment. It's a nice place to chat with friends.
author: Kim M.

description: This place is good for drinks but if you want to wait 45 mins and still not eat this is the place for you. For starvation go here...also they didn't do anything to make up for the fact that this happened. A sorry doesn't help much....
author: Valerie N.

description:
Stopped by this bar right before dinner at Foreign Cinema.  It's located right next door to the restaurant.  It's a small bar with a vintage look with a side wall of old records.  Upstairs is more seating and lounge area for when it gets crowded.  

When we stopped by it was only a few people in the bar, but then again, I would assume it only gets packed at night.  We ordered 2 drinks each

Southside Rickey - gin, lemon, lime, sugar and soda, this was what I ordered and it has a very strong lemon/lime taste to it.  You could barely taste the gin, but after 1 drink, you can tell that there was quite a bit of alcohol in this drink.

Slumdog millionaire - gin, curry leaves, pineapple gum, yellow chartreuse and lime. This is what my husband ordered and I had a sip of it.  It has a strong flavor from the curry leaves, which made it unique.  He enjoyed it a lot.

I'm glad that there was a bar right next door for us to hang out while we waited for dinner.  I was even more glad that they had some specialty drinks that we were able to try.
author: Lana N.

description:
Lazlo is a little sexy bar in the Mission. 

The sleek design, darkness yet slightly iluminated interior, the chill of the place makes it seem cool and comfortable. Like a hideaway for drinks. 

Lazlo makes for an excellent spot to have a cocktail before dinner at Foreign Cinema and they make excellent punch during happy hour. I had the Peach Manzana for $4.00, quite tasty. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kGUsD_PWP3GGTGzfPb46Ng?userid=Lu8y2ayxVlAzuJEVfVcH4w#FrJMn6NYsnkjTHhlWre4yA
author: Rebekah T.

description:
Laszlo is an average bar in the Mission district. Maybe the problem is that there are so many good bars around and that make Lazlo look worse than what it is. I go to this bar often when there is not much going on in the area. It's a small bar and the drinks are not cheap but we have always met interesting people. The drinks are good and they are probably better than the ones offered by other bars and the bartenders are very attentive and always take care of the regulars.
Last time we went there the place was packed, it was almost impossible to get a cocktail, we ended up having to go somewhere else.
author: Marcos F.

description:
My new favorite bar in the Mission. Great live music, warm ambiance, and strong drinks--pricier but totally worth it for the experience. The crowd that shows up here was pretty diverse, mostly young professionals & couples. 

I'll definitely be hitting up this spot pretty soon.
author: Juan T. K.

description: Came here a couple of months ago.. Service was SUPER slow.. first bar tender had a sarcastic personality.. food was under cooked.. Drinks were OK! Everything was very overpriced!
author: Chivonne B.

description:
This place is a perfect example of the Cancer that is consuming the Mission.  I've never had worse service at a Bar. Never. 

None of the bartenders care.  They don't acknowledge you when you come in.  They are loud and obnoxious with their friends.  Then when I do get a drink the bartender sprays it with his cleaner because he's twitchy and coked out and can't tell the direction of the nozzle.  

I couldn't get anyone's attention to change drinks.  My boyfriend who met me right after I got my drink waited 20 minutes without being offered a drink.  
When we finally got our bartender's attention and asked for the check,  still with a sprayed drink and a drinkless guest. The other bartender pretended to know my tab and charged me 12 when it says 11 on the menu. And  to top it off my drink was terrible.

I would recommend to the owners, clean house.  You have some nasty cockroaches serving drinks.
author: Jacklyn H.

description:
This is one of those places where people from other neighborhoods go to "slum it" in the Mission. You'll see a lot of popped collars, fancier-than-befits-the-Mission outfits, credit cards and the $11-15 drinks to go with all of that. 

There's a valet outside if you didn't come in a party bus, but street parking isn't *that* hard in this part of the Mission (but why you would drive to this area when there is a bus stop in front of the bar and BART 3 blocks away is beyond me). Taxis know to hover near here at closing time.

It's often crowded and takes a while to get a drink. The drinks are mixed well, but I usually defer to beer or wine for efficiency. It's nice that you can order/eat food from neighbor Foreign Cinema, but it's not the best experience if it's super-crowded, and it's a little too fancy for bar food.

I don't volunteer this place to friends but I don't have a huge problem coming here when others suggest it.
author: Krista L.

description:
There's no better way to kick off a weekend when you've a splendid cocktail and 'The Graduate' playing!!!!

Imagine my friend and my husband teasing me, lovingly, about the "Andhra drink" - - you see, my family is from Andhra Pradesh, a south Indian state that boasts of the spiciest sauces (what we call the pickles and chutneys)!! [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telugu_cuisine]

Well, Laszlo has a drink on their menu that is called something ".......Heat....." - it is infused with jalapeno. TERRIFIC!  After 3 of those, I suppose I could walk along the Marin Headlands and/or the Golden Gate while it's 50.F in a bikini!! :))) Their Bourbons are good, and one other cocktail that my husband had was good...the name slips my mind now. Hmm!

I loved that they have this lil cosy mezzanine like area. Tender lighting...if I can say that. I loved their old television - but that box did not play the movie :O)

Ambience - 5 *****
Menu - 5 *****
Price - 4**** (implying, it's moderately priced. Not too expensive, but just right!)
Music - 4.5 *****
Service - 4 ***** ( they take a while to clean up, but I guess overall, it is not that bad)

Definitely a place to go to!
author: Me Iz S.

description: Just another typical gentrified Mission hipster bar... nothing special but what really got me is that they clearly list happy hour on their website but then they say nope, no happy hour specials, it's just a period of time to call happy hour (or some nonsense along those lines).  point is, NO happy hour despite having it clearly advertised on their website.  but looks like a fine mediocre place to overpay for drinks if you're in the area.
author: Mana B.

description:
It wasn't super empty on a Sunday evening, but apparently that's normal in the Mission.  I went to four bars that night, and there was a solid crowd in every single one of those bars.  So weird to be considering I live in FiDi / SoMa where the starbucks and walgreens aren't even open.

ANYWAY, back to Laszlo.  I liked it.  A lot.  For the Mission, it wasn't dive-y at all, probably because it's somehow associated with Foreign Cinema.  You can order Foreign Cinema-ish bar bites from Laszlo's, which is great, so if you're looking for a casual date night spot, this is a good spot that lies somewhere in between "let's get drinks" and "dinner."

The decor / theme is pretty cool / industrial.  Not typically my cup of tea, but it works and feels clean.  The crowd on a Sunday night = people in their late twenties / early thirties... who probably worked at start-ups.  I know that's not everyone's favourite crowd, but I liked it.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Great strong drinks, low key crowd, DJ played 80's music... luv it!!!!
No cover...
Few cute corner tables, perfect for dates and fun night with your SO.
Would definitely come back here again.
author: Claudine V.

description:
Definitely a good spot to go to if you have plans to go eat at Foreign Cinema but I do not think I would go out of my way just to drink here again.

The place is not that big, there is an upstairs area as well as a downstairs area around the bar, seating is limited. We came here on a Saturday night and the place was packed! Thankfully our cousins showed up early and saved us a table near the entrance of the place. Just like others have mentioned, the music can get really loud! We enjoyed the music they were playing though, old school hip hop, music from the 90's, stuff you would have heard in the club in the past 10 years! 

It's street parking, so cross your fingers that you find a safe spot close to the bar.

Restrooms: Separate restrooms for men and women. The restrooms are shared with Foreign Cinema so they were decent and stocked with toilet seat covers and toilet paper. The women's restroom had 3 stalls.
author: Aimee R.

description: I used to love this place.  It was nice to just go and get a cocktail before and after dinner.  After they remodeled and hire a brand new staff, I stopped by twice and couldn't ignore how badly the service is.  The place is barely packed and some how it's almost impossible to get a drink.  The bartender would ignore you and you stand at the bar looking like an idiot or feeling you smell or something.  The server describe to me a beer I should try since its taste fruity and ended up bringing me a tecate.  I'm pretty sure tecate doesn't taste fruity at all. I gave it another chance and came back the other night. No luck. Still the same people behind the bar. Still the same crappy service. We ordered food and ask question about the dish and the bartender/server was too good to answer so he didn't.  No wonder the line to el techo is all the way to the end of the street and no one is in this bar on a Friday during happy hour.  Shape up guys. If your service is as good as the food, maybe those people who doesn't want to wait in line for el techo would change their minds and come over. Or people would want to stay for more than a drink.  Good luck keeping customers with your poor attitude and service when there are bars all around you that are not too good to serve their customers drinks with a smile.
author: Jaime L.

description:
4 stars for the Bloody Mary and our awesome bartender! Stopped by here while waiting for our table at Foreign Cinema. All three of us ordered the bloody mary and asked for it to be extra spicy and our bartender said it was already pretty spicy. He wasn't lying about it being spicy or delicious. I'm not a fan of tomato juice, but this was out of this world delicious. You could feel the heat hit the back of your throat and warm up your belly. 

I'm not from the bay area, but when I come back up to visit, this place will be on my place to hit up.
author: Tracey W.

description: Probably the best Michelada I've had in town.  Not sure it's $8 good, but it's pretty spectacular.
author: Joshua W.

description:
It is no surprise that these guys have over 300 reviews and only 3.5 stars.

So why give them 5 stars?

It would be too easy to give a 1 star...

I have been going here for years. Love the location. Drinks are... um, fine.

Tonight, I said to my super great girlfriends... after we had already been at El Techo and Lolinda (amazing place, by the way... Jeff at El Techo A+ and Alvaro at Lolinda... lovely...) 

let's go to Lazlo... we stood at the bar for EVER with TWO bartenders standing in front of us... talking to EACH OTHER... I smiled kindly... and NOTHING... I waited for a bit and then finally, something just SNAPPED.

I said HEYA, HIYA there. fellas!!  And they looked over with utter disdain, like, "what do YOU want?" 

And I replied with.... F - YOU.

That's right, F - YOU.

And once again, if you are reading this... for every person who has ever been simply ignored at a bar in SF... F - You.
author: Claudia O.

description:
Currently at the bar. There are 7 people in here. No exaggeration: 14 minutes to have our drink order taken and 8 minutes to get it once ordered. How. Is. That. Possible.

There was just another couple in here that ended up leaving because it took so long to have their drink order taken and then even longer to have it made. I overheard them saying "he hasn't even started making our drink yet!" and then walk out.
author: Chris M.

description: Spoiler alert: bartender with the man bun is an absolute douche. We met up with some friends here on my boyfriend's birthday--first stop, we're completely sober. Bartender singles out my boyfriend to ask for his id (once we were already past bouncers) and when bf produced military id and let him know that dob was on the back, dude gave him attitude. Just unnecessarily rude.
author: Alex M.

description:
Laszlo:

Happy hour lasts until 9pm, with $3 beers and $5 Stoli drinks.   
Nice that you're able to order anything off the entire Foreign Cinema menu. (Try the mussels, they're delicious.)
Plenty of seating at the bar or upstairs. 

But....
The place was not happening on a Wednesday night.  
The main bartender was not very friendly.  At all.

Might be a fun bar to start off your night, but not really the kind of place you'd hang out for longer than that.  At least for me.
author: Joanne G.

description:
I love old school. I love classiC movies. I love a good single malt whiskey with my cigar.  Laszlo has all of these (sans cigars).  This place is definitely a great spot to hang and be in company of good people who just want to have a good time.  The crowd is a little older, and by older I mean mature.  30's 40's crowd, et al.  

What strikes me best about this bar is the most obvious attraction; the classic movies being projected on the wall leading to the second level.  I'm quite comfortable sitting at my booth with Macallan in hand, having a good conversation w/ random people and still be drawn to the movie played against that huge backdrop.

The bartenders are quite talented.  Just know what you want up front, and be prepared to get a look of disconcert when you don't.  This is business, a fast one, and bartenders here are here for you as long as you are not taking money out of their pocket when 50 others are trying to order drinks and you delay them even for a minute. Not to say they won't help you, but you don't want to be that guy/girl!
The drinks are aplenty and they are strong! They are made with a lot of love so be sure to tip the bartenders well; they will definitely remember you.  In my most recent outing, while having the sweetheart bartender prepare my Macallan neat, I happened to notice her eyes jump out of her head as she studied the menu to see how much my drink actually cost.  Needless to say, I tipped her very well, and my next 3 came soon as I walked to her side of the bar.

DRINKS: Perfect.

Ambiance: Lovely.

Bathrooms - Very important! Shared w/ Foreign Cinema BUT very clean, very upscale, and very welcoming.

Experience: Always a 10.
author: Myke Y.

description: One of the worst bars I've ever been to. The venue is pretty cool... Fairly open downstairs with a neat upstairs balcony. The service is, hands down, the worst I've ever gotten. One of the bartenders flipped me off when I tried to get his attention (tall, skinny man with a man-bun). I spoke with someone who identified himself as a manager (I highly doubt he was). He told me to apologize to the bartender and assured me that I must have provoked him. He told me not to take things so seriously. I told him I was appalled this is the way they handle business as this is not professional at all, but he just told me it was my fault.
author: Victoria W.

description:
I love brunch.

I've been known to use the word loosely, and now it has almost no meaning. 

The brunch here, though, is so insane.

Come here on a Sunday with the hot afternoon sun beating down on you to this dimly lit, air-conditioned oasis and peek through the hallway as you watch people line up for their tables at Foreign Cinema. 

Then, have yourself a tasty ala minute bloody mary while you order off of Foreign Cinema's menu at Laszlo. 

Let the victory of a glorious Croque Madame warm your soul as you cackle at your lack of wait for food.

But you like, had better things to do because being seen waiting in line for Foreign Cinema is like, so much better, amirite?
author: Ben T.

description: I wish I could give zero stars. I arrived with friends visiting from out of town and tried to strike up convo with the bartender. He seemed chill, but busy. I continued to get passed up by him serving other customers and also stopping to chat with others blatantly ignoring my friend and I. I looked around and the others he was serving were all white customers. I asked him if I could order a drink. He told us to wait and that sometimes you just have to wait in life. WTF?! This guy has some major issues and suffice to say I'll never be going back to Lazlo, a once beloved hole in the wall bar of SF, and I advise people of color to be aware of this racist bartender. In the end, tall, slim, white guy with shitty facial hair bartender with slick back ponytail with a dog tag necklace refused to serve my Latina friend and when I asked him what his issue was he just shrugged. We immediately left.
author: Carnitas C.

description:
Drinks were good and strong - had the signature citron and a side car :).

However I would say service was not that great. I understand that the bartender was working since 8 in the morning but I've never had to wait that long for a drink! Thus the three stars.
author: Christina C.

description:
Laszlo is a new favorite. Great mixed drinks. DJs mixing out of a large in-house vinyl collection. Old movies projected on the wall. 

The truffle popcorn is an amazing snack. 

The beer list kind of sucks.
author: Marcus C.

description:
I stopped by here after dinner at Foreign Cinema.

i love the decor and ambiance here. Pretty sweet for a bar if you ask me.

They have skateboards all around. The bartenders are quite friendly. Seems like everyone knows everyone at the place.

It's pretty small inside, therefore if you're a bit claustrophobic, this place wont be right for you. It's intimate if you make it to be.
author: Mimi T.

description:
Was in the area and this spot was going off so came in to check it out. 

Had an awesome chill ambiance, dj spinning hip hop and a yummy menu of cocktails.

I had the body heat which was really good but almost a bit too spicy. 

Would def come back!
author: Lina K.

description: Love the eclectic cocktails here. Not your traditional bar with traditional spirits is also what I like.
author: Diana C.

description: I used to walk past this bar on my way home from work and never bothered going in because I thought it was too hipster for me. It's actually not bad. I did order a double drink and thought it wasn't stiff enough, but what saved last night was the music the DJ was playing. The Pharcyde, Q-Tip, and other hip-hop tracks. You can have the worst bar ever, but I'll still enjoy the place if you play the right music. The dress code isn't strict at all either. I just walked in with t-shirt, jeans, and a pair of sneakers.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
Laszlo might have the best happy hour in the Mission. 

It's hard to beat $2 happy hour Trumers. Even harder when happy hour lasts till 9pm! Near impossible to beat when you factor in the low-key chill vibe of the bar that makes it an awesome place for post-work drinks. 

Bartenders here are chill and laid-back. They'll take good care of you. Laszlo is perfect for a pre-Foreign Cinema drink, or pre-mission bar crawl meet up, or heck just spend a whole evening here. I'll be back.
author: Jon L.

description:
Maybe I'm getting too old, but the music in there is so loud it's impossible to have any kind of conversation.

Definitely not a fan of this bar, especially in an area with a zillion better ones.
author: Ben R.

description:
This review is for Sunday brunch at Laszlo. 

First up, that champagne mimosa cocktail. I think I've been spoilt for life now, other mimosas can not compare. Glorious! Two of these cocktails whilst waiting for the food to arrive and I was feeling on top of the world. Then, the food itself is spectacular. A champagne omelet for brunch? Yes please! Just when you think things can't get any better - try their bacon as a side or the homemade pop tarts.

In addition to the cocktails and menu options, the staff are also super lovely. I was visiting with some friends who were about to get married and are regular Laszlo brunchers so voila, a round of tequila shots appeared. Quite the boozy Sunday brunch but I'm not complaining.

I left feeling extremely daytime drunk but also sad that I wasn't in SF for another weekend brunch. Whenever I return to the Mission, I'll be at Laszlo Sunday morning sipping on a champagne mimosa cocktail.
author: Jessie P.

description: Great drinks but the music was so loud I could not have a conversation. After being there for about an hour, I couldn't speak for an hour because I had been yelling to talk to someone right next to me. Asked the DJ to turn it down a bit but he didn't seem to care.
author: David G.

description: Bloody Mary here is really spicy, just the way I like it. Only had one drink here before Foreign Cinema brunch. But if I'm in that neighborhood again, I'd check out the other drinks.
author: Dan M.

description: I have to stop here EVERY time I swing through the mission. No excuses. I've been stopping here since fall 2012 and have yet to be disappointed. I love the vintage indie film playing on the back wall and the new DJ they brought in on Friday nights is SOLID. Great vibe, drinks and music!! Cool crowd comes through before the night really gets going perfect spot to begin the night in the mission, or even hang out if the scenery is cool. Love love love it here!!
author: Rafael R.

description:
Went there on a Friday night for after work happy hour, their HH menu was limited to one cocktail I was not interested in. I tried a couple of pricey cocktail instead and it was not worth it. I also think the food from foreign cinema is overrated but that'll be for another review. 

About the ambiance, the bar was literally empty (our group + a couple) when we arrived (it was 6:30pm) and was getting a bit busier when we left (after 9). The upstairs part was close, No DJ, and one bartender.

I am not saying it was bad at all, but the mission offers a ton of possibility that are definitely more fun, that I would pick over this.
author: Max H.

description:
I book marked this place after going to their website I liked the design of the site as I thought that the Laszlo logo was similar to that of an old Bauhaus design.  I saw similarities and was intrigued by  the cocktail menu. We came after having brunch at Foreign Cinema. We sat in here on a Saturday late afternoon for a couple of cocktails. I went with a St. Germain drink that was light and refreshing... 

OYSTERS. You can order oysters and though I am not an oyster person i decided to try one with the bf. He was trying to get me to be adventurous and have some with him telling me that they are good. WHAT EVER .. They look like labia's and I am all about texture and I just can't do. Apparently, they were really good. I wouldn't know because I rather be adventurous in other ways. 

The design for sure is very Euro influenced.. Like it.... A LOT! The Bauhaus image that I mentioned. 
http://www.printmag.com/CMSAssets/Blog/AssociatedImages/bauhaus-1923.jpg
author: Christina S.

description: I like pretty bars. I like loud music. I like good cocktails. I really liked Laszlo. I shall return!
author: Liz M.

description:
AESTHETICS lie between a traditional SOMA establishment (brick and exposed conduit) and friendly neighborhood watering hole.  You walk in and see that the focus is the long bar to the left.  You walk to the back to find a door that leads you to the bathroom and an exit to Foreign Cinema.  Next to this door is a staircase to the upstairs level that can host about 35-40 people.  The place is pretty packed on Saturdays (1. its a great bar; 2. as peeps have reviewed - this is where you go before your F.C reservation).  It gets warm upstairs when at full capacity (and perhaps with a few cocktails thrown back too). 

DJ stands at the front door basically, facing towards the bar.  Music is not Top 40's but is in the same vain.  Its fun, throw-back, and while it may not be a song that everyone can scream-sing along to --- it will keep a party going & sustain a happy mood.   

PARTYLEAD:  If you want to reserve upstairs - you have to meet an $800 bar minimum APPROX.  Note my "APPROX".  This may or not be exact.  Basically, the area is reserved for your party - but there is only the bar downstairs - you have to let the bar know the celebrant's name when you order drinks.  But honestly, as long as they see that the alki is a-flowin' --- that minimum isn't strict.  Another note:  There is no "bouncer" so to speak - to let your guests through so you could potentially get "strangers" up there.  They don't put a rope at the staircase or a "reserved" sign on the tables or anything.  Its more of a mutual understanding that that's your spot.  I feel like this matches the relax, free-spirited vibe of the district. 

If you're wondering about COVER - don't.  Because there is none.

If you're wondering "WHAT DO I WEAR?" - don't.  Its the Mission District.  Its SF no less.  Do you, boo boo, DO YOU.  Its a take me for who I am city.  And donnn't you love it?!!!!!!
author: Deanna A.

description:
Arrived in the Mission despite the pouring rain with the intent to have brunch at Foreign Cinema but the wait (without reservations) was 1 hour! No biggie, we decided to eat at Laszlo, their attached bar, instead (no wait time and it was pretty empty). It was Sunday morning, around 11:30AM, and it felt like my Saturday night had not yet ended. There was a pretty legit DJ spinning indie music, dim lighting, a football game playing, a movie projection on the wall, and drinks being poured. 

Laszlo itself is pretty cool. There's a small upstairs area if you want more privacy, or you could sit at the bar/the couches downstairs. There's some pretty sweet artwork on the walls, and a very laid back vibe.

I really enjoyed their dinner menu but their brunch is even MORE amazing!! I had a dish with chicken sausage, thinly cut fries, avocados, what I believe to be kale hash, all mixed with some other yummy unidentifiable food. IT WAS D-E-L-I-C-I-O-U-S. Probably the best, most unique brunch food I've ever had. Ouu, we had a side of their slow cooked bacon too -- it's everything you love about bacon PLUS a hint of sweetness. If you're looking for good brunch food, definitely check out Laszlo/Foreign Cinema.
author: I. L.

description: Great DJ, drinks and atmosphere.  Unfortunately, the door guy/bouncer is a jackass.  If you see a skinny snoop dog look alike at the door, likely with his face buried  in his phone, avoid the place.  The rest of the staff were great.
author: Brad S.

description:
I typically find myself at Laszlo when I'm waiting for my reso at Foreign Cinema. 3 stars as it's not a memorable place (certainly not a destination bar for me), but the bartenders are nice and to the point, wide selection of booze, and cheap, stiff drinks if that's the route you want to go.

Upstairs is always closed each time I've been here, so I'd love to come back and check it out. Maybe for my next trip to Foreign Cinema..
author: Johanna L.

description: Cute place but the barback continued to (over and over not just once or twice) literally push people to get through.  Incredibly rude and disrespectful.  Not coming back!
author: Kari K.

description:
Part of Foreign Cinema.
Theres an upstairs with some couches overlooking the street.
Came here on a sunday at 3 and close to every chair and table were taken.

The DJ was awesome!
Good combo of electro + Indie.
I'd love to get my hands on those playlists.
author: Ash R.

description:
One of the bartenders was so rude! I came here to meet my girlfriend and her friends on Friday night. The ambiance was nice and elegant. We noticed all the coaches available on the upper so we decided to go and have enjoy ourselves. We were just sitting down when the bartender came out nowhere yelling to the top of his lungs: "get out"! " get out"!

Completely inappropriate behavior for such a nice establishment. We are all professionals enjoying cocktails and $6 dollar beers. No need to yell. There was no sign or anything that indicated that the couches were reserved. 

We would have gone there if we had known that the area was reserved. Again, no manners. Yelling is so disrespectful and rude!
author: Chino C.

description:
With so many great restaurants in the Mission my friends and I have been frequenting Laszlo after our dinner dates. It is within walking distance of the restaurants we go to and a good place to pop in, grab a few drinks, and hear great music (90's hip hop and mashups). 

Unlike other bars in the area, this place has a lounge like atmosphere, plenty of open seating, and plays movies on the TV! 

Unfortunately I can't say that I would make this my destination party place -- it is more of a convenience after dinner. 4
author: Krystal A.

description:
I had a tipsy-licious time here!

I was drafting my review for Laszlo in my head while I was in the bathroom washing my hands. (I seem to get these Yelp review ideas when I'm in the loo)  I realized that aside from my friend's well-made mojito,  my stiff gin martini and my brother's AMF, (adios mo fo, which totally did not have an effect on him BTW)  what made it even sweeter was the fact that it was free.   A college friend generously offered to pick up the tab. I haven't spent time with him in years and almost forgotten how fun he is!  

Judging from other reviews, Laszlo seems to be the default bar when peeps can't get into Medjool because of the dress code, it's full, etc.

Please.  Why would you want to go to Medjool which makes you wait, charges cover, has looong bathroom lines at their rooftop bar, [insert other reasons here]  when you can have your drink ready at Laszlo by efficient bartenders in less than 10 minutes?   Our group only had to stand for a short time before seating opened up.  (as the second floor area was closed for the night)

This dimly lit bar has a loungey feel, even with the left wing signage and random movie projected on the wall.  But I'm sure you wouldn't even notice that, what with the good company and drinks a flowing?
author: Janice C.

description: Dark bar with a sleek vibe, love the high-ceilinged effect. Projects foreign films on the back wall. Limited seating, can get loud/crowded, better for smaller groups.
author: Elizabeth L.

description: Great vibe and music. Really cool spot.  Unfortunately, i've never seen such a short poor on a glass of wine!...and the ice water didn't taste right.
author: Scott D.

description: Went today for brunch, despite the bad reviews because invited there by a friend. The place is ok, extremely loud music makes it not that good for a date if you want to chat. Didn't try cocktails, wine was ok. Amazing note for their bacon. A Croque Madame, bacon aside, Scrambled Eggs and four glasses of wine for 75 dollars. Our waiter was kind but others quite rude.
author: Paolo B.

description: How good of a time you have will depend on what night you come here. On a weekend this place is intolerably packed but also has good drunk people watching. On a weeknight this is actually a good date spot for a drink. I was extremely impressed that there was room to sit and ordering a drink was a breeze!
author: Yolanda Y.

description:
Five stars for the bloody mary, that's what this is all about.

We'd come to Foreign Cinema as I'd been having a bloody mary jones.   But, as is often the case, the wait was long and we ended up killing some time at Laszlo's.   The bloody urge is not going away, so whatthefuck, we order one there. 

I'm immediately impressed with the time and effort taken.  This was an artisan's mary, friends.  I can't be sure, but mayhaps Guinness was involved, along with 5-6 other things.  I like 'em real spicy and savory.   I like pickled veggies and them lil' onions.

Bingo.  What emerged was outstanding.   This is currently my favorite bloody mary in the city... but I haven't been there since (this was about 2 months ago) and I'm just hoping that damn bartender who's name I didn't get is there next time I go.  

Ironically, the Foreign Cinema followup Mary didn't hold a candle.   Laszlo's won by a mile...
author: Goolie G.

description: The place is loud so we sat outside for lunch. I like this place because you can order food from Foreign Cinema.
author: Margaret R.

description:
This place could get super busy on the weekends so I recommend coming here on a weeknight if you want to be able to enjoy sitting down at the bar with your Foreign Cinema food and cocktails.

4 stars for the pricey cocktails.
author: J M.

description:
3.5 stars!  I can dig it :)

This bar was described to me as "a dive bar that's not too divey" and I can concur.  We came here after pre-loading our stomachs and livers at Baretta.  I bought the first round for about 5 or 6 people, and thought the bartender made a mistake when my tab came back only $23 bucks!!  Awesome!!  

We had a group of about 15 people and we headed to the second floor where there were 2 small tables and some chairs.  The VIP lounge section was blocked off by that cursed red velvet rope that seems to haunt me every now and again, haha.  

We stayed for about 2 hours and had a really good time.  The drinks kept flowing as the conversation got livelier and more outrageous.  The only thing that could have made our time there better... If they turned down the music juuuust a tad.  I hate having to scream while I'm 2 inches away from someone else's ear in order to have a conversation.  By the time we got there though, I was already 4 drinks deep, so whatever I was saying that was drowned out by the music was probably a good thing!!!
author: Miyako L.

description:
This place is so cool.  

Came here on a Wednesday night, and enjoyed everything down to the decor.  They have a nice selection of beers, and a really cool bartender.  Super laid-back environment and lots of seating.  They had the basketball game playing on the tv behind the bar, and then they were also projecting a James Bond movie up on the wall!  

The artwork is really cool too, lots of stuff to look at.  There's an upstairs that overlooks the downstairs, and a super high ceiling.  The whole layout is f'ing dope.  The women's bathroom is really clean and has 3 stalls (this is hard to come by usually in a bar).  Place is great, love it.
author: Cora L.

description:
Literally took the drink out of my hand and told me to get out. F--- this place.

also, 2am actually became 1am because of dst, but that didn't matter.
author: Robert S.

description:
Decent bar. My friends and I made a stop here after we went to Medjool's - it's like a dive bar but not a dive bar.

Drinks are decently priced, about 8-9 bucks per cocktail. Decor is nice and music isn't too loud. Convenient location, great for bar hopping. The atmosphere is great for some friends to sit down, have a drink and catch up. There's a variety of people here, but when we went, there just wasn't that many. But that guarantees you a chair!

Bartenders? Great! I wasn't sure what to order so one of the bartenders offered to make me one. It was strong but delicious. 

If I'm in the area, I'll probably stop in again.
author: Angela K.

description: Celebrated my birthday here last night in the upstairs area and couldn't have been more pleased! The upstairs is lovely with comfy couches and good viewing of the movie projected on the wall. The music isn't too loud upstairs so we were able to talk. Bottle service & bar bytes are very affordable and the staff was super attentive. Thanks guys. I had a blast!
author: Juliya R.

description:
I opened Yelp this morning to find this message. I am thus upping my review.) I'll update when I go back, which, impressively, after this message, I will. 

"Hi, my name is Phil, I am one of the bartenders at Laszlo bar.
I was not working on that Saturday when you came in and had a tough time there, but I did work the night before on Friday and I think I am responsible for the 'watery' drinks.
The story is a little strange and fantastical, but true:

The big sign behind the bar which advertises or happy hour is being replaced, so, in the meantime, we keep a visual aid bottles of the Trumer Pils  beer, and the Stoli vodka. I made a display only 'dummy' bottle of Stoli and filled it with water. To my credit, I actually wrote with a sharpie 'DISPLAY ONLY'. This is when the service breakdown begins.

I gave Glenn (your bartender) an ear full for not looking at/reading the bottle, not listening to you (the guest) inquiring that the drink was made with water and not vodka, and not smelling the drink, getting another co-worker to taste, etc. He has been sober for a long time, so I respect his not drinking, but he should of thought of other action to take.

ok, this is getting long, sorry. In summary, we care and respect your comments, it is important to us, and we hear you. Bryan and I have worked there for 10 years this August and we always try to make a strong generous drink, so I hope you come in and let us (Phil or Bryan) make this up to you.

I am going to send this to the other Yelp folks that I think were in your group also.
Thanks for your time. Phil"
author: Mariko F.

description: Great atmosphere and decent drinks, but the bartender "Bryan" (at least that's what my receipt said) was a rude jerk to me when I asked him a basic question. That seemed to be his modus operandi all night, as he snarked each person in our group in turn. Get a grip! Or a better job! Jeez dude.
author: Davide B.

description: At first, it seems like a squeeze, but there's plenty of seating upstairs. I went for the Thrillist Mad Men party, at which I only had gin drinks and they were already paid for, so unfortunately I can't judge the other cocktails or the pricing. I was very impressed that the bartenders slaved at squeezing fresh lemon and lime juices for all the Tom Collinses and gimlets - though I was pretty impatient when it took them longer.
