They were extremely gracious and helpful when I kept asking about the different cocktails. The only bad thing about my time there was some drink called the Negroni. It made all of us actually shudder when we tasted it.
author: Cat N.

description:
Maybe it's just the left wing cookiness in me, but I like Laszlo and their commie bar touting ways. The decoration and signage, fun stuff. It actually inspired me to link a pic of my favorite flask in Laszlo's honor, cheers comrades.

Anyway, besides the theme of the bar, it's a really nice space with some really good music.

As mentioned, there's an upstairs lounge but the first floor is open all the way up to the ceiling so it has a huge feeling to it even though it's not that big at all. I'm not sure who's necessarily spinning at any given time but I'm always happy with the beats. The music and place itself have a very loungy feel, just like you'd want with the dim lighting and random movie playing on the big screen. 

In my opinion, sometimes bars are obnoxious with playing movies throughout the night. If it's on big TVs, dim lighting is shot and your whole "lounge" just got a bit less "chill". Laszlo does it right though, it's projected really high up on the wall so if you're on the first floor you don't have to notice the movie unless you want to. 

On top of that the movies are always the craziest movies ever, like really odd but in a good way black and white flicks. I was really hammered there recently and I vaguely recall a movie that had a bunch of goats in it and I'm pretty sure some of them were injured, I really can't recall much more. I also don't know if the movies being played are always black and white but even if they do play other genres I don't take Laszlo to be the "Let's put on Oceans 11" type.

Definitely worth the stop in my opinion.
author: Justin N.

description:
I have to come back when I really mean it...

Stumbled upon this place after finding out Foreign Cinema was already closed until dinner. Not a bad alternative! I got a basil gimlet -- it was perfection in a cup. Strong, spicy and fresh. On par with some of the best gimlets I've had, and when I least expected it.

Loud music, great ambiance, friendly bartenders. Plus you get access to the wonderful toilets of Foreign Cinema. Fantastic place to watch any NBA/sports game.
author: liz c.

description:
A little loud, a little mystic. Should you score parking much earlier than expected before dinner at Foreign Cinema, no need to wait in the car or wander around, Laszlo is right nextdoor and its dark sultry mood invites you.

Drinks are decently priced and the music was good, from what I can remember. Though the few times I've visited Laszlo have been only to kill time before dinner at FC, I certainly would not mind starting out a night here, while on the other hand, I couldn't see myself spending an entire night or majority of it here either.
author: Chelsea P.

description:
A great, unpretentious place to hang out before dining at Foreign Cinema, or just to take advantage of Happy Hour until 9pm. Stoli drinks $5, Pilsner $2.

You can order off the FC menu if you are so inclined, but I dunno how I'd feel eating such nice food inside Laszlo. Maybe just oysters and appetizers. 

Our drinks (pineapple vodka + greyhounds) were strong and delicious. The grapefruit juice comes out of this glass container that makes me think it is freshly squeezed. I think we both decided that these were the freshest greyhounds we'd ever had. 

Remember to clearly say that you want the HH special or else they give you better quality vodka and charge you more. I'm sorry but if there's a HH I'm taking full advantage.
author: Lydia W.

description:
Normally I'm not a fan of dimly lit bars, but it works for Laszlo.

Though the prices aren't necessarily cheap, Laszlo manages to balance perfectly between hip and low-key. I never feel under or overdressed here. 

Their margaritas and other cocktails are fresh and strong. The bartenders are quick, and I always find that my cheeks ache from smiling and laughing too much, the moment I step inside. 

Maybe it's the drinks. The consistently cool company. Or the warm dark hue of the place, softening the sheen of leather cushioned stools, but whatever it is -  Laszlo has always been the start of a solid good night.
author: Jessica T.

description:
How little did I know I've actually been to this place more than once. The last time I've been here, I was with some girl friends sitting at the lower floor corner with the place bring crazy packed. So fast forward about 3-4 years later. It seems like this place haven't changed at all. For this second time, I came for a film screening that was put together by a consultant company. Just like before, I walk through the wooden doors and the bar right immediately to the left. The place is very dim, there's a staircase at the very end of the room that leads to what looks like a second floor. Except, it's really just a narrow walkway for a few extra seating, so you can say it's more like a long balcony. It is a small place so I don't think this place will ever be space free unless there is a private party here. They might their drinks pretty strong here so you get your money worth for the alcohol.

This place is very cozy, kind of remain me a little bit of a cabin with dashes of modern touches. I really liked the atmosphere especially when the crowd are pretty much young professionals so I blend just right in. Good place to come for a few drinks with friends and coworkers. They also offer happy hours.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
After an amazing unofficial Tom R event at Jay n Bee's bar in the Mission this evening, a group of yelpers and meetup.com'ers decided to go to Laszlo this evening.  This was my first time here and to be honest, I was really impressed with the place and the professionalism of the staff.  Well, up to a certain point that is.

As I was hanging with my friends and having a fantastic time, I turned around and noticed that my more than half full drink had suddenly disappeared.  Now everyone that knows me knows that I am the nicest guy and tonight especially, I had plenty of money so I wasn't trying to milk drinks, but all of a sudden, my more than half full drink was gone.  I super nicely and politely asked the bartender and bar back what happened to my drink and his response shocked the h#ll out of me.  I just couldn't understand it.  The bar back was really nice and professional and told me that he would never take my drink which was less than half full and I believed him.  He, like the bouncer, had the demeanor and attitude befitting an establishment such as this.  The bartender, whose name was confirmed numerous times this evening as Phil, was a total d#ck.

What really breaks my heart and I bet even he could confirm this, is that I was so nice in the way I went about asking about my missing drink.  I was super polite and tactful in the way I asked about what happened to my drink, but in the process, another yelper (whose name per her request shall remain anonymous) mentioned yelp, upon which the bartender literally said out loud in front of everyone, "F#CK YELP, I DON'T GIVE A SH#T ABOUT YELP!"  Hello...I don't need that.

I didn't want any grief or drama and calmly walked away from this classless individual, upon which some other people of our group got into it with him and I later found out that he then took away a full drink of another friend and yelper.

I found the whole situation embarassing and didn't need the drama, but as I left the bar by my own choice, I did explain the actions of the unpleasant and unexplanably unprofessional and obnoxious bartender with other Laszlo staff and was told more than once, "Oh yes, Phil is always that way!  WTF!

The other day, a close friend and fellow Yelper jokingly gave me a hard time that I have not had too many negative reviews since becoming Elite five months ago.  Well, I explained how I always try to lean towards the positive as opposed to the negative, but here's one for the books.  

Ultimately, here's the understatement of the year...I was not impressed!  Too bad, since I really liked the place and had this not happened, I most certainly would have given the place at least a four, most likely five.  Phil...you suck!  Too bad, because had this not happened, I really liked the place.  Yelpers, take heed...we are not wanted here.
author: Roy N.

description: Love this little spot next to Foreign Cinema, mostly for the nod to Russian Cosmonaut-esque art.
author: Amber K.

description:
Stopped in on a random Wednesday night which was great, however my douche-dar tells me that this place is entirely different on the weekend nights... if only from the spillover from Medjool (is that place really still aorund?).

Bar service was skilled and professional with an interesting cocktail list to try something different if the mood strikes.

Decor was nice... dark and trendy, but not overly stuffy or overly divey.  Will definitely visit again on the weeknights, but would not take the chance of heading here on a weekend.
author: Kevin F.

description:
I have to say, when Laszlo is empty it's a pretty enjoyable place.  You can actually talk over the loud music and there's room to move around.  Plus you can't beat the $2 beer at happy hour.

I guess it will be back to packed after the holidays....
author: Jean K.

description:
Need a fix before noon on a Saturday? Photoshoot perhaps? ;)

Great use of space. It was HOT in the city this Saturday but COOL in here. Friendly people having a Chimay, oysters and some gentle conversation! 

Need some privacy? Head upstairs. 

I had fun in SF this weekend!
author: Lily M.

description:
4 of us walked in and my friend requested to see what was their happy hour specials.  The lady behind the bar said stoli and tummer.  My friend goes can we get 4 tummers and 2 stoli sodas.  She goes you can't double fist buddy, smirks, and walks away.  The reason why my friend ordered two extra beers was because the service is extremely slow.  It took a good 10 minutes before we got served and the bar wasn't even that full.

For a mission st bar, just because you are next to foreign cinema doesn't make you that great of a bar.  It feels very pretentious.  It feels as though I'm in the Marina district.  It feels as though they are in the Marina district.  But......if you walked outside.there is a vacant old  abandon theatre, low riders, drunks and drug dealers.

It just felt kinda weird in there.  It's a cool place, don't get me wrong.  They just gotta lose the attitude.  Just because you put up a few candles around the place and have a dj playing doesn't make you a high end lounge.

YOU ARE STILL A DIVE BAR!!!!
author: jason g.

description:
We stopped by here for a surprise Bday party and was pretty impressed with the upstairs. Yeah... it's small and narrow but it was secluded from the rest of the bar and I sat by the window where you can see most of Mission which was cool. 
The drinks were pretty good and the bartender was friendly - well to me he was but not to the guys of the group - Ha! I liked that they served wine and it seemed like most of the people in the bar were drinking that as well so I didn't feel foolish ordering it - They had a decent house Cab. 
The atmosphere was really chill, which I liked, and seemed to be a tamer crowd. I'll be up to trying the bar out again soon.
author: Kelly T.

description:
Girl: What? 
.
.
.
You like my breasts? 
.
.
.
You want to get in my pants? 
.
.
.
Me: No, no...I said do you want to be frien...
.
.
.
*Gets drink poured on face and slapped silly* 

I want to love this place but they blast the music SO LOUD that it's hard to have conversations with friends. Also the space is fairly compact for a big crowd. :-/ 

Happy farewell to Michelle though!
author: Kenny L.

description:
A beautiful interior coupled with drinks that get you where you're going make Laszlo a perfect choice. I dig the upstairs, especially on a pretty night when a soft breeze floats through an open window and instantly reminds you of everything that is right about the world.

UPDATE 4/26/2006:
Returned to Laszlo last night for the first time in a long time. As soon as I walked in, I remember why I so loved this place. Dark, but not too dark. Great bartender. Wintergreen mints on the counter for the taking in the women's bathroom. Happy hour lasts from 6-9 with $4 cosmos!
author: Miriam W.

description: If you don't have the identifiable douchey hipster look or are a female, good luck getting service here! Walked out after being ignored for 5 minutes while sitting right in front on the bartender! He made 4 elaborate drinks for hipsters/females and took food orders while my thirsty non-hipster looking ass sat there waiting to quench my thirst with a beer! Goodbye :)
author: Chris M.

description:
We went there because we were too early for dinner at Foreign Cinema on a Sunday night. So we decided to hit Laszio--never hurts to get in a couple of drinks before your dinner! :) Actually, the event was to celebrate our friend's birthday, so drinks were mandatory. Because it was a Sunday evening, the bar was a little under half full, but nonetheless the atmosphere was still bar-like. The lighting was grungy dark, but had a kind of trendy characteristic to it with some pictures hanging on the wall. The bartenders were very friendly. 

I think that between 6 and 9 was happy hour. Stoli is one of my favorite vodkas, so it was awesome that it was part of the happy hour. $5 Stoli shots! We also ordered birthday cake shots, for the birthday boy--which was around $10-11 each shot. The shot was very tasty--exactly like a chocolate cake.

Overall, I was amazed to find a pretty cool bar in the area I was in, and it's nice that it's right next to Foreign Cinema.
author: Vera W.

description: Really like this place because of the decor, ambience, and drinks. They were playing old-school movies from the 40s and 50s on a huge projector wall which makes for great entertainment and conversation. I was there with a group of friends but it definitely seems like a good enough ambience for a dates as you can grab a little corner for drinks and what not.
author: Carl N.

description:
This bar seemed pretty decent. We stopped by here for Sonic Living's hosting of a happy hour. They paid for the beer for an hour so I can't say if the prices are good or not. The decor was inviting and there were lots of places to sit if you get there early enough. The tunes were pretty good. It had kind of a hip hop feel to it. I'd probably stop in here again.

I guess they're owned by Foreign Cinema so I've sampled a few of their drinks. Pretty tasty.
author: Amy J.

description:
Did you know? You can get Foreign Cinema food here but without the fuss. I like snacking on the warm olives, but you can go 'full on' and order anything off the menu. One time I ate the fried chicken entrée at the bar and it was AMAZING. It was one of the best things I've ever eaten.

I also really like the brunch menu here. It's amazing. Try the croque-madame. It is so good I want one right now.

Andrew and Gale are kick-ass bartenders.
author: Klevin D.

description:
I'm embarrassed to be the Duchess and not have a review! No wonder I don't deserve that "Master" badge...

What more can be said about Laszlos? It's where I begin my nights. It's where I end my nights. It's just that kind of establishment. Bartenders are always super chill, clientele is never douchey, and for some reason, I just really love those skateboards on the wall. The best part is sharing the restroom with Foreign Cinema. Many a times, I've drunkenly stumbled into that hallway with the hostess staring at me, and then busting into the restroom to find well-dressed, classy women powdering their noses after their fine-dining experience.
author: Susan L.

description:
Cool vibe here, good people watching, generous bartenders, not all hipster, worth checking out before dinner at Foreign Cinema or as its own adventure.

The end.
author: Athena S.

description:
At first I didn't think Laszlo and I had that much in common.  It was so dark and metallic and decorated with random Russian paraphernalia.  I am none of those things.  (Well not usually anyway).

But then I realized that we did share a few things in common.  A distaste for crowds, a love for cool DJs such as DJ Robynn who was spinning that night, and a fondness for Captain Jack Sparrow (aka the bartender).  Aw yeah.
author: Amy C.

description: I don't I would've ever come here if I weren't dining at Foreign Cinema. I like that this dimly lit bar has a sort of speakeasy feel to it, but I also sensed a pretentious feel too. The bartender was none the too helpful and there wasn't really a cocktail menu anywhere so I guess they just do the usual well drinks and cocktails. It can also be confusing that what is served here does not match the Foreign Cinema menus lying around. One good thing is that there is a $2 special from 6-9 pm on bottled Trumer Pils.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Any chance to hang out with the beautiful Kristina A. and her posse of power is a one that i don't pass up. This spot is small and intimate and has a very warm and lounge-y feel to it. Upstairs was even warmer, and I mean like you would break a sweat if you had to sit up there. That was the only complaint about this spot is the fact that I felt like roast duck due to the temperature. Then again it may have been the wonderful talent that Kristina attracts that was getting my temp up. 

PS. Todd B would not stop talking about the Pineapple sky special with his pinkie finger in the air...dunno what that means. I am new to the city. ;-)
author: Dru P.

description:
Laszlo is a cool little scene in the Mission, complete with:

$2 Trumers til 9
$5 Pineapple Sky Cocktails after 9

The crowd varies, I have met chill peeps, non-chill LA chicks that like to strike a pose and are waiting for their big break ( wrong city, love). The narrow upstairs is a cool but mad hot area if you're trying to escape the rush. 

Plus, you can't go wrong with a bar that plays " The Holy Mountain" via projector on a Saturday night. 

Whatcha know about " Santa Sangre"??
author: Taj A.

description:
I will say up front that i definitely need to return to gather some more info for a proper review. I stopped in here with the wifey to round out our Happy Hour crawl through the Mission one friday. $2 Trumer Pils was calling me. so here goes. 

Atmosphere (4): Seemed pretty cool and hip. Definitely comfy, pretty clean, lots of light (I hate drinking in the dark). 

Clientele (3): There wasn't anything wrong with the people here, there just weren't very many. A lot of the nearby places had a lot of people, but it seems that this place does not get going until later maybe? Not a big problem for me, but i do like a lively happy hour environment. 

Food (N/A): Didn't try any and not sure that they have any. 

Drinks (Incomplete): Not sure how the selection is, but it seems that they had a full bar. Not sure that I saw any draft beers, but again, i still have to explore and update. 

Value (5): $2 beers, $5 vodka. Even i can afford that. 

Service (4): Fast and efficient on my visit. Could have been more friendly I guess, but now we're splitting hairs. 

Wifey's two cents: "This place is dead, lets roll."
author: Miguel V.

description: I dig it.. Whenever I hit up the Mission, I make Laszlo my first drink(s) stop.. it's a great place to meet up with your peeps.. You can spy on the crowd from up above while you enjoy the cool Lazlo vibe, with movies playing on the concrete wall, upstairs balcony, and 90's beats to get you in the pre-party mood. Cocktails are decent, and the crowd is not overwhelming.
author: Sara F.

description: Pretty crummy bar.  The space is great and the music was good but the cocktails were really lacking.  We ordered an old fashioned which was way sweet and watery, and a banana daiquiri.  She brought the drink and after tasting it said, "I hope you like sour drinks".  She offered to make it again and said she would reread the recipe - a bad sign.  Anyway, the second version was just as bad.  She ended up comping the drink since it was her first time making it. This place didn't live up to the high standard achieved by the adjoining Foreign Cinema. So two stars for now but it could be a go-to spot if they can get their drinks dialed in.
author: Lee W.

description: Guys, you can order the same menu that's at Foreign Cinema. So, while sitting at the bar, with great service, I can be munching on delicious, fancy fried chicken. What's better than that? Right?
author: Turi F.

description:
Dim lighting and cool mirrors hanging behind the bar greet you as you walk into Laszlo. 

Ideally positioned adjacent to Foreign Cinema, Laszlo offers a hip, (albeit) very loud environment. Drinks are served up in a timely fashion and made fairly well. The bartenders seem to genuinely enjoy mixing up cocktails and dancing around. 

Would like to go back for their happy hour which sounds like a great deal lasting until 9pm. Nice mix of people and pretty chill vibe.
author: Theresa T.

description:
1 star for the bomb djs throwin it down @ Lazlo.

Came here to show some love for the sick djs and also have a buttery nipple & mojito. The drinks were not very good and pricey (like all bars & clubs). The service wasn't all that either. The place gets packed as hell on Friday nights, and the place is hella tiny. The pictures on their website & on yelp made the place look pretty decent in size, but it was hard to even move like sardines in a can.
author: T t.

description:
brunch on a saturday:

house made pop tarts,

bloody marys w/pickled veggies,

hang over soup (a tomato based soup w/bread and eggs)

all delicious. 

Actually, the food was so good I stopped caring our bartender seemed to be in a bad mood. 

A great spot to hit up if Foreign Cinema is packed but you're still looking for some killer brunch.
author: Amber Elizabeth M.

description: Really cheap beer on tap during happy hour.  Great atmosphere but I can say their food absolutely sucks.
author: Janis P.

description:
Here's my shortest review ever:



This bar sucks!


====================================================



What's that? Not enough info? OK, for my yelp friends I'll give some more details.

Laszlo is too Pretentious for Mission St., the drinks are terrible, the service is unfriendly, the crowd is mostly Valencia corridor douches that wish they lived in the Marina, and the worst offense of all is that they don't offer Anchor Steam in any form.

The only bar I like less is Medjool, this little area is a blight on the neighborhood.

I will have to be dragged in here to ever come back.
author: Manny F.

description:
Laszlo is a nicer looking bar in the Mission, There is nothing wrong with that. We went to Laszlo after visiting Medjool, continuing a nice night of bar hopping.  They had a nice bar, a nice selection of booze, the atmosphere was a cool laid back vibe, the music was nice and it wasn't too loud where you couldn't talk. We were there on a Friday night and it wasn't terribly crowded, which was nice. They had a second floor balcony type area which helped disperse people around the bar. You could look down on to everyone below you. It reminded me of a couple of places in San Diego. 

     Finally,  A good thing was the prices were reasonable for a nicer looking bar in the Mission area. Definitely a plus.
author: Archie N.

description:
I've been to Laszlo a few times, so when my friend Z invited me to Après-dinner drinks, I was helk yah I'll come out.   Walked out of my place on a rainy Juneuary night, and bam there's a cab.  WTF!  $10 later and I get to Laszlo, a bit on the early side considering I was factoring a 30 minute wait for a grumpy cab ride.

Bartender hooks me up with an awesome German bier on tap, and pours  into a COLD glass!  For $5, I was a happy camper.  The interior was dark, grimey, but with that feeling of being safe/chill and away from the elements.  The walls have skateboard-designs hanging on them, and they just started playing the classic Marlon Brando film, 'The Wild One.'  All the meanwhile, an average DJ plays some mixes of 80's, 90's, and other stuff.

A little time goes by, the friends show up, more friends show up, and other people show up and become friends!  A good time, and the drinks, prices, and friendly cool bartenders made it a fun night fo'sho.
author: Mark K.

description:
Funky Russian themed bar. Its a standard bar wearing an ushanka hat. 

The style of the place is cool. Russian paintings on the wall. Its looks cool and they have these skateboard decks with their name painted on them everywhere. Its neat and the bartenders are cool.

But like I said, its a bar.
author: Kevin D.

description: Came here when it was open for amazing sandwiches at lunchtime. Very friendly service!!! House cured meats... yum! Highly recommended any time of day for any meal.
author: Donna C.

description:
Ducked in here last night for a quick bevvy on the way to meeting Big G. There were only about 3 customers in there but the service was still slow. The bartender (Wolverine wanna-be) was unfriendly and didn't remember that I like my martinis DRY (I mean, c'mon, there were about 5 people in there at that point - it's not *that* hard to remember) so the second one was undrinkable (I left it on the bar - not like me to leave good vodka behind). 

It seems to me, judging from other Yelp reviews, that the manager knows about the shitty service and snotty bartenders, but don't do anything about it. If it were *my* bar, I'd can the mofo. There are plenty of people out there who need a job. 

I'll take my hard earned $$ elsewhere, thank you very much.
author: Mi M.

description:
The bf, our friends, and I ended up here at the end of the night on NYE, which turned out to be the best way to end the night: drunk and dancing to old school funk. FOR FREE.

Admittedly, watching people grind up on each other while singing "We Are Family" is a bit awkward, but I guess it's kind of fitting for the whole Communist theme.  

We did have to wait a while at the bar to get our drinks, but at this point, we were in no hurry to get our drink on.  The drinks were pretty reasonably priced, especially for such a clean place, but my gin and tonic was a bit on the weak side.  Yes, even 5 drinks later, I could tell. 

It was overly crowded downstairs, so we headed up to the upstairs seating area where we could dance up on posters of Lenin.  HOT.  Who doesn't want to spend NYE getting their freak on with a bald mustachioed man?
author: Jen L.

description:
Met Brian who is the bar and restaurant manager when I came here for the first time a few nights ago, he was warm, welcoming and showed a genuine interest in all of his customers at the bar. We informed him that we were first timers and he gave us the run down, what the restaurant was like and so forth. We liked this place so much that we came back the next night.

Cant wait to come here again. Thanks Brian
author: Lisa W.

description:
A small space for a bar that I wish had more room to accommodate a dance floor of some sort. Oh well, I had to settle for dancing in my seat. 

Seating downstairs is more like bar seating (no seats actually at the bar); it is limited but luckily someone in our group got there early so we were able to snatch up enough seating for 7 total.

Dim lighting but that's to be expected during a night out on the town. 

The highlight of Laszlo was the music (at least for the night I was there, which was a Thursday) - lots of 90s hip hop & R&B. Can't go wrong with drinks and listening to music that brings about intense nostalgia.

If you're looking for the restroom, there's one downstairs. Head all the way to the back and go through the door next to the right side of the bar.

If you're hungry at 1am, you might just bump into the lady with the small hot dog cart.
author: April P.

description: Wow. Douchey bartender came around and *aggressively* took the drinks right out of my friends' hands right at closing. I understand you want to get home, nothing against that. But it could have been handled a little more politely if you care about repeat visitors, word of mouth recommendations, etc.
author: Stephen L.

description:
Went here on a Saturday night for some drinks. We were there on the early side before the crowd started to build, and really liked it. 

The best part is that they serve Foreign Cinema's dinner menu so we were able to have some awesome food after downing some drinks, without needing a reservation :) Go early if you want to do this though. Once the Saturday night crowd comes in, it's a little too crazy to be eating in the bar.
author: Rosie S.

description:
I have been here twice now. Once was for my 26 birthday which I remember 20% of the night and the other was after our holiday party last year.

I will base my review on my latter experience for obvious reasons. The place its self is a pretty standard bar with a good selection of booze and a laid back atmosphere. It's a little bit more upscale considering the area. Drink prices are reasonable and it gets pretty busy on a Saturday night.

ahhh Laszlo, I will never forget you.
author: Jeff P.

description:
Loved the music (all my faves from late 80s & 90s), which was well mixed.  Ambiance was cool and industrial.  Drinks were really really strong (good or bad?)  

Reason for only 3 stars:  it was so loud I had to scream right into my friend's ear.  Made it hard to socialize.
author: Hanna D.

description: Drinks are pretty pricey for a small bar, but the atmosphere is great.  Great djs spinning all types of hip-hop.  Couldn't stop dancing while chatting it up with the other patrons.
author: Scottie P.

description:
I came here for an after dinner birthday celebration with a coworker and her other party-goers.

Before I write anything, I should say I'm not really into the bar scene. I tolerate it, but it's not something I actively pursue.

With that said, I did enjoy this bar despite it being cramped for space. The classic film shown on the side of the wall with subtitles was interesting, and I also liked how it had the upper floor (albeit even more cramped than the bar level).

Drinks were a little expensive. 3 dollars for a can of Tecate? I didn't order it in the manly, raspy voice like in the commercials because I felt it was busting my balls.

Probably wont go again. Just too many people in a cramped bar with few tables.
author: Shaun D.

description: I'd always only been in here before or after Foreign Cinema, but I'm not saying that in any sort of a bad way. It's cozy and friendly, with great drinks, not douchey unless there's a bunch of douchebags waiting or having just eaten at Foreign Cinema, or if it's the weekend. But the latter is everywhere. The upstairs is pretty keen and a friend of ours rented it out for a party. It was solid and the people from Lazlo were jammin', so much so, we were Salsa dancing drunk, at which point, I think someone bought a pumpkin. Go figure...
author: Roy M.

description:
Really nice atmosphere- $2 beers before 9PM.  Will most certainly stop here again next crawl through the Mission.

Watch out for the bent or squishy aluminum looking chairs- one with a broken leg tried to topple my friend.  I loved the giant mirror above the bar.
author: Jeff M.

description: Great place to pop in after dinner (or brunch, ahem) at Foreign Cinema and keep the party going.
author: Amber W.

description:
An oasis of class and style amid the normally dirty and overcrowded Mission District. They have a great selection of top-shelf liquor and skilled bartenders. There's usually even seats to be had on a Friday or Saturday night. 

Another great thing about this bar is the DJs. Anything from funky hip-hop to old school soul. You might hear some Queen or Mamas and Papas off an original 45 single. Laszlo is quality all around.
author: Aaron V.

description:
This place is small and narrow.  It's a bar that's between fancy and dive.  They have sitting upstairs but the space was  too small, but I guess if you are into coziness, this could work.  

Hard to find parking.  We parked like 5-6 blocks from it.  Drinks are ok.  Music was awesome!
author: Pam S.

description:
pro-tip: sidle up to the bar at laszlo on a saturday or sunday to sip on tasty mimosas and order food off of the foreign cinema menu.

the bartenders are sweethearts and there's always plenty of room to bring a group of friends for brunch.
author: Kristen A.

description: Can't remember much about the place or the drinks but had bad experiences at the door and as they were closing.  The guy checking ID at the door gave me a hard time asking if the ID was real.  Then as they were closing, they took the drink from my friend's hand before he was done.  Kind of rude...
author: Carrie L.

description:
One time I came here these two girls ventured in from probably next door (Medjool's), thought they were the shits, went straight upstairs, hopped the rope, and started partying on the couch.

After a while, the burly bartender guy walked upstairs and told them they weren't supposed to be there. The two vapid girls kind of blew him off and continued to do their thing and the guy raised his voice and threw them out. +4 

Show'em who's boss.
author: Ken L.

description:
RUDEST BARTENDERS..... did not open up the upstairs even tho it was crowded. The guy with long hair and two braids kept banging the door to the bar and pushing everyone out.
Should not work at a bar if you cannot handle crowds.
author: nit p.

description: Laszlo is one of my favorite bars in the Mish..the vibe is typically good..even on weekends. Last weekend we made an escape to here  after a less than desirable experience at Medjool..it was our saving grace. The bar is connected to Foreigh Cinema so so it's always nice to swing by after dinner.
author: Mimi T.

description: The bar is a bar. The staff is nice and there's plenty of seating. I may have been here in the past, but I don't remember. This time I was here for a wedding reception. Lots of selection so don't get hung up looking at everything. They have what you want. I'll probably come back here to check out the full compliment again.
author: Andrew Y.

description: I love this place! Such a cute hidden gem on the side skirt of Foreign Cinema. Brian, the bartender, rocks... and the menu is fantastic!  The duck pate & duck sausage was delishhhh... Totally worth the calories on the hips. Ha.
author: Uyen N.

description:
I believe that the rating should be given for the overall quality of the establishment, including their policies and staff. So why the 1 star? I've been to Lazslo once before, on a weeknight, and actually found it pleasant enough at the time. It was decently busy, but not loud, with good drinks and interesting Eastern Bloc-style posters on the walls. Last night, however, has completely destroyed this opinion.

I came here with a few friends, including Gene X., to meet two others, but there was a $5 cover charge that we weren't too hot about, so we headed to Doc's Clock down the street. Later, at 1:30am, we went back to Lazslo to try and meet our friends again for one final drink of the night. Did we get in? No. Still a $5 cover charge and still a door guy in dress pants and running shoes with an attitude. What the hell were they charging the cover for exactly? Some janky club music played over blown-out sound system? Because Medjool is next door? Better shoes for the door guy? Who knows, but Lazslo, I've got news for you: Mission is chock full of bars that are more interesting, have better music, and are happy to take our money for a decent drink. I won't be back. Ever.

Did I mention it was raining this whole night? Damn.
author: Andrei Z.

description:
Hip tv, Pay close attention to it, it looks old school :)

I went there for happy hour and it was chill. I dont know how it is at night, but in the afternoon around 6:30, it was pleasant. 

HH specials were good too and well priced.

Great thing about it is that it's part of Foreign Cinema so you can order food there too
author: Eric A.

description:
Laszlo has good bloody marys. This is important to know if you are unfortunate enough to poison your taste buds with a bloody mary that tastes more like a dogs ass from the nearby Medjool rooftop cafe. Laszlo will make it all better, I promise. 

They will also make life a little better should you have to wait an unreasonably long amount of time for a table at their neighboring restaurant Foreign Cinema. I highly recommend waiting though, instead of doing practical things like making reservations, and letting Laszlo take care of your alcohol consumption needs because what is a yummy brunch or dinner without a little bit of an alcohol buzz? 

But wait, there's more. Laszlo is not just the bar that will rescue you when its neighbors are letting you down. Laszlo is concrete and steel and industrial looking and has an upstairs where you can hide from people you don't like. It also has all sorts of cocktails with communist drink names, none of which I can remember, all priced capitalistically, to remind us of just how lucky we are.
author: Drue C.

description:
Let's just say that you were out prowling the town.  

(No, this story IS NOT about me and I am not a cougar yet (what age does that start at, anyway?), though I strongly aspire to be one as they dominate the sexual food chain).

You spend your day drowning your feelings of inadequacy in what you think at the time is decent champagne all the while batting your eyelashes at whoever looks your way.  And I mean, whoever...

Turns out, it wasn't champagne.  It was actually sparkling apple juice because the guy you were chatting up didn't have the flow to spend on the amount of champagne you were capable of drinking and after those 4 vodka sodas, one vicodin and 2 shots of Jaeger you beer bonged, it tasted like Cristal anyway.

You somehow find yourself at Lazlo because 1. there weren't enough slicked back hair, chain wearing, 22 year old striped shirt jockeys for you at Medjool.  Because 2. You're too drunk to know where you are.  But 3 and MOST importantly, everyone looks better in the dark.  Including your hot mess.

Check it out.  It's where the people who weren't pretty enough at Sky Terrace go to make-out.

And when I say make-out, I mean you might see boobs.
author: Rachel G.

description:
Bad Boyz came here on a Sunday. What a mistake? 

We hope to find more entertaining people here but failed. I made conversations with old people. That's not so amusing. We did however came up with a business plan. We are going to be rich and famous someday so we decided our company's name and mission. That is, to get AWESOME!  

They do have drinks specials daily from 6pm to 9pm, however they failed to mention that to us. The only thing I saw was Trummers for $2.  I should of listen to Tiff, don't come here on Sundays. Anyway, we went over to Elbo and that was certainly better.

So guys and girls, every Sunday the Bad Boyz of Yelp are going out and partying, look for us on the talks, it's always last minute but always fun.
author: Stanley K.

description:
This is perhaps my favorite bar in San Francisco. I have gotten dates (not something I normally do at bars), met new friends, had awesome times with current friends, and even danced a bit.

They usually also have the best music of any place I frequent in the city. No matter what genre, they usually pick some awesome DJs. 

I also enjoy the Commie theme and especially the upstairs area. I perch up there and smugly look down on everyone else until I see something (or someone) who compels me to come down.

This is definitely my turf. Back off!
author: Ryan V.

description:
In Russian, Laszlo means dumbest bar in the Mission. Honestly, this place is utter crap. Who decided being Russian is the new trendy thing anyway? 

Let's just get a few things straight. Putting up fake Soviet propaganda posters does not make you cool. Calling your Mojito an I Am Cuba does not make you cool, nor Russian. Making that mojito like crap - I suppose was slightly cool & Russian - but I didn't enjoy that either. 

This place just screams Wannabe. If there is any tell-tale sign that Mission won't be hip in 5 years, it's the up croppings of a place like this. I'm not hip. I'm 180 degrees opposite of hip and I was practically the coolest person there. iBankers in blazers in the Mission? 

I don't want to hear dorks talking about trailing P/E ratios while ordering their I Am Cubas. If I'm in the Mission, I want to overhear people talking about the time they strangled a pirate off the coast of Peru and then spent 5 days cliff-diving and eating spider monkeys while smoking peyote.

And, Laszlo, get some real drinks. How about a full flask of warm vodka  with a stick of rotten black licorice for a straw. That would be hip. You could call it The Stalin.
author: Tom C.

description:
Dance club? Really? Where? Hmmm.

Well there was no booty shakin for me here last night, but there was plenty of entertainment in the form of white man's overbite. Wow, was it a middle age man single mixer last night or what? Besides our party of cool Internet dorks (yes, I am an Internet dork too) there was just a slew of dudes wearing North Face jackets and khaki pants. Ooof. Definitely not my type of guy.

The place however was awesome. I really liked the decor and the sort punk rock vibe and element to it. The bartenders were also really nice and poured well and the drinks seemed reasonably priced. The bathrooms were pretty nasty, but at least the women who come here know better than to piss all over the seat. What is with that anyway? If you are going to do the hover, at least lift the whole damn seat up. What were you raised by squatting wolves?
author: Stephy S.

description: Cool and friendly bartenders. I think they dish up 2-3 dollar Trumers at certain hours...
author: Jim B.

description:
i usually only go there on sunday nights (actually, almost every sunday night)

Go-go is the sweetest bartender ever!!!
author: Thömas F.

description:
Holly sh!t.  A comunist bar in SF.  If these guys had really lived under communism, they wouldn't glorify it so much.

Still, I like the commie posters, allover the place. It gives me some nostalgia back of the days where I had to see them everyday at school, at my neighborhood, at the bus station. 
Lenin, the nameless soviet socialist worker hero,  the rusian chicks working for the good of the party and the country.

I came in here with friends from out of the state, and they loved it.  We had a lot to drinkt, and we noticed that the chicks in here were not even looking at us.

No wonder. This is a major lesbian spot for happy hour.  We didn't know it, but still ened up chatting with a couple of girls that were there for a bachelorette party.

Good times
author: Ardit B.

description:
I am not totally sure why this is listed under "dance club" there isn't really any place to dance BUT I do like this little bar. 

A small place tucked between Medjool and Foreign Cinema - actually its attached to foreign cinema and you go in a side door to use its bathroom. 

The has a narrow wall of stools and a main bar. There is a tiny upstairs with some seating as well that overlooks the bar. No cover and drinks aren't too bad $6 for vodka/soda. Good music but way hard to hear and talk - and we got a  place to sit.

This place was PACKED at 1030pm - to the point of not fun had you no table area to sit and stand. I dont get the theme... Russia? Communism?

They also play randomass movies projected onto the large back wall... always a good talking point.
author: Jessica L.

description:
What coaxed me out on a Tuesday night after a long plane ride, over 2 weeks of travel, and very little sleep? This peppar vodka martini drink thing at Laszlo.  It's amazing.....so amazing I don't remember the name.


Great bar, great location. Have dinner at Foreign Cinema and stroll in here afterwards for the peppar vodka martini drink 'thing'.
author: k. w.

description:
The Laszlo I saw isn't nearly as great as it looks in these Yelp photos. A lot darker, more run-down looking. It's really small and gets crowded. The floor upstairs is more like a balcony with tables, not a full floor, so it doesn't alleviate the space shortage. Those you are sharing the space with do not care to look around them and will not apologize if they bump into you or flip their hair into your drink.  The DJ, whoever he was that night, was not on top of keeping the levels; the basses came out muted and treble tracks spiked harshly. It was painful. The guy after him wasn't even using the turntable - he just hooked up his Apple laptop and I could have sworn he was playing off of his mp3 playlist. Also, I'm told they serve food here, but when I asked for a menu the bartenders said no food.

Props to the friendly people standing outside. They were welcoming to all strangers. The beers, though limited, were only about 4 bucks, which I'd say is a decent price. And the crowd, at least that night, were all 20s-30s... no creepy old desperate men, and everyone looked stylish.
author: Clar L.

description:
I love this space.  I don't know if it's having an architect for a boyfriend or just too many drinks, but I really appreciate how this place is designed.  Good drinks, good people.  I like it.

***UPDATE:
Minus one star.
I went back for happy hour.  (*What* happy hour?)  The special(s) consist of one (1) dollar off on one (1) shit beer.  And the place is deserted.
author: Christine M.

description:
Came here for a photo shoot over the weekend. I don't know what it is about bars, but they don't look good in the daylight. They are much sexier in the darkness. Yeah baby... 

The place is small, but cute. I LOVE the upstairs part. Very dark and gives you the VIP feel. Jack was our bartender on Sunday. He was awesome. And very cute. Thanks Jack!! 

I'll need to come back here after the sun sets. TBC...
author: Jen D.

description:
Every Sunday is Propaganda Night and it's quite the lovely way to wind down the weekend. Laszlo has a few tables and chairs set up in front and on a nice San Francisco night, it's absolutely perfect for good drinks and conversations. 

The plus is that the bar area is spacious and the service is quick. Downside is that there really isn't much of a dance floor, but they do feature DJ's every Sunday night. The bathrooms are shared by Foreign Cinema but the plus is that there are plenty of stalls. 

My advice...arrive early if you want to snag a sitting area and enjoy a relaxing atmosphere but arrive late if you want to get some fancy footwork in on the dance floor. 

Oh and side note, Chimay here is only $6 here instead of the usually $9 at other places.
author: MJ T.

description: I love drinking at Laszlo, strong drinks, and connected to Foreign Cinema too. They have a low-key happy hour, but it gets crazy on the weekends. The upstairs is fun to people watch down below.
author: Nish N.

description:
I am not cool enough for this bar...that said, I still went and did my thing amoungst the Hipsters...

I went and caught Mingus on the decks, had a few beers and railed against the fact that it was only Monday - gotta love drinking on a Monday!

The Soviet Era art is a nice touch to go with the whole Eastern European feel that the place evokes. Another key feature that I love is that you can go out front with a beer in hand and catch a smoke if you are so inclined.

Cool little joint it might even make it onto the list for a DYL Happy Hour...
author: Todd E.

description:
As you may know, weekday happy hours are my lifeblood. So I enjoy mainlining places like Laszlo on a calm Tuesday or Wednesday evening, when you can spend some quality time alone with a great bartender (and when I say great that ain't no fucking joke - he gave us happy hour prices on non-happy hour beer) and some great people who, if you had known them in the eighth grade, you may have smoked an illicit cigarette with in the girls bathroom during sixth period. 

Laszlo is also an excellent place to stage the revolution, with their World War Lite decor (dig the mid-century replica TV and antique communications equipment) and super-elite mezzanine level good for top secret negotiations. And the 70's family-photo slideshow on the wall intermixed with stills from Battlestar Galactica was oddly familiar. Maybe because I have a big stuck-in-the-70's family. Or watch too much BSG. Or whatever.

Non-happy hour prices are a little much for the neighborhood, but on the plus side, you get to use Foreign Cinema's bathroom. So it evens out.
author: Megan W.

description:
So my girlfriend was in town from Hawaii, interviewing for a job in SF and she wanted me to show her around the Mission because that's the neighborhood she'd probably want to live in.  

So we did dinner at Destino (which was great btw) and I wrote down a list of possible bars to take her to in the Mission.  Zeitgeist was out because it was freezing balls outside.  It was too early in the night to check out Little Baobab.  Bruno's was a bit too lo-key for me...and I was too sober to really enjoy the uniqueness that is Amnesia.  

So, even though I'd never been there before, I decided to go to Lazlo's cause I had heard great things about it.   Good decision.  The bar was pretty crowded for a weeknight but i didn't have to wait too long to be served.  Drink were reasonably priced ($6) and strong. The music was quite fun - and yes, I do know all of the words to Digital Underground's Freaks of the Industry.  Good job DJ.  I also ended up randomly seeing some co-workers at Lazlos and bar hopped with them for the rest of the night.  Maybe, when my girlfriend moves to SF next year, this will be one of our favorite local hangouts...
author: LaSha G.

description:
I love the space at Laszlo- multi-level, narrow, brick-lined, glowing candle-light, sexy industrial theme. The bottom floor is classic bar, the top loft balcony level a bit more loungey with low seating and a curtained off area for canoodling (if so inclined). The drinks are solid too - some of the best motha-f-ing mojitos I've had in this city. 

Despite all this, I've never really connected with the place, and I'm not sure why. Perhaps its the proximity to Medjool that turns me off. Perhaps it was the crowd/vibe whenever I've gone. Or perhaps it was the icy-cold reception I last received when I bumped into a friend and his very possessive ladyfriend (Relax! I am NOT trying to steal your guy!). 

Despite the turn-offs, I'm sure I'll be back. It's too damn convenient, and those mojitos, too damn good. And yes, I'll keep my hands off your man.
author: Umami Y.

description:
I had a twilight experience at Laszlo last weekend.  

I met a flaming gaysian who claimed he was straight and proceeded to give me a lap dance to prove his straightness.  His style was less Chippendale and more 'girls gone wild' so he failed to convince me.  He did get me wet by spilling a drink all over my lap.  He was sweet though.  And so was the "straight" guy sitting next to me who got a partial wet lap dance in the process.

We also met a cute male nurse from Alaska who claimed he is straight but his handbag was more fierce than mine...

A very butch woman who claimed she was straight complimented my sexy legs by caressing my upper thigh (my legs ARE unquestionably gorgeous so this one is a tossup)...

I am convinced that Laszlo that night was the final "on deck closet" for those ready to come out, a final training ground for fun cocktails, animated conversations, 80's music and lap dancing.  

Even if you don't need to come out, you will have a good time in this closet sized lounge/bar.
author: mia s.

description:
I must have come here two or three times without realizing it was Laszlo; I just thought of it as the Foreign Cinema bar. I now realize the name of the place is right on the door at eye level, but either it wasn't there before or I just don't pay attention to these things when I've got drinkin' on my mind. But yeah, it's Laszlo and not the Foreign Cinema bar.

My native language is English and I'm not an expert on the Cyrillic alphabet, but as I understand it the letter they're using for an 'a' in their logo is actually a 'd'. I wonder if this is confusing for native speakers of slavic languages. I also wonder if those who grew up east of the iron curtain and left to come here would find the communist theme cute or amusing.

Regardless, the space is aesthetically pleasing; The soviet movie posters, polished concrete, and simple furniture invoke russian constructivism without being too cold or austere. The pictures posted here may lead you to believe the space is bigger than it really is; Laszlo is actually kind of intimate, maybe 20' by 30' with a small upstairs lounge.

Trumer Pils on tap for $2, and they make a good bloody mary as well. They bartenders have always been friendly when I've been here. I'd come here pretty regularly if I lived nearby.
author: matthew r.

description:
Went here last night for Planet Magazine's (the hipster bible) Summer Record Release Party. Read behind the subtext: Went here for 2-hour open bar hosted by some God-awful rum company that only paid for their rum concoctions to entice your business. That being said, a free drink is a free drink. 

J and I showed up right at 7, and the place was looking a little dead. She's starving and says, "Let's get one drink, then go to Cancun for some food and come back." Yes, why don't we eat so we don't get completely snockered off free rum drinks.  

Forty minutes later, we return, impressed with our logic and sensibility. The place is happenin'. I notice it's 8:15 and panic mode sets in: only 45 minutes to get our free drink on! That's when logic goes out the window and the night spins out of control.  

I down three "light and stormy's" in a row. That's a lot of rum. Suddenly, I'm kissing some cute 22-year-old from Iowa and he's holding me up as I sway unsteadily. J hooks up with some dude, and I think the four of us leave for Beauty Bar. Big mistake -- hipster 'tude, ugly lighting, and crappy music. I think the night ends with a cab and a call to my favorite all-night pizza delivery service. (See Volare Pizza for said review.)
author: Suzanne R.

description:
Ahh. Laszlo. What would we do without you after a Friday night of slingin' hash and servin' booze? Oh Laszlo. The bumpin' music. The bonding over teenie-weenie Fernet shots followed by an eenie-meenie splash of gingerale. The commie art. The oh-so friendly bartenders and their lovely pirate bar back. The drunken eye candy leaning on the bar. If it weren't for you, we'd be forced to decompress in some lame-ass, bridge-&-tunnel-filled bar on Valencia Street! And we can't have any of that, can we? No, we can't. 

Just don't go there on a Sunday. Or if you do, get a beer. The cute girl bartenders can't make a decent drink, and they can't seem to figure out the difference between scotch and bourbon. Not good.
author: Tiffinie T.

description:
Well Laszlo, I liked you alright, until you lost my credit card but kept my friends. 

Why wasn't my credit card important enough to save? You closed out my bill, but lost the card? wtf? 

Also, I may be an alcoholic, but I do not appreciate being treated like a liar. You suck hostess of Foreign Cinema!
author: Rachel B.

description: Like coming home to mama.  Every time I've been here, I've been treated warmly, like family.  Why can't all bartenders in the Mission be this warm?  It works, it's hip, it's cool, and I can dance to it.  Located on a primo stretch of road (delicious Foreign Cinema is next door, formerly cool rooftop bar Madjul is next door also), this is the best choice for ambiance, music, people watching and being treated like a VIP in the entire neighborhood.  We all know the Mission district does not lack places to imbibe - there are a number of other good establishments, with delicious drinks and a friendly attitude (rather than simply "attitude", you know who you are), but none this top notch.  This place gets it right.
author: Evan K.

description:
I've been to Lazlo a couple of times now and it's never been too crowded to the point where I can't walk around, which is nice. A good friend of mine was visiting me and we ended up at this bar. She asked the bartender to surprise her when she asked what she wanted to drink.
She came back with a blueberry/pomegranate martini-esque drink which was muy delicioso! She had the glass rimmed with powdered sugar instead of salt, looked and tasted great.
I also have to mention that their music is always different and great. No matter what they're playing I always find myself dorkily bobbing my head to the music. so sue me!
author: Alyssa G.

description:
A tall, open space with a ringing balcony and a swank, dark atmosphere.  The bar is backed by a huge mirror above the underlit top shelf bottles.  The front of the bar is all windows, adding to the atmosphere.
Booze selection is excellent, and cocktail construction is equally talented.
DJing is great, and the sound system is quality - good sound, good volume; just loud enough to help you get yer groove on without killing conversation.
Laszlo is everything Medjool should be, without the scene.  Great bar.  There are even a few outdoor tables!  (though they're on Mission, which adds a certain 'atmosphere' that's rather distinct from inside)
author: Don H.

description: I've been here many times for many years. I've always experienced a pleasant visit, but lately the place is becoming a bit unprofessional. I love the way this place is and its great for when you're waiting for your dinner reservation at Foreign Cinema.  Only order simple cocktails. The bartenders seem to be a bit inexperienced and their cocktails are not good. Stick with the basics. A friend of mine wanted a cocktail that has whiskey or bourbon in it and she asked the bartender to make her a drink that wasnt too sour but sweet like a blood and sand. Boy, her drink smelled like gasoline and tasted like it too. She must've have used a super peaty whiskey because it tasted like that. Whiskeys that are peaty isnt for everyone. She should've asked. But I only come here for convenience and to kill time.  Not a spot to spend the night there.
author: Gina S.

description:
Two plus weeks ago I called the bar and a woman picked up. I told her that I was looking for a space to have about 20 friends for my birthday. She said, "What date?" I told her Sunday, February 15th and asked her if I would have to reserve the balcony area. She said that I wouldn't have to reserve, that it was probably ok since it was a Sunday night and that I would definitely be able to order food in from Foreign CInema, which is really the only reason I chose this space. 

When the first two party-goers got there before me they asked the bartenders who did not let them upstairs.  When I arrived I spoke to one of the bartenders and explained the situation. I told him we'd have a lot of people and the upstairs would be better for everyone involved. He said he'd talk to the other bartender but that he was sure they would be able to accommodate us. He came back to us with a deal. We could go up there if we promised to spend at least $300 at the bar. 
I wasn't worried about hitting that amount at all with 16-20 people having several drinks each, but I thought it was a little weird to just pull that rule out of their asses.

But it gets better (worse). Foreign Cinema was bought out for a wedding and therefore was not serving food to the bar. I WAS STARVING and looking forward to drinking blood mary's and sucking oysters all night long! I get cranky when I'm hungry. Very cranky.
I asked, "Can we order food for delivery?"

"Definitely not"

Getting crankier.....


Finally, we snuck food in from the other restaurant next door, Medjool. (THANKS SCOTTY! You're the best!!) And the night was saved for the birthday boi.

But seriously, if someone calls with a request for a huge party and the employee says "Yeah, sure that's not a problem at all!" then I expect it to be NO PROBLEM. I shouldn't have to offer problem solvers to the staff, they should be working that issue out on their own. AND what fucking bar doesn't allow you to bring food in?? Seriously!? What??

I'll be back for Foreign Cinema, but never for Laszlo. Thanks for trying guys but nah.
author: Jes M.

description:
So we get to Laszlo at 6:10 and after pounding down a hotdog bought off someone with a van and a hotplate and burning the roof of my mouth , the door seems to be malfunctioning because it WILL NOT OPEN. It turns out that the bartender has forgotten to open the front door. There is a side door that opens from Foreign Cinema, however, and luckily Smitty had knowledge of said door. Needless to say there were about 4 people already at the bar staring at me trying futilely to open the door.Did i mention the bartender didn't once look at me or try to motion to come in through the side door or to hang on.....Oh yeah. So after standing there for a minute or two ,we go in through the side door and sat down and waited for the bartender to set up his station and finish a conversation that he actually started after we sat down and waited to be served. Sigh. 
The place was empty because it had just opened so i liked that.The decor was nice. Especially since Yelp is calling it a dive bar.Im giving them a star for being open near my eating establishment and another for begin able to get our drinks poured and check settled in a timely fashion. But heres the thing. I can get a shot of bourbon and a beer anywhere in the Mission so what is Laszlo bringing to the table? ummmmmmm nothing.
author: Jim M.

description:
So, I only know of this place because a friend worked the valet here and well we visited often. Sometime they have a cover, but honestly I have never paid and don't think I would. This is one of those bars you go with a 'small' group of friends to enjoy a good mixed drink. 

Yes, the music is cool and diverse - although at times too loud. I enjoy this place if I want to have a chill night.
author: Eveli A.

description:
I never really saw myself as the "mission type" - prefering to make fun of the pretentious badly dressed yuppies of the Marina.  Upon going to Laszio, it became clear to me:  this is where the normal people in SF go.  Who knew?  I always thought that the mission was more like, where you went when you wanted to get shot. 

Laszio was awesome.   They were so nice, they let us have dinner menus from Foreign Cinema and the ambience was nice.  As an added bonus it wasn't too loud.  Great place for a drink with a friend, even those non-mission loving sorority girl types :)
author: Sloane R.

description:
Why Laszlo is one of my go-to's:

- Good, mixed crowd. It's not a hipster or scenester-only place.
- Nice atmosphere. Sort of "hipster elegant". Interesting CCCP propaganda decor.
- Great DJs, and they rarely charge a cover
- The upstairs lounge area is great for a mid-sized party
- Good mixed drinks
- It's 1.5 blocks from my place

Caveats:

- I've never had one of their speciality drinks
- If you're looking to have a conversation, be aware that this place can get LOUD
author: Angelo B.

description:
Night time review:
I'm into it. I went there last night to meet some friends for a little Sunday night dancing.  It was a blast, I think there were some people from Lexington as well as some folks from Delirium here to rip it up on a Sunday night.  The drinks were a bit more than I'm used to but not ultra spendy.  

There was also a very strong showing of young, beautiful and foreign female models here.  There is nothing wrong with that. Is there?

Afternoon review:

Jack the bar tender here is tight.  He introduced me to the Saturday special... Burger and beer for $10.  Now, this seems like an 'OK' deal if you are thinking about most loveless burgers that you get most places.  I'll tell you what, this burger comes from the forgin cinema kitcen and... let me tell you... it is so packed with love that there are only a few of these burgers every week.  I think that there are little fucking burger angles that come in all drunk on Friday night and have some lesbian angel orgy on top of the patties. That is what they taste like.... lesbian fairy sex juice burgers.

King me.
author: Thadd L.

description:
They have a hipster pirate working there.  The stripey shirt, the handkerchief over the head, the waxed moustache, you know the trend that mission anarcho-hippies were trying to bring up 2 years ago.  Well this guy is going for it, and I think he's after your bootie.

That basically sums up the scene, except the place fills up with people from far off places trying to live the mission hipster style.  Like dude, poke a hole in that new stripey sweater already... it looks too new.
author: SC ..

description:
I once got kicked out of a bar in Budapest...... and yes..... it was a communist bar!  I guess communist don't like loud, obnoxious travelers. 

Fast forward to S.F.........  Laszlo's is hit or miss on the weekends.  They sometimes play really good dance music but there is no place to dance; that's a little weird.  I'll go here if I get dragged to Medjool and I feel like getting a drink at a place less crowded.  It's not a primary destination spot but definitely a place to get a drink before you go somewhere else.  You never know, you may get stuck there.  If I ever see myself here I'm getting ready to dance my shoes off at Little Baobab.
author: Justin C.

description:
3.5 Stars 

I have been here a handful of times with a big group of friends and we've always had a great time! 

Somehow, we consistently end-up with the back, corner booth right under the stairs which is a perfect location for the bar and bathrooms! 

Drinks are good, music is fun, and the old movies playing throughout the night make for interesting viewing pleasure. Terrific people-watching too!
author: Johanna D.

description:
Some nights, I have special social needs.  Groups of people I don't really know but am expected to socialize with can make me a little squirrelly if I'm in the wrong mood.  I haven't really brainstormed about appropriate adaptations for this affliction, but  Laszlo offered one: play movies on the conveniently available high walls!  Sure, there's no sound, but this visual distraction shelters me in my exquisite occasional akwardness by allowing me to zone off with a legitimate excuse (ie, "This is the sickest part of Blue Velvet!; the General from Pan's Labrinthe just got his face cut open, sh*t!").  Also useful for conversation starters.

Hey, most nights I'm pretty good on my own.

Aside from inadvertantly recognizing my special needs, Laszlo had some pretty cool, simple decor, nice bartenders, and was the only place happening (but not TOO much) on a Sunday night.
author: Jennifer B.

description: Located on the side of Foreign Cinema, I always wanted to see what this place was about.  I like the set up with an upstairs..it does not get too crowded.  The bartender could be a little friendlier but the Happy Hour specials run later  until 9p.m. so that's kinda cool.  The drinks are not cheap and was ehhh ok....  I would probably come back here if I had a group of friends with me and I just wanted to hang.  Otherwise, the crowd can be a little cliquish.
author: Helen C.

description:
Let me try this again, I wrote a review before, but it was deemed a bit harsh by Lazlo patronizing patrons. I absolutely LOVE Foreign Cinema - four stars hands down. Great food, great atmosphere, great company (except for the one Valentine's when we were seated next to bitter idiots smoking all through dinner)...Anyway, this is about the bar and only the bar, not the restaurant, it's owners, restaurant staff, anyone standing on the sidewalk, sitting in the restroom or living up the block. 

I don't like it. It's cramped, way way crowded, like sweaty skin sticking together crowded, the bartenders were super rude to me - because I'm clearly too old and unhip to be there - and I don't care what anyone says, standing at the bar waiting to order for more than 8 minutes is too damn long. I could walk up the street to the liquor sto and get mine you know? 

So while I took a bunch of flak for saying that I thought the bar scene there was pretentious, I still feel that way and yes, I have been to crowded bars before (uh, Beauty Bar anyone?) and loved them. I have also waited for a beer before (um, Kilowatt?) and I've even had a snobby bartender piss me off once or twice (yeah! Mint) but I'm an old fashioned girl who just wants my beer and some music and doesn't go to bars to be cooler than thou. So I learned my lesson. I've been told I need to hang left of Mission.
author: Melisa B.

description: All I remember is that it was dark & Johnny Depp was there = a good night.
author: Peg S.

description:
Update 8/27/06

Let me preface this update by mentioning that I have recently become a little bit biased  in my feelings about Laszlo. (Full disclosure:  I play records here every other Monday. That being said Weekends are a bit much but weeknights are more and more inviting (esp. Mondays!). 

Pre-Dosa had drinks here. Being situated right on top of Foreign Cinema I always get that feeling I'm not going to dig the crowd in here. Luckily it was early and pretty empty. The bartender's Ipod was killin it. The Arsonists followed by the Man in Black will get me every time. Kudos for serving up my Jameson rocks in a highball glass. Subtext spins here on the regular. Check your local listings. Outside of that I can't see myself spending too much time here.
author: Mingus R.

description:
They really know how to make a drink at Lazlo.  From the spicy Bloodies on weekend mornings, to the perfect Mojitos, I have never met a drink I didn't like at this lively watering hole.  I actually drank so many mojitos at this bar one year that I made myself give them up for a long time.  So when someone would say "Mojito?"  I would say "No mo!  No mo! NoMohitos!" (Did you ever notice how drunk people think they are hilarious?  Good thing my friends are all drunks too, so they always laugh WITH me)  Last night I revisited my old friend Mo, and she still goes down like CountryTime Lemonade on a scorching summer day.  Ahhhhhhh.

We always seem to end up at the corner table by the front door, with a few too many people squished in to the small space.  But I have never experienced anything but friendliness from the patrons sitting next to us (thank you to the ladies who gave up a chair for us!), and we are always able to get a drink in a timely manner no matter how crowded it is.

I love the impossibly high ceilings and the changing display on the big screen.  The first time I ever went here they were playing an old Planet of the Apes movie. The DJ's play crowd-pleasing rhythms that make people groove in their seats.

Yep, I like Laslo.  We mesh.
author: Liz S.

description:
Industrial chic. Warehousey, exposed brick, stark and DARK space decorated with vintage Communist propaganda posters and random projected visuals.  

Nice upstairs lounge space also, but it's small -- a few leather sofas.

Bartenders seemed nice.  We ordered our drinks from a pirate.  I kid you not, a Johnny Depp-like pirate.  Not that I'm complaining.  Far from it: Johnny Depp is hot and therefore so was this bartender.

I'm torn between a 3 and 4 star review, basically because I sensed no vibe -- seemed like a random group of people.. perhaps rejects from Medjool, the "Where should we go?" on a Sat. night, etc.  Maybe it picked up after I left (close to midnight).  I dunno.  Just no vibe.  Kinda like this review.
author: Natasha S.

description:
Came here on a mission for a successful sibling's birthday and did not leave disappointed. 

I think I have this innate sense of enjoying the simplicity of this place. To me, there wasn't really anything trendy or jump-out-of-your-seat unique about this place. In all actuality, it's like most dimly lit, unsuspecting bars in San Francisco. I guess the only thing that jumped out at me was the fleeting image of the old "Adams Family" movie projected on the back wall. How many times will you be able to take a journey back to such random cinema while sucking down suds and throwing back a few cocktails?

And the prices of the liquid entertainment weren't bad either. Bottled beers are around $4 a pop and cocktails that came out to $7 per drink, if my math serves me right (I'm hoping there was no alcohol induced fuzziness when I signed off on the tab).

Good music, well-priced drinks, and content that led to quite enjoyable evening. Good in my book!
author: D L.

description:
I love this place.  The drinks are great, the crowd is fun, and the slideshows are awesome.  Without a doubt you'll find yourself trying to figure out what any of the things they're projecting mean.

This bar gets crowded on the weekends, but I've found that the crowds come and go.  So fight for a little space at a table and enjoy.
author: james s.

description:
I dig this place. It's a haven of a clean, modern, well ventilated bar with a good liquor selection, quick, skilled bartenders and great music. All night, I HAD TO constantly stop conversation to declare my love for whatever song was playing - and I wasn't the only one. Also, the bathrooms outside and down the hall are clean, well stocked and had little-to-no line.

Of course it gets kinda loud and crowded but not nearly as bad as other places in the area and the the crowd was more normal people than the raging hipsters that haunt the lower number streets along Mission. I'm so going back to this place the next time someone suggests drinking in the Mission.

Oh, and Aaron V. brought us some delish grub from El Farolito around 11, which really hit the spot. A great night out.
author: Kristina A.

description: I have been here several times and I find it inconsistent.  The two most recent times there have been female bartenders, who have a bit of an attitude.  One time they had a cocktail list, the other time I was told they did not.  When my friend asked for a whiskey cocktail.  He was told, "I don't make up special drinks."  In the end, she made him a great manhattan, but he felt like he was the asshole for even asking for something different.  The girl acted like we were wasting her time by asking for a drink.  I would come here again, especially cause I like their in house DJ, but I know to come expecting a sort of snotty bartender.
author: Ashley W.

description:
This place is a favorite for me in my area.. its  a cool looking bar.. 
They play old movies on the wall, the ambiance is very chill, the bartenders are good people.. And this is a great place to party all night long with your friends. Never to over crowed.. 

I have been here several times and will go back! Hope to see you there!
author: Samantha R.

description:
I thought it was gonna be good. It's always associated with the Foreigh Cinema so I expected a quiet, intimate atmosphere or something a bit special or different.

I stepped in. A regular bar with a ridiculously loud club music.
Where am I again ? ahhh Laszlo. Well disappointed.
Just a random bar. If you are looking for a random bar, there are plenty of them on Mission st and a lot cheaper. 

Not a bad night, I got tipsy and really had fun with my friend. But it had nothing to do with this bar. Sorry but I'll probably not come back.
author: Marc L.

description:
Reason for coming: Birthday Party.

I've been next door @ Medjool's on several occasions but never noticed this bar right next door!  I would say the experience is worth it.  However, I think one extra bartender would've pushed me to give this place 4 stars.  Service was a bit slow and the server was a bit rude.  I was on the top floor most of the time and the server just pushed his way through everytime despite pushing patrons up against the wall! Aftermath,  we went back to Medjool's......I will still come back to this place though.  Good dive bar in the neighborhood; too bad my group was just looking for some extra space for dancing.
author: Jay L.

description:
I've been here twice now. It is day and night from week nights to weekends. 
Saturday night the place was packed. So packed that we didn't even bother trying to get in. So we hit up another bar down the street. An hour later made our way back and the place had cleared out quite a bit. So in we went. Was able to snag seats at the bar.

It's a smaller bar but it does have an upstairs. (Which i have never attempted to try and walk up those stairs). It is pretty loud in there. You have to pretty much yell in order to talk to anyone. I do like the music there though.

On the wall they have this huge projection screen which plays movies I've never seen. I guess if you're bored you can always drink and watch the weird movie. 

Bathrooms are very clean but being dead drunk it can be quite the chore to get from the bar down the hallway to it. 

The drinks are great here. Both times I've gone here I've gotten plastered. Prices are pretty decent. 

I'd definitely like to come back but after saturday night and this huge street fight which resulted from a club across the street, I might be coming back on a weeknight. 

I'm not quite sure why this place appeals to me as much as it does but it does.
author: Jenniffer T.

description:
I've been to Foreign Cinema several times since I used to live a block away, but for some reason, had never been to Laszlo. Had I known it had a Russian-Constructivist theme (see my Rodchenko image), I would have been here YEARS ago! It's dark & industrial, and I kinda dig that. DJ Swahili Sheen--our own MIngus R., spins here on Monday nights. 

Ah...Monday nights. It was very quiet, but it was actually nice because a few friends & I managed to liven it up a bit. Kind of like having your own private bar. You can order food from the Foreign Cinema menu & have it served at your table--the Rosemary Pork chop, Mussels and the other things we had were excellent! 

One extra star for the Jack Sparrow-esque bartender. That's not an easy look to pull off in real life, dude. Kudos.
author: N B.

description:
Good vibes, good music, no cover! 
We went on a friday night. Parking was so easy! Some may say the are is kinda sketch, but with all the bar people wandering the streets you should be fine. It was pretty packed inside. The bouncers were chill. From what I remember the drinks were really priced well. Not those crazy prices that I've come to be used to at many bars. 

The DJ was spinning REAL vinyls. Respect for that, he was playing the jams too. 

The bartenders....not as friendly as others have said but it probably was because it was so crowded. (which I don't know why a bartender would be mad about that. crowded bar = more tips for them) 

HINT: there was a hot dog lady 5 feet away. She wasn't as good as the OG dirty dog guy but it was still satisfying.
author: Jess O.

description:
It's Friday night.  You're a borderline alcoholic.  You're meeting up with some lady friends to gossip madly and tell obscene stories.  Want to indulge in strong drinks and decadent desserts without the possiblity of being overheard?  Head to Laszlo.  I am a big fan of the bartenders, and the menu from Foreign Cinema makes the icy rock that is my heart melt just a little bit.  My only complaint is that the music is a wee bit too loud for normal conversation - I had to yell at my friends to make myself heard.
