Ok, fine, can't blame Laszlo for that one...maybe I just wanted to yell at them regardless.
author: Jess T.

description:
"My Dad Comes Into Town For Business With Some Friends and then Proceeds to Drink Me Under the Table" Part 4

Crazy drunken night of debauchery with my father and his friends ended at Laszlo, where we proceeded to close the place down.  Granted, my memory at this point in the evening is EXTREMELY fuzzy (see parts 1, 2 & 3 of the "My Dad Comes Into Town For Business With Some Friends and then Proceeds to Drink Me Under the Table" series.)

I had never been to Laszlo before and, to be honest, I have no idea how we ended up here, except that after we decided we were done with the Latin American Club, I think my dad's friend Andre said something about wanting to go dancing, and I led them off in a direction that felt "right" to me.  When we got to Laszlo it seemed lively and people were outside and before I could say anything Andre was leading my dad and their other friend into Laszlo and proceeding to dance and the boy and I did our "oh well" shrugs and followed.

As I recall, I drank a Lemon Drop that was delish, and danced, but I have no idea what kind of music was playing and I think I was dancing with my boyfriend but who's to say?  Nor am I sure what my dad and his friends were doing.  I think my dad was drunk-dialing my mother, and I hesitate to speculate as to what his friends were doing.  But the lighting was good, the vibe was lively but not douchey, and did I mention that my dad is awesome?

It should be noted that I woke up with I think the second worst hangover of my life.  So apparently I inherited my dad's ability to drink, but not his ability to entirely avoid hangovers.  I literally can not keep up with my father.  I am pathetic/he is a machine.

Oh and my dad liked the new boy, by the by THANK YOU FOR ASKING.

***It's probably pretty clear that I'm trying to up my "usefulness" rating in my reviews.  You're welcome everybody!***
author: Ashley B.

description:
This place is very, very dark...too dark that you cannot see the person you are talking to! The upstairs area is cool...comforty couches to chat and quiet to have conversations amongst friends. It also provides a good view of the crowd downstairs, esp if you want a better view of what the DJ is doing or people watch. Just be sure you don't spill your drink over and hit someone's head!

I give it three stars because the music was good (DJ Robynn spinned that night), great location (near Medjool and Foreign Cinema), spacious (the upstairs did it for me), and interesting art (didn't necessarily like, just different). 

Not higher than three stars? Too dark and hard to find parking in the neighborhood.
author: Nadine D.

description:
With the whoosh-whoosh-whoosh of helicopters overhead, I ventured into a cold, winter San Francisco night and down to László Bar, my next stop on Mission on Mission. As my evening began, a protest gathered in the Castro to challenge the passing of Proposition 8--accounting for the aerial surveillance. I had to wonder, what can three helicopters really do to hold off a crowd of thousands? I wondered if protesters would spill onto Mission Street or if I was too far on the outer periphery of the neighborhood.

László Bar has two doors--one on the street which is found between a few tables outside the bar, and a second door down the long hallway leading up to Foreign Cinema's  hostess station. I entered through the side and found the bar comfortably full, but not packed. Upstairs a mezzanine offered a curtained seating area which hovered vacantly over the bar area. The corners of the bar buzzed quietly with small groups enjoying cocktails, and the bar stools were all spoken for as couples sipped their $8 drinks and waited for tables at Foreign Cinema. I chose a spot along the wall that had stools and a thin landing to place my beer.

For more check out http://www.missiononmission.com/2008/11/laszlo-bar-2526-mission-street.html
author: Gadiel M.

description:
Just because you call a grilled cheese sandwich "croque madame" doesn't mean you can charge 10 bucks for it. That is, as they say en francais, "merde de cheval." 

Just another example of SF retards letting themselves get ripped off. Why do you do it to yourselves?
author: Stan B.

description:
music. awesome. (they have a dj there 24/7.)
drinks. awesome. 
its a nice chill vibe. i think u can rent out the top floor for a private party as well. only downside is parking round here is iffy and i don't live close enough to walk there.
author: aron w.

description:
Subtle, inviting decor.
Decently priced drinks.
Excellent location.

So you might be asking, why only two stars? The music is way, way too loud. Like louder than a club loud. Uncomfortably so, where my voice hurts today from having to yell at my friends in order to have a conversation. 

This is my third visit, and each time has been the same, so I guess it's par for the course. I wish it weren't the case, because otherwise I think the spot has a lot of potential.
author: Jason B.

description:
decent mojito, no entry fee, and it doesn't have water that tastes like joan river's vagina *ahem* MEDJOOLs. (don't believe me? read my review!)
plus the crowd on fridays is not bad, a good mixed one.
author: Susy C.

description:
Five stars for Gail, the bartendress who kicks ass, & for being smart enough to have DMadness and Zita in every 3rd Saturday.  Minus one star for occasionally bringing in too LA a crowd, and for how said crowd helps the place descend into a grimy little pen before it even hits midnight.

Gail is sweet, but not in the sugary sweet (yecch) way- she's more like a sweetart: sweet with a bit of tang.  She let us in before anyone else so my partner and I could get some engagement photos @ his favorite SF bar.  While our photographer shot away, she made us special cocktails (my fave was "Gail No. 18":  a martini concoction w/ pumpkin butter, nutmeg, and tequila that's to-die-for-- and named after our wedding date!); she impressed our photog w/ her knowledge of cameras and photography, AND when we were about to leave she wouldn't let us pay her anything.  She made our night, needless to say.

DMadness is a friend from back in the day, and when he and his partner/ wife get on the tables, you can tell they know what kinda music gets into the bones of those of us who were still in jr high during the golden age of hip hop.  The two of them together are just pure nostalgia and good vibes.

So get yourself to this joint on a 3rd Saturday, try to find Gail, order her No. 18, and get set for a night of great music.
author: E R.

description:
I absolutely love this bar. I recently hung out here with some friends after a great meal at foreign cinema and was very satisfied. The crowed was young and very laid back. I loved the bar tenders, they were hilarious and could make any drink into liquid perfection. 
   The floor can get crowded as the night progresses but if you want to escape the pandemonium there is a great loft-lounge upstairs. There are three really comfortable couches which are cozy and make for an intimate setting for you and that special someone, or for you and drunk friends! Either way check this place out, it is a great ending (or beginning) bar for a night out.

--CAUTION: if you tend to be absent minded, keep hold of valuables, this bar is extremely dark and it is easy to lose track of things.
author: Ryan W.

description:
Don't tell anyone but I actually like this Mission bar!

My friend asked me what my Mission faves were and my response was..."find me in Zeitgeist or Kilowatt." I followed that statement with, "I also secretly like Laszlo."

Met him there on a Sunday night for a few cocktails and was reminded why. It's a casually sexy bar and if you come any time but the weekends, it's my kind of place. Good music, good people, just cozy enough. 

I still wouldn't touch this place with a ten foot pole on Fridays or Saturdays but that's just me being a claustrophobic fruitcake. I like places where I can sit at the bar and carry on a conversation without getting knocked into. The douche bag quotient is significantly lower in SF bars on nights other than Thurs-Sat.

P.S. they have a good happy hour too
author: Cindy P.

description:
There's only 1 reason I go to Laszlo: 

Heat Seeker:
Absolute Peppar, fresh lime juice and Cointreau, shaken and strained. The buildup is a little sweet, the finish is hot. 

This place has a lot going for it. It's nestled between Foreign Cinema and Medjool, so it's always a busy scene. Sometimes it gets too crowded, but that's typical for Mission joints. But honestly...the Heat Seeker is worth it!
author: Samir P.

description: Been here twice, and each time the music was great, from old school r&b hits, to hip hop, to reggae dancehall. The place is a little small if you're trying to get your groove on, but the people are fun and you can still bob your head from side to side on the crowded nights.  The decor is pretty cool, and trendy, and there is a neat upstairs area that looks down at the bar. The back wall usually has some movie playing in the background, which adds to the quirky ness of the place. But hey, the drinks are cheap, good music and good vibes! Definitely one of the better spots in the Mission.
author: Chela R.

description:
A nice happy medium between dive and posh.  If you'd prefer to be drinking in a crap-hole bar, feel free to mosey along to Mission Bar (catchy name, I know, gets me every time), or, if you want to schmooze with a bunch of fake-tanned, arrogant pricks, Medjool is right up the street!

I enjoy dives as much as the next reformed redneck from Ohio, but sometimes you just want to be with someone... er... in a bar that wouldn't horrify you if someone turned on the lights.  

I've spent too much of my life listening to ZZ Top and talking to one-toothed men who use double negatives... sometimes I just need a place like Laszlo to remind me that I've escaped rural America.
author: Alissa K.

description:
I've been here but two times in two years of living in the neighborhood.  but I'm planning/hoping to spend more time here over the coming weeks, as jp (subtext) and gene (mingus r.) are now throwing down records every monday night.  as usual from those guys, good music when i dropped in last monday.  it was crowded for a monday night.  I imagine that was b/c it was labor day, plus the word had been put out to the yelp crowd. 

Granted, the spot is a bit trendy.  they come right and say it in their sort of wack message to yelpers--"this bar caters to the urban hip and Euro-friendly"...whatever that means.  well, what it does mean is that you won't find me in here on the weekends.  but as long as good records are being played by good friends, i'll make the effort to get over here.
author: Suman G.

description:
My friends and I were looking for a place that played hip hop music and I knew the dj that was playing at this particular venue on a Saturday night so we decided to head here.  We were really surprised at what we found.  They charged us $5/head TO GET INTO the place.  This was the first time any of us came in here so we didn't realize that it is JUST A BAR - no dance floor!  But the music is super loud as though it was a dance club.  

It is super small, gets crowded and the music is super loud so you can't really have a normal conversation.  So basically, you're in there either drinking and sitting around or standing and bobbing your head, which is what we saw a lot of people doing.  My group and a couple of girls tried to make a tiny dance floor but it just didn't feel right in this tiny space.  So I don't have any clue as to why they would charge any amount for people to get in to just buy a drink.

On the bright side, the women's bathroom is pretty nice and clean.
author: Mercy D.

description:
This is a sexy little bar with creative cocktails and a cool vibe.  The music was a great mix of rare groove, downtempo and underground hip hop and the crowd was a good mix of folks having a cool, mellow time.  It's not pretentious yet still very hip and  trendy, but in a great way.

I dig this place, it's a reason why the Mission is still cool.
author: Tony A.

description:
i love the vibe that Laszlo has, day and night.

The juice is always fresh so that = better cocktails! The bartenders on Sunday nights are great as well....i think i had the best White Russian ever there!

Great lighting and vibe too-perfect for a mellow cocktail with someone sexy!
author: Victoria D.

description: Laszlo was the last stop on a midday bar crawl I did with my 90-year-old grandmother a few weeks ago. Gramma did not approve of all the communist paraphernalia and very rudely informed our bartender several times over the course of the hour and a half we spent there. For some reason, they didn't kill us. So, 5 stars.
author: Rebecca P.

description: Only about a million times better than Medjool next door and a thousand times better than Bar on Mission. Getting drunk here is far too easy with $5 stoli (my standards have been drastically lowered with the onset of the recession) drinks and $2 Trumers from 6-9. I have been know to stand at the window, at 5:55 p.m. murmuring "open open open". It's dark and cozy and the bartender won't judge you for drinking alone.
author: Autumn K.

description: Well-mixed strong vanilla martini with floating ice shavings on top just the way I like it. Good DJ (in terms of mixes). Good dark, trendy -- but not corporate -- vibe, especially for a rainy Wednesday night. But WAY too loud. So maybe OK DJ.
author: Andrew K.

description: one of those places that I never remembered going to but I've been.  when I was there, it was okay.  Interesting crowd, clean bar...I don't remember a dance floor, though.
author: Shinny L.

description: Gave one extra star because we got there a minute after the end of happy hour and the bar tender still hooked us up.
author: Lidia Z.

description:
This rating is only based on Happy hour--personally, I would not come here when the elitist  yuppies start pouring in; which they usually come in @ 8:45pm.  

Back to the happy hour,  they usually have some type of imported beer for $2 and $4 cosmos-starts at 6pm to 9pm. The bartenders know how to make quality drinks and they do not act like a snobbish ahmir...
author: ronzilla x.

description: Nice Bar with modern interior and art. Outstanding cocktails, the Mephisto tasted great & was strong. The crowd was cool and the music was not to loud to be able to have a conversation. One of the bar tenders could have been friendlier but the services was quick until late. Would definitely recommend it to friends.
author: Patrick E.

description:
Trendy and modern...

Well mixed drinks...Hangar one Tonic = minimal calories...

Not crowded at all 9PM on a Tuesday night....last night was my first time here in about nine months

Right next to Foreign Cinema

Good place to 1) either meet up before dinner at Foreign Cinema 2) wait if you don't have reservations at Foreign Cinema 3) check out the Soviet theme everyone keeps mentioning, which I was completely oblivious to....
author: Summit S.

description:
This was our 2nd stop after Medjool's, very cool since we were partying w/ cool people (Srini & Jay!!!)  The bar is small, interior is a bit dive but most of the time, that's just the perfect recipe for: FUN!

Creep alert though...met some guys, one of them wanted to talk to me so told me that he and his buddies were foster brothers.  HUH??  Is that a pick-up line?  REALLY??  Then, the one guy who had a girlfriend ended up staying at the bar to chat w/ me when all his buddies decided to leave.  At least he revealed that they were all buddies NOT foster brothers.  BIZARRE!!!
author: Wendy H.

description:
So there's one Russian Constructivist print up, rock out.  Remember that exhibit of all those Communist printmakers back at the MOMA in Manhattan years ago?  I do -- but only because I am trying really hard not to notice (and failing to not notice) that she's noticing my legs.

At least, I imagine she is, and it's dark and silent enough in here on a Monday early evening to engineer a very dangerous date.

What's lovely is being able to slide down off the tall and elegant side-of-the-bar table and stool setup (we wanted to head upstairs, it was closed to us) and head across the hall to Foreign Cinema's powder room to check your text messages.

From her husband.

She's doing the same as I get back.  It's gorgeous in here, but maybe that's just us.  It's easy intrigue.  It's not trying too hard.  

You know all that stuff about being choked by a velvet glove?

No?

Add three (me) or four (her, I made her wait) Fernet Brancas and let absolutely boil.
author: Melissa G.

description:
This is a nice place to get a drink. Nothing about it blows me out of the water, but it has a good atmosphere and the bartenders are friendly. Also, they have very generous wine pours, which earns them a special place in this wine loving girl's heart. 

The big pours come in handy when you have to sit and talk to a "friend of a friend" who is wearing a pretentious scarf, keeps talking about how unstimulating it is to be back in San Francisco after a recent trip to Europe, and puts his hand on your thigh a mere 30 seconds into the conversation.
author: Angie R.

description: Don't know what's up with this joint, but the DJ last night was awesome!  Could not stop jamming out to all the old skool hits.  It was hilarious.  There are now break dancing videos up on facebook this morning.  Good times.
author: Monica R.

description:
This place saved my Saturday night. First off, I mistakenly assumed heading to a big club would be fun. Ofcourse, 5 minutes into being at the club, I realized: a.) I'm no longer a recent college grad b.) I don't wear bling bling or stunner shades and c.) I don't live in the ...
Anyway, I checked this place out as an alternate and it definitely had all the makings for a great time out. Decently priced drinks, great music (live dj with mc) and a very cool setup. The crowd was definitely chill and did not look like they made it their first priority to dress like a rap video. 

Drawbacks? After the experience at "the club", this place was awesome.
author: Jonny Bobby G.

description:
Another intimate, cozy bar/lounge. Went here on a Sat nite and I think we were a bit late. Couldn't get a seat or table, but all in all, I like the vibes.

I would def come here on any other night when it's not as crowded to have a drink and hang out.
author: Dessa R.

description:
What?  What?  I can't hear you!?!  My eardrums are blown out.  It's a good thing I can type too, because my voice is hoarse.

This place is dark like the Comet Club, but very stylish/hipster on the inside.  It's not a place where I see anything except sporadic 2 second dancing, yet the music is cranked all the way up. I'm still trying to figure out why.
author: Tim G.

description:
Popped in here on a Friday. Nice little place with a good DJ however the service wasn't particularly friendly. 

Good place for an after work drink, just don't expect to be welcomed with too much enthusiasm.
author: Rob P.

description: Great little neighborhood bar that i frequent especially on a M - Th when the crowd is local and more low-key. During this whole Giants mayhem, Laszlo's has reached another level for me. I watched a game there on a Saturday afternoon with neighborhood folks in a chill atmosphere and loved it! It was so nice to not have some frat boy breathing down my neck. On the day our Giants won the World Series I happened to be at Laszlo's when the mini riot ensued on 22nd & Mission after some dumbass ran his car into a group of about 100 people celebrating and then proceeded to get a beatdown for it. I have to say the bouncer was soo quick in protecting their patrons. I was quite impressed! He gathered everyone inside, put us on lockdown for a little bit and gathered all the bottles/glasses from their outside seating area while the riot gear police handled the situation. Love you Laszlo's!
author: Lila R.

description:
If you're into the dark bar with intermittently good DJing check this spot out. I like the film noir detictive flick they had prjected on the wall. The bartender also make me laugh out loud, which was a rare pleasure.

So if you're in the mission, I suggest checking it out - purley for the graphic art all around... THE COMMY PROPAGANDA MACHINE LIVES!
author: Lauren S.

description:
Laid back, super cool bar... sandwiched between Medjool and Foreign Cinema.  Less douche bags than Medjool, and less formal than Foreign Cinema.  Loved it.  

Been here twice, and had a fun time both times.  You can actually carry on a conversation, it's not too loud.  And they play good music.  If you're bored you can watch trippy movies on the wall.  

The bartenders are super nice here.  My girlfriend's drink immediately (after ordering) spilled all over the floor (slippery sucker), and the bartender replaced her drink free of charge.  

And they have a dope happy hour (great prices).
author: Sarah F.

description:
I feel ya Melisa B:

Though I love Laszlo dearly... it's the first place I ever ate raw oysters, on an early date with the Mister... I consistently find my New Favorite Cocktail on their specialty menu... more often than not, we wind up ordering food from FC next door and the Mister chit-chats with the 'tender about the many and varied awesomenesses of amaros... and probably most importantly, we go weekdays when it's not packed and is a chillzone with which to be reckoned... I had to LOLARZ!!!one1!!1 when I read your review because I SO recognize exactly what you're describing. 

Crowded "hipster" bars are f'n glass-chewingly unbearable on the weekends. I've jettisoned fast and emphatically enough from their personal-space-invasive, unmannerly, top-decibled confines to cause a sonic boom many a time, with only my extended middle finger ever to consider heading their direction again.

Though my enswoonment with Laszlo remains unflagging, the recent memories of a manhole-cover-sized tray of oysters and cocktails non-cloyingly femmed up with violet flower liqueur remain fresh in my mind from a week ago, and the eager anticipation of our next excursion Laszloward on a Tuesday ot Thursday as turgid as... things that become turgid, I am compelled to proffer my fist solemnly toward yours for a solidarity knuckle-kiss of recognition. ;)
author: Beverage Appreciato R.

description:
This is definitely NOT my go-to bar in the Mission, but I ended up here on Friday night, instead of Justin Roja's party at Medjool. 

The drinks are standard, the dj music is mixed, but the vibe is off. I think it's too loud, and too...dark? Not sure... 

Maybe if I had some of the happy hour cosmos I'd write a better review.
author: Misha F.

description: Laszlo is just okay. It is obvious ppl are there b/c of overflow at Medjool or another cool bar in the neighborhood.  It has a "I think i am cool, but an not really sure" vibe.  They have some good beers - a few Belgian beers on tap and an okay sound.  The bartenders are a little aloof and the crowd is just okay. I never spend more than an hour in this place, but it is a great place to meet some folks, have a beer and move on.
author: Kamael S.

description: Looking forward to actually hanging out.  I spent like 45 minutes in here and knew I wanted to come back.  I like it. Its kind of dark, there's a movie playing on the wall and a resident DJ who sounded pretty good.  Haven't had drinks yet...TO BE CONTINUED.
author: Ronjini M.

description:
No thanks.  Shady set up, sketchy bartenders who are not friendly in the least, and really crappy, weak drinks.  If you're going here, get a beer- at least they can't water that down.

I won't be going back, and none of my friends will, either.  With all the bars in SF, you're much better off with somewhere else- anywhere else.
author: Dave S.

description:
I dig the vibe on Sunday nights.  Good beats.  
The folks behind the bar aren't shy to "pour it on".  Good libations.
One evening some lovely ladies started to kick around tables and knock over bottles, while wearing perfectly innocent sundresses.  Good show.
They immediately shut down the top section. [boo, but...] Good crazy-crowd control.
author: Beth G.

description:
Came here for a friend's bday celebration last night. (Happy Bday Lilly!) Good drinks, good music, and cool space. I especially liked that they mimicked Foreign Cinema's "movie-on-the-wall" concept. We came on a Saturday night and so it was especially packed with people. Total sardine city, but was still fun. I suppose weeknights are much more chill here where you can actually get a seat. 

The only thing that pissed me off was that there were these immature little bastards upstairs dropping their cocktail glasses down below at us!!! Who does that? And how old are you? Your freakin' lucky it didn't cut any of us, you dumb asses. One hit my shoulder for God sakes. I should've hurled my glass right back up to you bitches. 

Other than that......it was a cool night at Laszlo for my first time.
author: Anne E.

description:
We were there last night after SF Indie Fest Wrap Party across the street at 12 Galaxies.  WHAT an AWESOME PLACE Laszlo is!  It's swanky yet unpretentious. The chardonnay I had was great. My friends enjoyed the lemon drops. The upstairs area is cozy and complete with comfy coaches and sitting places. The music was at the perfect noise level for me ... esp. from the 2nd flr.  

And just so you know, my 5-star review is completely biased by the fact that I made out with a hot French guy from NYC. Just a little Happy Chinese New Year indulgence for myself ! ;-)
author: Tiffany L.

description:
I always prefer Laszlo's over Mejool because it's cool without overdoing it. Laszlo has serious space and tables, an upstairs that looks down on the rest of the bar, good DJs and, of course, the supertrickedout obscure DVDs projected on the exposed brick wall. I like the service here as well. 

Never paid a cover here, either.
author: Andrew K.

description: Looked for a place to bring my friends on my birthday that had a great vibe, modern decor, good music, bites to eat, clean bathroom and delish drinks. I was excited about their mezzanine area as a different vibe as well. This space had what I was looking for (and I will give it 1 more try bc of all the above things) but it lacked a few key things the night of my group outing. 1. schedule was not updated for their music online the week of so I had to call and get the run around through Foreign Cinema 2. I called and asked about the music and bringing a party here but I was not told anything about the $400 min for the mezzanine - and oh it was already rented the night I planned on going. Apparently I should have "emailed instead of called" to get better service - noted. 3. Bartenders were not accommodating (when happy hour was over I wanted the same drink @ whatever cost it was after happy hour bc I was trying to stay consistent to not get sick ;-) but was informed they were "sold out" and they did not offer to at least give something "similar" - are you kidding? Service 101 if you cant get em what they want give em something similar. Not hard. I am pretty easy to please So in the end my friends and I had a great time, enjoyed the atmosphere but wished it was managed a lil better to make the whole experience smoother so my group -of 15- felt welcome and didn't comment to me the next day that the bartenders could have been better - unanimously.
author: Bokhara G.

description: The advantage of Laszlo is that you can get the brunch menu offered at Foreign Cinema, without the wait. The disadvantage is that the staff are quite rude, so it's not worth it anyway.
author: Masha G.

description:
Good drinks, nice ambiance. Love sitting upstairs and watching the people below me and outside the window. Celebrated a couple birthdays here. Always fun times.

Happy Hour includes $2 imports and $4 cosmos. In addition, the bartender is very attentive and makes really good drinks!
author: Zell C.

description:
We had a party here last week and it RULED. First of all, there was nobody besides us there until 10:30 or so. Second, you can drink on the sidewalk, and nobody seemed to care that we were not just drinking at the cute little cafe tables and chairs, but we had taken over the entire sidewalk and were spilling off to the sides. It was a warm night and totally perfect for mingling.

The usual crowd seems to be kind of cheesy, but I liked the bartenders and the DJ, I only drink Diet Coke so I have no idea whether the drinks are expensive, and Foreign Cinema next door has a red carpet you can pose on if you're drunk enough. I would definitely recommend this place as an excellent space to put on events during the week. On the weekend, I bet it's kind of bridge-and-tunnel though.
author: alice t.

description:
I was disappointed to learn that my friends' wanted to celebrate their birthday at Lazslo, because the one time I had stopped by prior, I found the scene boring and typical.

Nothing had changed the second time around--from the thudding music, dim lighting, and human din.  The only difference was the fact that I was accompanied by many more people, which helped the situation somewhat.

That said, I have to admit that there's a huge advantage to Lazslo's being attached to Foreign Cinema and that's the advantage of clean restroom access!
author: Momo R.

description: Gail is the best bartender in San Francisco. Amazing concoctions every time. I'm not even going to tell you what nights she works because she's MINE. Go away, scram, etc.
author: Andrew C.

description:
This is a great small bar in the Mission.  I went here on a Thursday night and the music was great!  A blend of World and Reggae music.  The bar had a good variety of top shelf liquor.  The place was pretty filled up by 11:00 p.m., and lots of people were dancing and groovin' to the music.

One thing that this place needs to purchase is a sign to people can find the place when driving by. 
 
I will certainly be frequenting this establishment again in the future.  Anyone want to join me?

And this place is across the street from another place that I reviewed.  (See my other reviews to figure that out).
author: Scott A.

description:
Strong and expert cocktails. I really enjoy the seating at this spot, the outside seating, the cozy downstairs spot next to the window and the upstairs loungey seating...seating always a nice compliment to a strong top-offed cocktail. Its hard to drink those full martinis on your feet in four inch heels!

Great place for an early cocktail, it tends to get busy later esp. on the weekends. The place is attached to Foreign Cinema so you can get a mixed dinner/drinks crowd which makes for good conversation. Good place to have an intimate cocktail with your SO.
author: Adrienne P.

description:
Loads of fun!
Great drinks mixed by my own Capt. Jack Sparrow! Seriously, this is a great bar connected to an amazing restaurant. Cool vibe without being loaded with hipsters. LOVE the HUGE door guy too.
author: Douggers M.

description:
I like this place on Thursdays.  It has a slow start to it which is nice.  Before you get swallowed by the people who start a makeshift dancefloor in front of the bar, you can stare at the bartender who looks like Captain Jack Sparrow.  

They start spinning Reggae after 10p (I'm petitioning to get that started earlier).  I love how my raggamuffin DJ plays Richie Spice on request.
author: Lissa J.

description:
I've got nothing but love for Laszlos! The drinks are strong, the bartenders are awesome and they always have good tunes playing. Its a little cramped in on Friday and Saturday nights, but the crowd is always full of good non pretentious people who are just there to have a good time rather than to "see and be seen." Definately one of my favorite places in the Mission when Im looking to have some drinks with friends.  Oh but watch out for falling drinks! Drunk people tend to go up to the second level and drop bottles...two of my friends have nearly been hit by falling beer bottles!!! This place would get 5 stars but Ive got to take 1 off for that especially because ive heard of this happening to a lot of people...maybe they should put in a net.

Also someone complained about no girls wearing 7s at Laszlo's, well thats not true! Last time I was in there I had 7s on ;)
author: Seana L.

description:
Went here on a Saturday for a birthday party.  Not a bad spot.  Very good music!  Any place that plays Rodney O & Joe Cooley ("Everlasting Bass") and Masta Ace ("Born to Roll") is my kind of spot!  They played a lot of hits that I listened to when I was in high school...not that wack stuff from Lil' Wayne about Lollipops...

Parking was decent.  We circled twice until we found a spot one block away.  If you're a real baller, just valet it next door at Medjool and hop on over to Laszlo (it's only 2 buildings over!).  

And when you're done partying, you gotta try one of them bacon wrapped hot dogs down the street from the street vendors.  I believe they were only $3.  Definately better tasting than I would've thought!  Oh yeah.  Word of advice.  Don't try and give the vendor lady a massage.....well, unless you're from Redwood City.
author: Daniel M.

description: Laszlo's is a nice looking bar next to Foreign Cinema, and like Foreign Cinema, they play old black and white Godard movies on the wall.  That being said, their drinks are ok, and it gets crazy packed and loud in there.  It can be a fun time, but if you just want to chill then perhaps its not the place to go.
author: Terry K.

description:
I have to give 5 stars for the great Saturday afternoon brunch experiences I've had here.  The burger and the croque madame are amazing.  Jack is awesome and plays Dragonforce while keeping up.
This just might be my old brunch spot's replacement.
author: Tiffany P.

description:
I think it's timing for me, because whenever I went to that bar it was either nearly empty....during the mid week....or super crowded with yuppies....on the weekend...perhaps they were spilling fr. Medjool...
It has a descent interior decoration and the outside chairs which is a big plus since very few bars seem to have that in SF....
author: Alex W.

description:
Never been here until I went for FiYaH's Birthday!! The party there was "GOLDEN" every third Saturday of the month and it was sooo crackin! We were dancin, drinkin and ALL SMILES-all night!!!! DJ DMadness & DJ Zita killed it!! Classic Hip hop, R&B, Soul & no hyphy, no top 40s...it good music, pretty mature crowd (expect for that one blond, drunk girl with the Bachelorette party who tried to sit on my friend's husband)!!  I'm not into BIG CLUBS, so this was a nice initimate place with great bartenders, clean bathrooms & parking wasn't bad either!

Here's the link to the party!!  http://www.myspace.com/goldenlaszlo
every month is a different theme.."May is Name that Sample"!!!
author: M R.

description: Meh.  The place was alright, but the bartender was a major CU Next Tuesday to us if you know what I mean.  She didn't like the fact that we ordered 3 drinks and then I needed wait like 2 minutes for my other friends to come in so we could order for everyone at once.   So she felt the need to tell me that she wanted to punch me.  She was not kidding.  I was in a good mood and drinking and laughed it off, but on another day I might have kicked her in the twat.  The place has potential, but that chick needs to get a clue and a grip.
author: Adam S.

description:
Was walking on Mission around lunch time and happened to see their brunch deal. Got a top flight burger with a guiness for $10.

They have a great collection of small batch american bourbon as well.  Nothing like a shot of Basil's to help you digest that burger!

Great food, stiff drinks, excellent decor...It's an oasis on mission st.
author: Deep S.

description:
I go every once in a while cause my friends DJ there..  on Mondays

they could probably get more people to go if they lowered the price of their drinks... $7 for a jack n coke in a short and slim glass?   I'll bring my flask next time.. The visuals are lame too.
author: Georgio S.

description: Great space. Feels like a bar ought to feel. No big tv screens great music. Good drinks friendly service. Good After, Befire or Instead of Foreign Cinema
author: Bruce C.

description:
I came here to start off a co-worker's birthday celebration for happy hour on a Saturday night. The bar had dim lighting and looked like a great place for us to hang out, so I was excited to get a stoli drink (or two) in before the end of happy hour. My friend (Annie) and I went to the bar and ordered two stolis w/pineapple juice. I knew that this was what I wanted, but Annie asked the bartender for her recommendation. The bartender responded with "I don't drink." ...A bartender that doesn't drink? That's like a cook that doesn't eat. How do you know if what you're making is any good?

Anyways, we grabbed our drinks and sat down with the group, excited for the night! Annie took a sip of her drink and said "you can't taste the alcohol" to which I responded, "I know! Pineapple juice is a great mixer." She didn't look appreciative. "No, you can't taste the alcohol. Try it." I took a sip of my drink only to discover that I had paid $5 for pineapple juice mixed with water. 

I won't lie - I don't like the taste of alcohol - any of it. I drink, but I don't truly enjoy even the best drink at Bourbon & Branch more than I do a glass of apple juice. And when I can't taste the horrible taste of alcohol in a drink, it means there isn't any. Another friend who had ordered a stoli drink said his didn't taste like it had any alcohol either. After some peer pressure from another awesome co-worker, we approached the bartender who made our drinks and questioned her. She stared blankly and said "I put a lot of alcohol in there. You guys watched me pour it." There were so many things I wish I could've said to her, but I didn't really know how to argue. Anyways, Laszlo is shady and I won't be going back again. I only wish that I had paid attention to which bottle she grabbed and where from so that I could demand a shot of that "alcohol" just to catch them in their crummy practices!
author: Jenny Z.

description: came in here sunday night to a pretty empty bar, but good company made it a fun time. I loved all the russian propaganda and the dimly lit underground feel to the club. Drinks werent cheap but whaddyagonnado?
author: ella a.

description: Woah, what a cool place! First of, I love love LOVE old Soviet propaganda posters. So as soon as I walked in and saw the big poster of Yuri Gagarin on the left, I knew I was going to dig Laszlo. Their happy hour was pretty good - $2 Pils and $5 basic Stoli drinks, if I recall. I was there on Tuesday night, if it makes a difference. I only saw the cocktail menu right before we left, so I'll have to go back to try the Soviet Sunrise and Solaris.
author: Julia D.

description: This IS San Francisco. It was pure change the first time I came to Laszlos. We were trying to get into Medjools' upstairs balcony but one of my friends' dress codes wasn't up-to-par so we headed next door into what we thought was a "Communist Bar". Every time I head into the Mission with that group of friends, we always stop here for their reasonably priced drinks, upstairs balcony seating, random projected films and small outside patio. Definitely a must on a Mission bar crawl.
author: Anna R.

description:
i made out with someone cute here once.  actually, it was more him licking the side of my face and whisper/yelling, "yoouourouwa soo ooo beautifyuhuauuuul hahhaha blah blah blah blah" in my ear/to the whole bar.  at one point, i was able to unstick myself from the guy (who i couldn't manage to stop making out even though it was so damn unpleasant because he was really cute.  like really.  no, you don't know him...he lives in chicago.) and the bartender was all, "i thought he was going to eat the side of your face off...if you need me to kick his ass, i will."  and i was all, "if i do, i will tug on my ear three times.  that is, if i still have an ear left!"  and then we laughed.  oh, we laughed.  then we (not me and the bartender, me and the cute chicagoan) continued the makeout session out of sight until i was so grossed out that he had to be sent home.  

i guess that doesn't make this place so special since i'm a fool for makin' out!  however, i strongly suggest the expertly mixed screwdrivers and delicious chimay.
author: Laura B.

description: I've only seen this place at night. It was alright but nothing really stood out to me here that'd make me want to come back. I think if anything, I'd like to check it out for happy hour, as it gets over-crowded at night and I end up spending more time moving around letting people through than socializing with my friends.
author: Tushar K.

description:
Laszlo was one of the first bars I came to when I first moved here, in another life, in 2002. It was for a private party and I was very, very, very poor so I was eating up the free apps and taking advantage of the open bar like I'd never seen food before in my life (my mother's favorite thing to say whenever I am stuffing my face) (como si nunca has visto comida, is what she says actually). I had just been introduced to the delights of swordfish when my plus one shoved a cracker with a strange spread on it in my face (seriously, in my face).  EAT IT, he dared. And of course, I was all... hell yeah!  The minute I put the cracker into my mouth, he says..."that's FOIE GRAS! LIVER! HAHAHAHAH" The minute he said it, my senses were overwhelmed with the putrid scent and taste of organ meat, which I'd been tricked into eating before (yes, by my conniving mother). I immediately put it away in disgust and continued drinking my Cuba Libre.

Sadly, this was probably the last truly fun thing that has happened to me at Laszlo. It's a beautiful space and yes, I've had fun here, but for my money, there are probably about 10 other bars in La Mision that I would rather go to. And two of them are across the street.
author: Maria D.

description: Had a great time watching MNF there last week.  Very cool, laid back vibe.  Jill the barmaid was edgy, cool, engaging, knowledgeable, & fun.  Screamin' H-Hour deals too!!
author: Dan C.

description: Charging a $5 cover at 1:30AM is unacceptable.  I also think the days of rude door bouncers is over.
author: Tara B.

description: The aesthetic of the place is great, if not a bit cramped downstairs.  I guess there isn't enough room for how many people try to be here.
author: John C.

description: A sexy little cocktail spot attached to foreign cinema (a sexy little dinner spot).  You can order a limited version of the foreign cinema menu, apps and little nibblies.  The crowd is usually a mix of missionites and a smattering of fancy people.  The bartenders are friendly, which is a plus.  Obvs.  The real draw here, tho, is the awesome funk party they host on Thursdays from time to time.  Funk spun exclusively on vinyl and it's really, really good.  Go have some dranks and shake your butt.
author: Emily T.

description: Nice place, but I went for happy hour and my rum and coke was made with some really nasty rum. Everyone in my group thought the drinks were watered down.
author: Marc S.

description: It's just a bar, but it's right next to Medjool and Foreign Cinema which makes it a great place to take a break from the hipsters.
author: Rayna A.

description: While I don't have this bar in my regular rotation, it's pretty decent. I like the decorations and the way it's set up,  but other than that, there's not much to write home about. Music is too loud to have a decent conversation with anyone, and actually not many people at the bar are looking to talk. Didn't feel very friendly to me. Oh well - at least it looks good.
author: Sarah P.

description: Friday night. Friend of a friend DJ'ing. Randomly swung by. Proceeded from gin to beer to gin to beer. Music was bangin. Too good to be played in a place that small with pretty much 0 dance space. It'd be nice if a place with such tall ceilings could be a little more spread out, but it's extremely vertically laid out. Drinks were reasonably priced, not that it matters to a 2-beer wonder, cheap-date like me. Would come again as a place to start the night or one bar out of many in a crawl, but this isn't exactly your all night spot.
author: Chieh T.

description: Hidden between medjool and foreign cinema. It was so loud I could barely hear anyone. The music was decent and the bathrooms were completely no line the entirety of Saturday night.
author: Skye W.

description: One of the best screwdrivers in the city. Fresh OJ, need i say more?
author: Rachel L.

description:
great loft-like spot with a chill scene and some tasty cocktails. try the 'mephisto' with hangar one lime instead of the stoli oranj -- very refreshing and definitely packs a punch.

they play some great music and it's a beautiful space, with lots of room to sit and chill. love the industrial decor and the 2nd floor loft level.

the one caveat: on a busy night, between the DJ and the high ceilings, the place can get pretty noisy. visited most recently on a monday, which was great -- gene (aka mingus r.) was spinning some chill tunes. make sure to check him out next time he's playing!
author: Jill M.

description:
hmmm, what better place for me to order my stoli-crans?

cool themed bar with massive constructivist posters.  i'm sure the music is better some time other than the holidays.  it was rather odd to have happy christmas music blaring in this dark stalinist room.

it's a good waiting place to chill and meet up with friends before dining at foreign cinema.
author: Anh V.

description: Now *this* is a good spot for drinks.  Totally chill atmosphere, fun dj spinning tunes, and very very very tasty drinks!  I had a fabulous shot of something-or-another - made with fresh lime juice and just the right hint of sugar.  It was SO good I finished the whole thing, hence the memory lapse...  also an excellent selection of wine by the glass which makes for a very happy lulu!
author: lulu p.

description: Eh.... I think this place is fine for maybe 1 drink, b/c it's a pretty cool space and the drinks are good, but then I'd move on. Call me old, but I just find it WAY too loud to be enjoyable (this was the case on both occasions I wound up here).
author: beth l.

description: My friends and I went here to start our evening of bar hopping.  We should have actually stayed here the rest of the evening.  Lazlo's is like a loft space and has bright colorful striking Russian Communist propaganda posters adorning it's walls.  Makes  for some pretty interesting drunken conversations.  The crowd is cool and not your run of the mill Mission hip youngsters.
author: Melissa M.

description: You want to have a really good night? Try telling your girlfriend that the fact that she hangs out with people that go to this bar makes you lose respect for her.
author: Chris C.

description: Nice, quiter bar in the mission. Went on a Tuesday night for some appetizers and drinks. Happy hour isn't too great on deals. But the oysters were awesome, and so was the house punch they were serving.
author: Aubree S.

description: I came here after I went to 13..... I mean 12 Galaxy and it has a completely different feel.  It was more of my scene (but of course I'm still down to look at all the skater boys) very relaxed, nice lighting, pretty bar and an upstairs.  I will definitely be stopping by here again to see it a little better.  But  I know the bartenders are nice because I did not have much money and still got a drink!  Thanks!
author: Megan L.

description: I guess I am the only one who doesn't enjoy this place, loud...DID I SAY LOUD...terrible music...drinks not good...please don't come here to relax after work...maybe I am just not feelin the Euro vibe..
author: Dee D.

description:
moved to SF last march, so i was still looking for the places to go for a drink and for some good music.

online, i saw that 'inna da light' is every thursday.  ...playing roots and dancehall, reggae, hip hop, funk, remixes, and mashups.

yes.

happy hour until 9pm.

absolutely yes.

here was the problem:  i couldn't find anyone to go w/me.  this almost kept me from going, but... 'why should i let that stop me?' i thought.  so i went.

bah

mah

self.

second time venturing out to a drinking establishment on my own (first time wasn't that great b/c of the place that i went to), so i didn't know what to expect...  turned out to be a great time!  the bartender bought me a drink, and i met one of the djs who is now one of my friends!

very chill place, and the people fit that same mold.

the second time that i came here was part of my several day bday celebration (family and friends were in town, so i set up a few venues.. otherwise, i wouldn't have made such a big deal for my bday).  it was perfect for my friends - - the barflies, the clubheads, and the stay-at-homes alike.  everyone had a great time.

wish i could've had a dance floor, but other than that, laszlo will definitely see me again.
author: Ting A.

description: This place was packed!  I liked that it was packed.  It seems that lately when I go out things are kind of slow in the city.  This place was hopping and warm and I liked the music playing.  Granted, I didn't stay long; I was just stopping there on my way out from dinner at Foreign Cinema.  But the vibe was good!  I'll come back sometime and really chill for a while.
author: Lauren S.

description: This is the place I sit and people watch and drink while I wait for my friends to give up on ever getting a waitress's attention next door at Medjool.  I'm more of a "drinking in the dark while watching" kinda girl then a "soaking up the rays waiting forever for a crappy drink" kinda girl , so I'm much happier here with the attentive bartenders and the fabulous music and the great drinks and the yummy food then the crappy attitude with views at Medjool any day of the week. Especially any day that Ryan or GoGo are working.
author: Cosmolicious L.

description: It was definitely nice to have a bar be so energized on a Sunday night, but it somehow seemed a little dingier than I would have expected a bar attached to Foreign Cinema would be. Still, the drinks were good, although the final gin and tonic got me a little drunker than I anticipated, and it had a nice, friendly atmosphere...
author: Arwen O.

description: Mojito, Mojito, Mojito! I'm not usually a fan of regular mojito's without some kind of fruit flavoring added to it (i.e. Strawberry Mojito's), but Laszlo makes great, fresh Mojito's! The flavor from the mint leaves aren't too strong, and are well balanced with the lime. They look small and taste friendly, but beware... they can be deadly after you've had a few! (and rest-assured, I am no lightweight drinker...) But who knows, maybe the bartender that night just made them extra strong? Anyway, Lazlo is a teeny, tiny little bar, but a good place to go to if you want to have a few drinks with friends.
author: Felicia C.

description: Came here for my  brothers birthday a few days ago- Cute little space with fun music. There was only one bartender on staff that night (It was a Tuesday) so it was a bit of a challenge to order a drink- It seemed she had her regulars there and was paying more attention to them, rather than other customers, but oh well, she finally did come over and we got our drinks and had fun.
author: Tara M.

description: mixed times here. I went here once with a big group and it was packed. Then I went on another where it was fun cause it was old school hip-hop but there was a cover and there never is a cover. Then I went there with just my roommate and it was dead. Never can get the right atmosphere. The door guy is cool though. My friend who is Leily P. 's(fellow yelper)  friend always says its just a bad night but ive been there with her everytime
author: Chris L.

description: I like this spot.  I first discovered it a few months ago while waiting for a table at Foreign Cinema next door.  Cool vibe, $2 Trumer Pils at Happy Hour (till 9pm), and an overall nice space.  Went again last night and had fun, though it was much more crowded and much louder.  Fun music (a great mix for having a beer and hanging out, reaching back old skool with Paperboy's Ditty and Journey's Don't Stop Believin', to name a few.)  A good option when you find yourself in that 'hood.
author: Louis M.

description: Not sure if I like this place so much because of the Communist propaganda or the fact that I just hate Medjool so much that it makes this place the perfect escape.
author: Lou Y.

description: Eh. Suck!  Pricey, loud, crappy bartender (he paid more attention to the delivery guy who was done delivering than my group), and for what aims to be a ritzy place, the selection was also lackluster.  I go to bars for the same reason I go to restaurants, I don't have to do the footwork and there's room for my friends to hang out  and I don't have to clean up afterwards... So if I'm going to be paying that much, you better be mashing up some fresh mint or jugging bottle behind your back, not being a jerk who doesn't provide service.  Decor was nice, and a second start for when he did finally serve us, he accidentally sheared the top of the bottle off and was actually responsible enough to throw it away.
author: Josh Z.

description: Can you say, "I'm too cool to serve you"?  Then maybe you could get a job here.  Typically I like the atmosphere in this place but there were two of us at the bar and two of them behind the bar and maybe we were invisible or something but I think I'll only go back when the place is busy so there's an excuse for bad service.
author: laura a.

description: On a Friday evening after work for a friend's send-off party, the friendly attentive bartenders were pushing some pretty heavy '80s tunes. This is ironic because the '80s were a time of American Cold War anti-Communist fever, which would make this place anti-its-own-artwork on all the walls.
author: Rob T.

description: We were invited to a Laszlo's bar last weekend for a private cocktail party upstairs and I was pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere. It was not too crowded and it wasn't a dive bar that you couldn't take your significant other. The restrooms were clean and more then adequate.  I just hate bars where the restroom ratio is four total urinals per 500 people. The bar had a projector and was showing movies and a small light show on the wall. Overall the experience was great. I would recommend this place for a couple grabbing a drink on their first date or if you were trying to rent an area for a cocktail party; the upstairs balcony is perfect for about 75 people.
author: Glock P.

description: Great spot to stumble in on a night with people you have never met. Really strong drinks with some good beats will set your night off for sure!
author: Yelper A.

description: Overall, a passable but not particularly memorable experience.  The seating seems okay, the decor seems okay, the general ambiance is okay.  Granted I was there on a Wednesday night, but like 10 colleagues were along too.  I think what soured me was coming in and seeing three buddies with full Chimay glasses - I went to the bar and ordered one for myself, and was presented with an empty glass...and a bottle.
author: Oliver N.

description: I have mixed feelings about Laszlo; it's so close to Medjool, so it risks infection.  At the same time, the music is usually pretty good.
author: Des Esseintes I.

description: Cool space that feels a bit out of place in the mission...drinks are good and strong, the music ranged from wow! to huh?  A bit dark but that's probably a good thing if you're looking to have your face licked (ala Laura B.)
author: phil h.

description: Went here last night, super convenient that it was attached to Foreign Cinema. Good music playing, would've been fun if it was big enough to have a dance floor. I like how the DJ was standing at the bar bobbing his head to his jams.  Communist style posters, foreign films, however, somewhat creepy films...but still interesting. Entertaining to watch guys flying solo trying to hit on large groups of girls...I wonder if it worked out for them? I liked the atmosphere, really chill.
author: Sonya D.

description: Cute little bar that is connected to Foreign Cinema and right next door to Medjool's.  We were early for our reservations, so the hostess told us that we could grab drinks at their bar that was in the restaurant or a lounge that was next door but connected to the restaurant.  They had really good happy hour specials including $2.00 Trumer Pilsners and $5.00 for drinks made with Stoli... The bar was really cute and it even had a little upstairs...They have DJ's and it turns more into a lounge at night.
author: Kymberli C.

description: As much as I want to steal all of their Soviet propaganda posters, I wouldn't have the heart because it would take away from the ambience--and that's what keeps me coming back.  The drinks are solid (my roomie ordered the solaris, good for sweet + tart cravings), and the music is excellent (I wish I knew who was spinning last Thursday because the beats were hottttt).   The movie projections are always entertaining: one night showed 1950s Disney cartoons, while another night had something bizarre that fell between Fellini and 1970s porn (or maybe I was too drunk to process it properly...even better).  For what it's worth, I prefer weeknights, but in my opinion, this place can do no wrong.
author: Andrea U.

description: Completely communist chic. Monkey felt so red after looking at all of the Lennin portraits, he wanted to unite the nation under the red banner ... and he could probably do it, too. Don't doubt the butler. Also, one of the barbacks looks like a pirate. Laszlo has a tight space when it's at full capacity, which is perfect for those cold summer nights. Moderately made/priced drinks. Monkey'd do it again.
author: Monkey B.

description: Ended up at Laszlo after Foreign Cinema was packed for Sunday Brunch.  The bartender was very nice, the food was excellent, and the wait was non-existent.  Would definitely go back, and as a bar it looks fun too.
author: Charles D.

description: Went in on a Tuesday with my dog. Everything worked out well. Not packed with any one type of person, everyone was pettin' my dog, nice and dark. Will try again.
author: Jason M.

description: This is the spot to hear good music on the 3rd Saturdays of the month; DJZita and Dmadness hold it down.  Happy hour until 9p, love that.
author: jane d.

description: this place is pretty bad-ass. their happy hour is until 9, which is unheard of around here. $2 trumers? hell yeah. $5 vodka/pineapple/soda concoctions(non happy-hour price) were cool too. it's a small place, but they have upstairs seating are as well. however, it was hot as hell up there, so we chilled downstairs most of the time.  good crowd, nice bartenders, and they play movies on the wall. defintiely a great spot in the mission. i will surely be back at some point.
author: Andrew T.

description: Friends took us here last night to enjoy some drinks after dinner. The music was grand, a dj spinning some good reggae and a b&w movie was projected onto the back wall. We had the whole upstairs to ourselves and were able to lounge around on the couches, kind of a nice touch. The drinks were a bit mini, I would order a double if it was busy otherwise you might as well enjoy your cocktail while you get in line for another. I'd say the only caveat was the pot smoking, I think it's illegal at bars. Overall we had a fabulous time.
author: Margaux L.

description: Great place. Decent prices, good selection. Good music. Also a nice place to go for brunch if you wanna avoid the craziness of Foreign Cinema but still enjoy their delicious brunch food.
author: Kevin L.

description: I really like this place.  It's has a really good balance within somewhat small area.  The drinks are well done.  Let's go!!!!
author: Xiu L.

description: Great happy hour: $5 Stoli drinks and $2 beers. The best part is that if you order a "well" vodka it costs more than the Stoli. The tunes are nice as well, a good mix with everything from Kings of Leon to the Rolling Stones.
author: Nicolas H.

description:
this is one of my ideals for a bar.
mellow lights. 
sleek without killin me on pretense. 
a dj with some bump. 
tenders that are good at their craft and don't have a complex about it.
hangar one's buddhas hand vodka. 

what am i doing tuesday night...
author: Jeremi M.

description: A welcome surprise. Chic, euro, 2-tier set-up. You roll over after dinner at Foreign Cinema, which is so convenient. I'm into it. Again, I approve.
author: Jess P.

description: Great place.. Cheap-ish drinks (comparatively), great DJ, and nice laid back yet fun atmosphere.  Being Hungarian though, and knowing that Laszlo is traditionally a Hungarian name, I was confused by all the Russian posters.. Still a cool place though and I highly recommend it.  Also enjoyed the movie going in the back, kind of funny to be able to stare at something when the conversation runs dry.. hahaha.  I'll definitely be going back when I'm the city.
author: Michael S.

description: Sunday happy hours/late nights are the best here. But thats cause I love GOGO. That's my girl from streetwars, and she hooks it UP! Strong drinks, cool upstairs loft... and easy access to cabs to drive your drunk ass home.
author: Marina K.

description: Sweet spot to hook up with friends to drink and gossip.  If you are sitting up stairs near the window it is fun to interact with all the drunks walking by outside.  Bartenders are cool, but sipping too much on the molasses.  Not really for dancing but if you walk out to the long corridor that connects to Foreign Cinema, there is plenty room to bust a flare, windmill, or just straight battle someone that just walked out of the bathroom.
author: omar b.

description: I love this damn place but only go there on Saturday afternoons when Jack is working. You can order food from Foreign Cinema and the drinks are delish.
author: Heather L.

description: Been there once and it was very enjoyable.  The bartender was really nice and the crowd laid back and friendly also.  The upstairs lounge area and the movies projected on the walls are both nice touches.
author: Nicole I.

description: Music was good, atmosphere was Euro, slideshow of naked women and Saddam Hussein was interesting...but the drinks were really weak.  Nice happy hour though.
author: Tabatha Y.

description: The bartenders here do know how to make a good drink.  The cosmopolitans are very balanced with the liquor and the sweet.  There's an upstairs portion of the bar with some couches near windows that face the street.  It's very cozy.
author: CAKE E.

description: I liked the whole Metropolis-type vibe.  If you're into the whole communist nostalgia thing, you'll probably enjoy this place.
author: Amy F.

description: Good spot!  Definitely recommend this bar.  Good service, excellent beats and a unique crowd.  This place doesn't discriminate based on people's appearance unlike some other spots in the Mission.
author: Danielle V.

description: I went to Laszlo last night with some friends after eating at  Foreign Cinema. It was actually a really cool friendly crowd. Good music. Great drinks. Really nice bartenders. Totally friendly. Even though it was pretty packed, they were really nice. I'll be back.
author: LISA G.

description: I really like this bar.  It's put together real nice.  They have the best TV I've ever layed eyes on and a great upper balcony area.  The drinks are not overpriced and the bartenders are great.  The best part is that on a Saturday afternoon you can go in for lunch and enjoy the best "bar food" ever cause it comes from Foreign Cinema's kitchen.  It's my way of dabbling my toe into the pool of the upper crust.  Way too many metaphors.
author: Corey V.

description: Cool atmosphere.  Reasonably priced drinks.  While the music is cool, it's not always so danceable. . .and even if it were, there's not much room to dance anyway.  Despite the lack of dancing (usually a prerequisite for me liking a bar), I've almost always had a good time when coming here.  So when my friend decided to show up 2 1/2 hours late for her birthday party here, I didn't mind one bit.
author: Danielle B.

description: Great place to have a cocktail without all of the preening and pretense that goes on next door at Medjool. Attentive bartenders, great drinks and lovely lighting in a minimalist chic space paying homage to all things Soviet. Better on weeknights than weekends.
author: Suepattra M.

description: Russian theme-bar with Reggae tunes? Good stuff, and that doesn't even count the drinks...
author: Mariangela S.

description: Funky little place with good drinks and music but it gets hot inside. They have a cool little, hip area that you have to walk up to and you can just sit down and chill.  Come with a group of friends and have a good time!
author: Mel P.

description: I have mixed feelings about this bar. For some reason, I don't always feel totally comfortable here, I don't know why. And it's not because of people looking down at me from the upstairs part - it seems to be open only half the time. However, the good things trump the bad: 1) happy hour til 9 pm every night, with $2 Trumers (even regular beer prices are pretty great) and such, 2) my friend's favorite bartender is generous with the pours (there's usually room for only a splash of soda) and 3) I used to come here with my girlfriends regularly on Thursdays, so lots of good, fuzzy memories. I like how it's usually not too crowded, although sometimes it can be packed to the gills. Anyway it's better than the place next door.
author: Amy K.

description: I spent 2009 NYE here.  The venue is failry small and narrow but it wasn't too crowded.  It was nice to have a balcony where you can look down on all the drunk fatties.  Drinks were reasonably priced at about $7.  The manatee drank a bottle of wine before she went and had a shot of patron when she arrived.  She had to go home by 1100pm.  But there was no way in hell I was leaving NYE at 1045pm.  My other fat friend made out with my second gf.  He is my hero.  This is a cool place as long as it doesn't get too packed.  Otherwise it will probably suck.
author: Fatty A.

description: Snooooo.... Teeeeeeee. An interesting little spot connected to a really nice restaurant, but man-oh-Manischewitz, there's more attitude in this tiny room than an Art Institute graduation party. Get over yourselves, people.
author: Andrew L.

description: Nice space and good music but... it was a little too quiet overall.
author: Yuichi S.

description: Good bar. Great for pre dinner drinks at Foreign Cinema. You can actually order appetizers from Foreign Cinema there. I've been here a bunch of times. The DJ on Thursdays is awesome playing lots of old school hip hop stuff you don't normally hear. But on the weekends post 10 oclock the place is pretty packed. Good drinks. Nice drink menu for you sweet drink lovers.
author: Hyung L.

description: A chill place to hang out, the music is always on point.  The crowd can vary and there's no dance floor.  Last time I went, the bartender cut up an entire lime and dumped it into my girlfriend's mojito...so we fish out the lime wedges and it's a half full (i'm an optimist) glass of muddled mint and lime pulp.  I went back.  He put in some 7up, a little simple syrup, it was a little too sweet, even for her, but he gets credit for trying.
author: Mike U.

description:
it's been a month.  i have given myself a sufficient cool down period, contemplated the consequences of what i have to say on this establishment as a whole, and thought long and hard about writing this review. but, truth be told, the owner should thank me for the light I'm about to shine on a bad apple, a veritable cancer in laszlo's side...

about a month ago, a group of 5 of us arrive at the bar after dinner at limon down the street. not too crowded this particular night, and i'm happy that a good and friendly bartender welcomes us. he brings us our gin martinis, vodka cranberries, and beers. nothing fancy, nothing special.  we have a short friendly exchange.  so I'm ready to settle in for a few more drinks, pleased to have a good bartender by my side, my spirits are high, if a bit too self-satisfied that we weren't at medjool next door.  and we really did start to have a perfectly fine evening, that is, until we were in for another round and I had to encounter the preter-menstrual she dog behind the bar.  

who are you?  but more importantly, what the hell is your problem??

what could happen to spark such ire in me?  well, it began like this.  the nice guy bartender went away for a bit, to the upstairs loft, actually, rearranging chairs and what not.  as i waited at the bar for the other bartender on duty - female, shortish dirty blonde hair, i waved my hand at her when we made eye contact.  not in a 'over here, lackey!' kind of way, but more in a 'hey, when you get a chance' kind of way to let her know that we were ready to order more drinks.  mind you, my good readers, i waved my hand, not my arm, when we made eye contact, not at her or behind her back.  but instead of smiling, or giving a nod back, or just getting to us when she could, she yells out from the other end of the bar "don't wave at me, i can see you!  so you don't have to wave at me!" 

i don't know. i suppose i could have let this go.  i could have said nothing, walked out, and never come back.  but something was seriously amiss.  like what the f just happened?!? kind of amiss.  i consider myself to have solid bar etiquette.  and as i said, we were having a good time and i really didn't feel like moving a bunch of people, which would take some explaining and then a possible scene.  so i waited patiently until she came over.  after we got our drinks, i calmly explained that after waiting a bit i waved my hand because i wasn't sure if she knew i wanted her attention but assured her I wasn't trying to be rude.  but there was apparently already a serious rift between us since my attempt to address the situation only unleashed the fury in her.  she repeated that i didn't have to wave, that waving to get her attention was rude.  moreover, didn't we know "this is MY bar?!?".  a scene was not to be averted.  i asked her if she was kicking us out or if she wanted us to leave.  i even told her how she's served me before and was perfectly fine and that i really didn't understand what her problem was now.  to which she screeched, "why don't you just go and yelp about me then?!"  at first i thought maybe she recognized me from somewhere?? ... curious, but no.

it all started to make sense when i looked on yelp.  i read some of the other reviewers' complaints and i get it.  you put your post-punk too cool for school attitude on and serve your drinks with a tight lip and a blank stare.  maybe you thought you could be the next drink-nazi bartendress who could make people shudder and swoon.  but when people called you out on your unnecessary hipster ennui, your funk ass got all sore and started lashing out.  

first off lady, it seems you need a hug.  and second, a new line of employment.  you need to find a less offensive way to work your shit out.  a few years ago, we'd have gone to fisticuffs, cause i would have reached right over the bar and smacked you upside the head.  (you can take the girl out of queens, nyc.... ) but i've found other ways of working my shit out here in this fine city, and so should you.

we all left and won't be going back. if people wanted to get rankled for no good reason we could just stand out on the street in these here parts, and we wouldn't have stepped into YOUR bar.   nice work, lady.  just keep working that magic and you'll drive this redundant bar into the ground in no time.
author: Nikki F.

description: A swank yet affable place with strong libations and dark, flattering lighting.  The otherwise good music is occasionally marred by an over-affinity to 80s hair bands on the part of the DJs.
author: Gabriel S.

description: Haven't had the occasion to go to Foreign Cinema yet, but I did stop in to this place on my birthday bar crawl.  Our group definitely had divided opinions about this place, and the reason is obvious: this place is very LA and somewhat clubby.  So if, like me, you're more of a SF fog-and-fireplace loving type, you can see how this place would rate a mere 3 stars.  However, I give it a bonus star because the 2-story architecture is sweet, and the cocktails are the real thing here.  I might even like the whole place more on a non-Saturday, when I could feel slightly less like part of a clubby, poser mob.
author: Wes M.

description: My first visit was last Friday. Like the space and the service. I'll have to go back to see if it's obnoxious later in the evening.
author: Rene D.

description: I completely fell in love with the Soviet theme at this place. The massive poster of Lenin on one wall is sooo cool. Ever since I went to Laszlo a few months ago during a stay in San Fran I've dreamt of partially adopting the CCCP theme for my loft back home in Phoenix. Then I picture the picketing outside my building of "Commie go home!" and the death of my future political career, and I snap back to reality.
author: Pierre Trudeau I.

description:
it was a super chill sunday night.
actually it was frickin' freezing.
we just got done having dinner and didn't feel like ending the night just yet. so, we stopped by here on our way to going to another bar, but decided to stay here at laszlo's instead.
it was rather empty, which was perfect for us, cuz we all wanted to chill and converse. the music was a bit loud but not too bad.
they bartender mixed us up some really healthy kettle one vodka tonics. thank you.
my back was to the door and the crowd, so i didn't even realize that the bar was becoming full with people.
about 12:30 and after my 3rd i decided it was time to call it a night and head back to my friends to get some rest before my 7 am flight.
damn, i AM getting old. sigh.
hanging out at laszlo was a cool end, to my brief visit back to the bay.
author: Kione E.

description:
i heart communist propaganda.
i heart dark places
i don't really heart their music
if if wasn't for the commie decor, this place would not really stick out from the crowd. i'd come back if i were invited, but i wouldn't seek this place out.

all that being said, i didn't indulge in any of the drinks, which were said to be yummy.
author: Helen N.

description: They always rock out with the DJs here.  Slick, thumping, non-intrusive beats that keep you coming back... for another drink, and another.  If with one friend only, upstairs is the best (don't stand too close to the railing).  Nice lil' slideshow on continual rotation.  Where, oh where, do they get some of those images?  Laszlo is not the best place to hang on the weekend... it gets out of control... sometimes.  Sometimes can be often enough.
author: Ivana I.

description:
The best part about this place is easily the dark, inviting, romantic atmosphere. Candle light is about all you get after dark. And the upstairs balcony which offers more privacy for those people who want to get buzzed and enjoy a sexy makeout session without advertising it. 

Lazlo has great drink specials at happy hour, which include cheap imports and low-priced cosmos. The one "downside" is there's not an extensive wine list. I had to wait in line behind a group of people asking the bartender to go over all three types of red about a million times. If you want a special, esclusive wine what the fuck are you doing here?? Take tomorrow off work and DRIVE up to Napa for godsake. 

Anyways, they always play a good set of music from one of several iPods provided by the waitstaff on that shift. Coincidentally, I also had my iPod so after a couple drinks, I asked if they'd play a few songs from it- and they plugged it right in. 

There's something about slammin' a $4 martini while rockin' out to Journey's "Don't Stop Believin'" - the other patrons were all tapping their feet and holding imaginary lighters skyward. 

Definately going back for another happy hour soon!
author: Alex G.

description: I love this bar!! Great atmosphere and great service. I told the bartender with the chops to make me a cocktail with hendricks and fruit and it was delicious!! Definitely one of the coolest bars I've been to in the city.
author: Christine C.

description: The bar that shares the premise with Foreign Cinema. Dark room projecting photos circa 1980s. Trendy yet unpretentious scene and bi-level setting with lighted candles all around. Nice mix to the Mission area bars. Me had fun....
author: Yan M.

description: My favorite spot for brunch on a hangover. Could be because I know the Sunday staff...but fresh crab and champagne is a delightful way to begin the afternoon. The prices are really good too. There's an extensive brunch menu that consists of local produce and such. The most delightful thing in the universe is their bacon with carmelized brown sugar...deadly delicious.
author: Colleen B.

description:
laszlo and foreign cinema share the same owner... and the same bathrrom (which is a good thing... possably the cleanest bar bathroom ever) and like most places in the mission, its best to stay away on the weekends. the places is rediculously loud for its set up, and quite frankly, theres nothing really special about it. but it is a decent place to get an early 'pre-drink drink'.

the only reason ive given it as many stars as i did is that when its not busy, get a seat upstairs and no one really bothers if you have a couple of cigarettes by the window... if thats your thing... cause its mine.
author: N. B. K.

description: The first time I went to Laszlos I was with my fiancee and this stupid girl was hanging all over him calling him schmoopie and sitting on his lap and I didn't much care because my fiancee doesn't go for DOGS but still, it didn't exactly make my night enjoyable. So I think my impression of Laszlo's is a bit tainted. I was there again this week and it's not too bad actually, the music is a bit overwhelming for me but the atmosphere  is pretty chill and fun.
author: Cathy T.

description: Just got back from a Thursday night listening to some Reggae. The DJ was good and played a nice selection of 45's. The crowd was perfect for the size of the place, although it did not seem like a Reggae crowd. Plenty of street parking and no cover. Drink prices were average although they had no bottle water just tap.
author: Justin M.

description: great happy hour ($2 Trumer bottles), but generally uncrowded to downright vacant until about 10pm when it turns into a bit of a mob scene. Decent music spun every night that I've been there starting at around 9pm. I've never had to pay cover.
author: Lena C.

description: i enjoy how the bar is dimly lit.  i like to stop in here for a beverage when it's mellow and not packed to the brim.  decent happy hour.
author: Sheri N.
