description: Good times if you can handle the crowds on the weekend. Good tunes from the DJ on a Saturday night-- just watching him dance and bump his own tables made my night.
author: Michie L.

description: Where Pac Heights goes to get gritty. The place is gorgeous, the outside delicious, and you can always find a pretty crowd. If you're looking for edge, this aint your spot, but it's a good place to get away from it in a pretty edgy 'hood.
author: Seiji C.

description: Everytime I'm disappointed by Medjool's cover charge, crowd or if the roof deck is close...I turn to you, Laszlo...and I have to say...you are totally growing on me. Good drinks, friendly bartenders and great music.
author: Anita C.

description: I just got back from Moscow, so the Soviet theme may be biasing my review.
author: Tinou B.

description:
don't like medjool? then hit this place up! 

it's nothing special, which makes it special.  sometimes you want to get lost in a run of the mill bar where the drink prices are low and the crowd is present but not apparent. 

a great place to kick off the night!
author: Ameer N.

description: So we stopped by on a Saturday night - $5 cover? Um... lame. We got out of that (3 girls, lots of bitching). Went in, saw that most people were twice our age, got a drink, walked around, and then left. My friend who loves this place swears that it was a bad night (read: not so attractive people), but oh well. The actual venue looks nice, I might come again, maybe.
author: Leily P.

description: Stopped by here for a drink....pretty chill and cozy place.  I like the upstairs part and I also like how they play random movies.  Only complaint is that it was so dark...but good drinks and friendly bartenders.
author: E M.

description: Not bad... like an oasis on the otherwise grungy Mission Street. A bit more chill in the earlier evening before the DJ gets there.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Not a bad place.  I dont know why it is called a club though.  They have a dj but no dance club area.  I also thought it was kinda funny that the dj was set up at the bar with his turn tables on the bar.  Anyways to say this place is anymore than a regular bar would be too much.  Its an ok place to get drinks.   It is far to loud to talk to anyone though.
author: Shawn L.

description: I was so happy to sit at the bar and watch the bartender freshly squeeze the juice that went into my cocktail. They mix 'em mean. We were here early Friday evening, and I liked the vibe. It was chill and relaxed, and I really appreciated the variety of seating options. There were dimly lit corner booths, a narrow upstairs corridor leading to a larger upstairs lounge, or even an outdoor patio. This one's a keeper for the weekends!
author: Purnima M.

description: I've been to foreign cinema several times but never stopped thru the bar next door called Lazlo. I got taken here this weekend and its this great chill sexy spot. Two levels, the top as a balcony overlooking the first floor. The lighting really dark and then such great beats...impressive djs. To top it all off good drinks that werent outrageously priced.
author: Farrah S.

description:
came here for a friend's bday party on a saturday night. the place was super dark and the drinks were relatively cheap - around $6 for a diet coke and rum. the music was loud and the bar was crowded which i liked.

my friend had reserved the room upstairs for his bday. the room was pretty sweet with lots of seating and brighter lights - you could actually see people. the downside-no bar/bartender/wait staff on the second floor so everyone had to go down to the first floor to get their drink on.
author: elissa w.

description: Only stayed a couple minutes because of lame friends, but from what I could see laszlo is an awesome bar, and propaganda is a super fun night.  It was early and it was already packed, with no cover and good music.
author: Matt N.

description: This is a great bar in a great location next to (shared with) one of the best restaurants in the city.  I love the openness of the bar and the second story that looks out onto the street.  The daily beer specials are pretty good too.
author: Rise G.

description: Awesome bar!!! Chill staff, awesome drinks, and probably my favorite bar to kick in the mission...
author: Rich P.

description: Love happy hour here, $4 cozmos that will get ya tipsy in no time. They also have $2 pilsners for the guy who won't drink something pink. Great place to unwind after work.
author: Jenny C.

description: Super legit place to booze.  I was there on a Sunday night and they had this cute little guy spinning his records.  His posse came along and livened the place up quite a bit.  I shall return.  Though, I wish a hangover wasn't part of the deal.
author: Meghan B.

description: Great place for a few drinks.  Very low key but hip place to drink some top shelf.  I like the lighting and drinks are fairly easy to order.  Be prepared to stand during busy hours, but it is not overly crowded.
author: E L.

description:
2/18 update:
the champagne is actually not good, as previously reported. went here for happy hour a week ago and champagne not particularly good, no. perhaps originally thought it was good due to level of intoxication upon imbibing, or possibly just excited about the prospect of champagne. it's champagne, sure, and they have it, yes, but it's not good. kthxbye.

k, i always have a blast here. i've only been on sunday nights for propaganda, come to think of it, but always so so fun. good music.  i love any bar that has good champagne, which they do. fun sceney scene and that balcony loft thing upstairs is cool. 4 stars because the bathroom sitch sucks. oh, and not to sound like i'm 80, but it's so fucking loud that i can't hear myself think, much less talk. love the candle vibe they got going on though.
author: Mary V.

description:
Good Spot.

Good for an hour or so but not a whole lot going on there.

I think they have a good deal on bottles of Trumer Pilsner till 9pm,  $2.00
author: Henry C.

description: Was here on a Saturday night and thoroughly enjoyed myself. Good dj good mixed crowd good movie playing on the wall.
author: Mike C.

description:
sunday brunch at laszlo is basically the shit.  great foreign cinema food, mimosas with fresh oj.  good good stuff.

good at night too.  i like sunday nights here.  and they serve chartreuse.  they get brownie points for that alone.  sitting outside is great too.
author: Crystal T.

description: My boyfriend and I decided to hang out here before dinner at Beretta Saturday night.  You can never go wrong with this place.  The bartenders are fun and the decor is great!  Laszlo just makes you feel warm and toasty inside...oh wait...might have been the alcohol..
author: Abby E.

description: Wow!! A bar in the Mission that actually takes credit cards.  Its nice to find a mission bar with a little bit of neighborhood diversity.  Good contrast to Valencia bars and the cheesiness that seeps from medjool.
author: Solbiato S.

description: After getting kicked out of Medjool on a Saturday night, I headed over here  to find some tight, non-mainstream hip-hop beats being spun smoothly by some lady dj and my usual drink for $2 less.....all without a cover.
author: Elly L.

description: Like the industrial inside. Great drinks, fun music. Cute girl bartender with awesome white leather boots. Sweet tight-shirted Eurotrash boys. Need I say more?
author: Liboo K.

description: If you have superficial out-of-town guests visiting you in the Mission and they won't walk far, go here.  Its like Los Angeles in the Mission District.  Not terrible but kinda dumb.
author: pauline e.

description: a must stop on the hipster streets of the mission~its rite next to medjool~so after the rooftop bar scene....i recommend heading over here...my type of spot thats loungy....good crowd....dj spinning the sick beats....no cover....got the lil screen atop playin movies...if your sick of this spot~go down the street to brunos & get yo groove on
author: elmer d.

description: A fun place in a so so neighborhood. Laszlo is fun bar with a cute boy and a drink upstairs - for added privacy.
author: Michele A.

description: I randomly walked into this place and didnt know what to expect, but this place is uber cool! The music was excellent, garage rock interspersed with new wave, and the place definitely had a hip vibe but was not too pretentious. An excellent place to be if you just want to chill out with friends over a few drinks.
author: Naveen P.

description: love the space - high ceilings, cool design.  and nice staff.  scene is hit or miss, and i don't know why they play the music so loud.  this place would be perfect if it were located somewhere like 25th and Guererro and and kept is a quiet but classy neighborhood joint
author: James R.

description: came here for the soundground happy hour for my free upper playground T-shirt.  free beer from 6-7 = douche bags galore, no etiquette, no "excuse me", no nothing.  popped collars and all, please go to charm school. the staff was cool and my free T shirt rocks!
author: Pickle R.

description: What a sexy little bar. I stumbed across this place after dinner at the Foreign Cinema. Great looking crowd, chill vibe. The drinks are so good and the bartenders are really friendly. The happy hour here is phenomenol...at $4 a cosmopolitan, I was suddenly really, really happy...What really sets this place apart is the music....love love love Laszlo!
author: Nicole R.

description: it was alright. a little too noisy inside for me so sitting out on the street at the tables provided were a lot better for conversation, drinking and people watching. stars for having a DJ inside spinning music and a bartender who looks like a pirate!
author: kristin e.

description: i love that i was able to escape from medjool and find refuge.  plus, a friend of mine spins here once a month.
author: Seong P.

description: we came here last night before hitting up little baobab.  it wasn't crowded, and we got our drinks quickly.  i got some drink w/ ketel one, lemonade and blackberry bourbon, and it was really good.  they serve hoegaarden here, but they don't have any beers on tap.  :(
author: Helen T.

description: good dive bar to prefunk. good choice in music. round up the circle of friends and just have a good time!
author: Mika D.

description: hidden gem of the nightlife scene in san franpsycho.
author: dae m.

description: nice cocktails but i bit sceeny with gross posers going to medjool.
author: SF U.

description: when i'm richer, maybe i will habitually hit up laszlo for a $4 bottle of stella, but until then...i'll stick with the dive bars.
author: Rebecca M.

description:
I joined Yelp specifically to warn all potential patrons, specifically women, to avoid this place. If only it were possible to rate a place with negative stars, I would. 

I spent New Year's Eve here, as I was invited by friends who had reserved it for the evening, and had a relatively good time, until the end. 

The bar's decent...kinda small and very small balcony. Drinks are what you'd expect for SF/Mission, minus I asked the bartender for something not much more difficult than a vodka/cran and his reply was "not right now"...you'd think that if drinks are $7-10 a piece, he could make time, but I forgave him seeing as it WAS New Year's Eve.  

At the end of the night, the steroid raging manbearpig of a bouncer stormed through the bar screaming that "everyone needs to get the F**K out of the bar!" Well, like most normal people, we took this as our cue to leave. We (my best friend and I..who are 24 year old young women and about 5'3") walked over to where are coats and purses were, by which time the bouncer had turned around and I guess decided we weren't moving fast enough (it was maybe 10 seconds after he yelled to the whole bar). He grabbed my friend and literally pushed her out of the bar, sans purse. After verbally trying to get the bouncer to understand that all we needed was the purse so that we could leave as he requested, I turned around into the door way to try to get back in so that I could physically retrieve it, but was met with a fist in my face and was knocked to the ground. At this point, I was angry and my friend was bawling outside because, not only did we just get physically abused for no reason, but we still couldn't get her stuff back, so I called the cops. 
Moral of the story:
1) The bouncer's name is Mike and he should be fired on the spot. 
2) The manager never once came to see what happened, and thus, should be fired on the spot. 
3) Women BEWARE. Evidently it's acceptable for the men in this bar to hit women and get away with it.
author: S G.

description: Good for weekday nights, loungey, but a few clubbers stray in from Modjool's.  Fast service good music, mixed crowd w/ more young than old.  The best part is they have an easement onto the sidewalk where you can drink and smoke outside.
author: E G.

description: OK, how many pirates does it take to pour drinks at Laszlo's? Actually, I'm not sure but there is at least one. Seriously, they have a resident pirate. I've never been to a bar with a pirate. Too cool! Rumor has it that David Hasselhof has been spotted here too as well as a great bartender named Phil. I highly recommend this place for all the aforementioned characters as well as great atmosphere and cocktails!
author: Erin L.

description: Went on a quiet Thursday night. Nothing much to say, but the door staff and bartenders we're friendly, so thats always a plus. Drinks are about standard for the neighborhood. I'm thinking Fridays and Saturdays are better, so I would try it then.
author: Jeremy J.

description: great place to meet up with friends and have a drink. can get crowded at times but still a good vibe. the upstairs section is my favorite. also a good place for a first date since the lights are low and music is always good.
author: denise s.

description: oh hell i love this place. somehow i get into lots of trouble here..its just a few stumbling blocks from home! bryan is  awesome and turned me on to my new favorite drink, blueberry lemondrop. i love a dark bar and laszlo always has a cool vibe. it is one of the few places in the mish where you can sit outside and the people-watching on that part of the block is stellar.
author: sheila s.
